original: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs 'di ni rnam pa gsum kho na ste /
analyzed: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs 'di ni rnam pa gsum kho na ste /
translated: This logical argument of negation is of three types only:

original: dmigs su yod pa'i rgyu dang / khyab par byed pa dang rang gi bdag nyid de ltar nges par mi dmigs pa'i de ni 'gal ba la sogs pa ma rtogs pa dang rtogs pa'i sbyor ba dbye ba de dang de dag gis rnam pa du mar bshad do //
analyzed: dmigs su yod pa'i rgyu dang / khyab par byed pa dang rang gi bdag nyid de ltar nges par mi dmigs pa'i de ni 'gal ba la sogs pa ma rtogs pa dang rtogs pa'i sbyor ba dbye ba de dang de dag gis rnam pa du mar bshad do //
translated: the non-observation of a cause that is observable, the non-observation of a pervader, and the non-observation of itself. The non-observation of these is explained in many ways by the divisions of the applications of the non-observation of what is incompatible and so on, whether or not it is realized.

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa rnam par nges pa ste le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa rnam par nges pa ste le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter, called ‚ÄúAscertainment of Inference for Oneself.‚Äù

original: // / gzhan don rjes su dpag pa ni //
analyzed: // / gzhan don rjes su dpag pa ni //
translated: Inference for Others

original: rang gis mthong don rab gsal byed //
analyzed: rang gis mthong don rab gsal byed //
translated: Clearly reveals the meaning one has seen.

original: ji ltar rang nyid tshul gsum pa'i rtags las rtags can la shes pa skyes pa kho na ltar gzhan la rtags can gyi shes pa bskyed par 'dod pas tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes @187b su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rang nyid tshul gsum pa'i rtags las rtags can la shes pa skyes pa kho na ltar gzhan la rtags can gyi shes pa bskyed par 'dod pas tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes @187b su dpag pa ste /
translated: Just as one‚Äôs own knowledge of the property of the subject arises from a reason that is one of the three modes, so, wishing to generate in others the knowledge of the property of the subject, one teaches a reason that is one of the three modes. This is inference for the sake of others.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the cause is designated with the name of the result.

original: 'dir rang gis mthong don /
analyzed: 'dir rang gis mthong don /
translated: Here, the meaning one has seen is

original: zhes smos pa ni /üîΩlung las gzhan gyis mthong ba ni //üîΩsgrub min don med las kyang 'grub pa min //
analyzed: zhes smos pa ni / lung las gzhan gyis mthong ba ni // sgrub min don med las kyang 'grub pa min //
translated: This is statedüîΩbecause it is understood from scripture thatüîΩanother‚Äôs perception is not established

original: zhes shes par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes shes par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: and is meaningless.

original: ji ltar kha cig na re /
analyzed: ji ltar kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is to be understood by another,

original: rang gis mthong ba ma yin yang //
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba ma yin yang //
translated: it is not seen by oneself,

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: but it is established by another‚Äôs seeing.

original: dper na blo dang bde ba la sogs pa ni sems pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na blo dang bde ba la sogs pa ni sems pa med pa yin te /
translated: For example, it is said that mind, pleasure, etc. are not sentient,

original: skye ba can nam mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o zhes zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: skye ba can nam mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o zhes zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
translated: because they are produced or impermanent, like form, etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig gi tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig gi tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is illogical, because verbal valid knowledge is not the object of inference.

original: tshad ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshad ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were valid knowledge, inference would not engage,

original: tshig tsam gyis don grub pas gtan tshigs la sogs pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis don grub pas gtan tshigs la sogs pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning would be established by mere words, and reasons, etc. would be meaningless.

original: tshig gi khyad par tshad ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gi khyad par tshad ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: But there is no fault, because the special words are valid cognitions.

original: 'di la lung gi tshad ma bsam par bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la lung gi tshad ma bsam par bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that scripture is not valid cognition.

original: 'di la mi slu ba'i tshad ma med na khyad par 'ga' zhig yod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la mi slu ba'i tshad ma med na khyad par 'ga' zhig yod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no nondeceptive valid cognition, then there is no special status at all.

original: mi slu ba yod na ni des grub pa pha rol 'ga' zhig la grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi slu ba yod na ni des grub pa pha rol 'ga' zhig la grub pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is nondeception, then what is established by that is not established for some other opponent.

original: des na khas blangs nas brtag pa 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na khas blangs nas brtag pa 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that one engages in analysis after accepting something.

original: 'on kyang brtags nas khas len pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang brtags nas khas len pa yin te /
translated: Rather, one accepts something after analyzing it.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis khas blangs pas ni 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis khas blangs pas ni 'grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, one establishes something on the basis of what is accepted by others.

original: lung de la gnod par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la sgrub par byed pa brjod pa'i phyir de'i tshe 'di tshad ma ma yin pas de grub pa ni grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir de las 'grub pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: lung de la gnod par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la sgrub par byed pa brjod pa'i phyir de'i tshe 'di tshad ma ma yin pas de grub pa ni grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir de las 'grub pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If one states a proof to another in order to invalidate that scripture, then at that time it is not a valid cognition, and so what is established by it is not established. Therefore, how could one establish something on the basis of that?

original: lung de dang ldan pa la des 'grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lung de dang ldan pa la des 'grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that what is established is established for one who possesses that scripture,

original: gang gi lung gang yin /
analyzed: gang gi lung gang yin /
translated: whose scripture is it?

original: tshad mas gnod pa lung nyid du yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa lung nyid du yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How can a scripture that is contradicted by validating cognition be a scripture?

original: skye bo reng bur skyes gyur cing //
analyzed: skye bo reng bur skyes gyur cing //
translated: When a person is born as a child,

original: yon tan nyes pa ma mthong la //üîΩkye ma grub mtha' mi bzad pa'i //
analyzed: yon tan nyes pa ma mthong la // kye ma grub mtha' mi bzad pa'i //
translated: he does not see good qualities or faults.üîΩAlas! Who needs that demon,

original: gdon de su yis dgos pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: gdon de su yis dgos pa yin // zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: the unbearable theory of the non-Buddhist schools?

original: lung de nyid kyis de dang 'gal ba khas len par yang ji ltar 'gyur te /üîΩde @188a * //
analyzed: lung de nyid kyis de dang 'gal ba khas len par yang ji ltar 'gyur te / de @188a * //
translated: How can one accept a scripture that contradicts itself?

original: khas blangs nas spang ba'i yan lag gi lung tshad ma ma yin pas na rtogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdes khas blangs pa lung yin la /
analyzed: khas blangs nas spang ba'i yan lag gi lung tshad ma ma yin pas na rtogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro // des khas blangs pa lung yin la /
translated: Because, having accepted it, it is not suitable to understand it, since the scripture is not a validating cognition that is a part of the abandonment of that.üîΩThat which is accepted by it is scripture.

original: de las kyang sgrub par byed pa'i chos yin zhing /
analyzed: de las kyang sgrub par byed pa'i chos yin zhing /
translated: And from that, there is a property to be established.

original: de las ni dngos po 'jog pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de las ni dngos po 'jog pa'i phyir na /
translated: And from that, there is the establishment of a thing.

original: dngos po legs par rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po legs par rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, a thing is well-established.

original: skyes bus 'dod pas gtan tshigs dang der snang ba dag gis de nyid rnam par 'jog pa na /
analyzed: skyes bus 'dod pas gtan tshigs dang der snang ba dag gis de nyid rnam par 'jog pa na /
translated: When a person establishes reality by means of a reason and its appearance, which are desired,

original: da ni dngos po la gtan tshigs dang gtan tshigs ma yin pa yang ci yod de /
analyzed: da ni dngos po la gtan tshigs dang gtan tshigs ma yin pa yang ci yod de /
translated: Now, what is a logical argument and what is not a logical argument with respect to an existent thing?

original: de ni dngos po la 'jug par yang ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po la 'jug par yang ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not certain that it engages an existent thing.

original: yod pa'i don ni rtogs pa la ltos nas sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: yod pa'i don ni rtogs pa la ltos nas sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: An existent object is established in dependence on an understanding of it.

original: gang las gzhan gyis khas blangs pa tsam gyis 'grub par 'gyur ba med par rtogs pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las gzhan gyis khas blangs pa tsam gyis 'grub par 'gyur ba med par rtogs pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not established merely by the assertion of another, nor by mere understanding.

original: yod kyang dngos pos ma byas pa'i rtogs pa ni med par rtogs pa dang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod kyang dngos pos ma byas pa'i rtogs pa ni med par rtogs pa dang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if it exists, an understanding that is not produced by an existent thing is not different from an understanding of a non-existent thing.

original: yid ches pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ches pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not credible.

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i khyad par dag las rtogs pa'i yan lag gzhan ni med do zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i khyad par dag las rtogs pa'i yan lag gzhan ni med do zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that there is no other part of understanding than the three: effect, nature, and non-apprehension.

original: de dngos po la grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ji ltar bdag nyid lam grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dngos po la grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ji ltar bdag nyid lam grub par 'gyur /
translated: If that is the characteristic of the establishment of an existent thing, how can it be established by itself?

original: gzhan gyis ni pha rol yang rtogs par mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni pha rol yang rtogs par mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: It is not tenable that another understands the other.

original: gzhan gyis kun brtags pas thal ba bsgrub pa dper na du ma la yod pa'i gcig po ni yul la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kun brtags pas thal ba bsgrub pa dper na du ma la yod pa'i gcig po ni yul la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, the oneness that exists in many is not endowed with other distinctions such as objects, because

original: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par nges pa'i gsal ba gcig dang 'dres pas rnam par ma bcad pa rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par nges pa'i gsal ba gcig dang 'dres pas rnam par ma bcad pa rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is not differentiated by mixing with a single manifestation that is ascertained by distinctions of object, time, and occasion, because it is empty of other natures.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni yul la sogs pa tha dad pa can dang ldan par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni yul la sogs pa tha dad pa can dang ldan par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a nature is incompatible with being endowed with objects that have different distinctions.

original: zhes bya ba lta bu gang yin pa de ni chos gcig khas blangs na chos gzhan khas blangs par bstan pa'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu gang yin pa de ni chos gcig khas blangs na chos gzhan khas blangs par bstan pa'i phyir yin te /
translated: This is because if one phenomenon is accepted, the other phenomenon is taught to be accepted.

original: de khas mi len na ni chos gnyi ga ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de khas mi len na ni chos gnyi ga ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not accept that, both phenomena are refuted.

original: rnam par dbye bar bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par dbye bar bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is impossible to divide it.

original: de ni gzhan du de lta yang dngos su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhan du de lta yang dngos su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is directly related to that in another way.

original: da ni ji ltar mi srid pa'i don grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar mi srid pa'i don grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, how can the meaning of impossibility be established?

original: gang zhig @188b mi srid pas khyab pa de yang de la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig @188b mi srid pas khyab pa de yang de la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is pervaded by impossibility is also impossible there.

original: de khas len na gzhan gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: de khas len na gzhan gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bzlog par dka'o //
translated: If one accepts that, it is difficult to reverse because the other is certainly the case.

original: de lta na yang rang gis khas blangs pa gzhan du gnas pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / dam bcas pa la khas blangs pa la sogs pas gnod pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rang gis khas blangs pa gzhan du gnas pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / dam bcas pa la khas blangs pa la sogs pas gnod pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Even so, is it not the case that the reason is not established because of the contradiction of one's own assertion with the other, and that the thesis is undermined by the contradiction of one's own assertion and so on?

original: brtag pa'i dus na 'ga' yang khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtag pa'i dus na 'ga' yang khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because at the time of analysis, there is no assertion at all.

original: don gang rtogs par byed pa des ni de rtogs pa'i shugs kyis 'ongs ba'i don gzhan yang khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: don gang rtogs par byed pa des ni de rtogs pa'i shugs kyis 'ongs ba'i don gzhan yang khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: By the one who realizes the meaning, that meaning which is implied by the force of realizing that is also asserted.

original: 'od khas blangs na sgron ma khas blangs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'od khas blangs na sgron ma khas blangs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like when light is asserted, the lamp is asserted.

original: de'i phyir de ni rtogs pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rtogs pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, that is just the realization.

original: lta ba gzhan du gnas pas skyon brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba gzhan du gnas pas skyon brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The fault is not stated by abiding in another view.

original: de ni de'i khas len pa'i dus yin pas der don ji snyed rigs pa'i stobs kyis nye bar gnas pa de mtha' dag khas blang par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ni de'i khas len pa'i dus yin pas der don ji snyed rigs pa'i stobs kyis nye bar gnas pa de mtha' dag khas blang par bya ba'am /
translated: Since it is the time of accepting that, one must accept all the objects that are present by the power of reasoning.

original: yang na ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: Or else, none at all.

original: de ma grub pa la sogs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma grub pa la sogs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that it is not established, etc.

original: gal te de ltar yin na 'di yang 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na 'di yang 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it were so, then this would also be so,üîΩor else neither would be so.

original: ma yin na ni gnyi ga yang mi 'gyur ro zhes chos gnyis 'brel ba nye bar ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin na ni gnyi ga yang mi 'gyur ro zhes chos gnyis 'brel ba nye bar ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it teaches that the two properties are related.

original: nges pa nyid du yongs su 'dzin pa skyon 'dir 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: nges pa nyid du yongs su 'dzin pa skyon 'dir 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If one definitely holds that, this fault would arise.

original: gtan tshigs yod na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs yod na ni ma yin no //
translated: But not if there is a reason.

original: rigs pas thob pa ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pas thob pa ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is obtained by reasoning is certainly fit to be accepted.

original: khas blangs pas rigs pa la gnod par mi nus so zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: khas blangs pas rigs pa la gnod par mi nus so zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: It should be explained that what is accepted cannot contradict reasoning.

original: chos gcig khas len pas gdon mi za bar gzhan khas blangs pa ni rigs pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gcig khas len pas gdon mi za bar gzhan khas blangs pa ni rigs pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is done by reasoning that one must accept the other when one accepts one property.

original: gtan tshigs med kyang 'di ni rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gtan tshigs med kyang 'di ni rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa yin gyi /
translated: Although there is no reason, this is the way to establish the pervasion and the pervaded in the basic reason.

original: bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the way to establish the opposite.

original: gtan tshigs la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition in the reason.

original: gal te 'dir yang bzlog pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid dang skye ba dang ldan pa 'gog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir yang bzlog pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid dang skye ba dang ldan pa 'gog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that here also the opposite itself refutes impermanence and that which possesses arising,

original: de ltar byed pa ni su yang med do //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa ni su yang med do //
translated: no one does it that way.

original: de ltar byed par nus pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar byed par nus pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible to do it that way,

original: sems pa can dang de gnyis 'gal ba ma @189a * //
analyzed: sems pa can dang de gnyis 'gal ba ma @189a * //
translated: because the mind and those two are not established as contradictory.

original: grub pas thal ba dang bzlog pa'i sgrub par byed pa dag go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pas thal ba dang bzlog pa'i sgrub par byed pa dag go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the reductio and the opposite reason are not understood to be proofs.

original: sngar rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can 'byung ba las gcig yod pas med pa'i phyir ram phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal bar rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: sngar rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can 'byung ba las gcig yod pas med pa'i phyir ram phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal bar rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If one understands that the effect does not exist because the cause is incomplete, or if one understands that the cause is mutually exclusive with the effect,

original: skye ba can dang mi rtag pa dag dang sems pa yod pa la ni de grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba can dang mi rtag pa dag dang sems pa yod pa la ni de grub pa ma yin no //
translated: then the existence of the effect and the nonexistence of the effect are mutually exclusive. But this is not established for those who believe in arising and impermanence, or in the existence of consciousness.

original: gcig la ni ji skad bshad pa'i rang bzhin gzhan dang bral bar khas blangs pa kho na'i phyir yul la sogs pa tha dad pa can dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la ni ji skad bshad pa'i rang bzhin gzhan dang bral bar khas blangs pa kho na'i phyir yul la sogs pa tha dad pa can dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the case of a single entity, it is not possible to have a difference of object, etc., because it is accepted that it is devoid of another nature, as has been explained.

original: de med pa dang de yod pa ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa dang de yod pa ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nonexistence of that and the existence of that are mutually exclusive, because they are characterized by the exclusion of one from the other.

original: slob dpon dag gis kyang yan lag can dgag pa la sogs pa rnams su don 'di nyid rnam pa du ma'i sgo nas nye bar bkod pas rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin 'gog par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon dag gis kyang yan lag can dgag pa la sogs pa rnams su don 'di nyid rnam pa du ma'i sgo nas nye bar bkod pas rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin 'gog par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: The masters have also set forth this very point in many ways in their refutations of wholes, etc., and they have refuted the existence of such natures.

original: gcig nyid dang du ma yod pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid dang du ma yod pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for one to be many.

original: gzhan dag ni gcig khas blangs pa btang ba med na med pa'i phyir chos gnyis ka yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gcig khas blangs pa btang ba med na med pa'i phyir chos gnyis ka yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Others say: The two attributes do not exist because the one that is accepted is not relinquished.

original: grub pa'i mtha' khas len pa'i rgyu mtshan dpyad pa'i skabs su bab pa'i tshe yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' khas len pa'i rgyu mtshan dpyad pa'i skabs su bab pa'i tshe yin te /
translated: It is when the occasion of analyzing the reason for accepting tenets has arrived.

original: de lta ma yin na ni khas blangs nas rnam par dpyod pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni khas blangs nas rnam par dpyod pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be untenable to analyze after accepting.

original: don med par rtog pa sgro btags pa yang rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don med par rtog pa sgro btags pa yang rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, superimposition is not permanent, because it is a conception of a nonexistent object.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag pa'am mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag pa'am mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: For example, sound is impermanent or sound is impermanent,

original: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //üîΩ'dir dngos po la ni sgra dang bum pa gnyis sam /
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o // 'dir dngos po la ni sgra dang bum pa gnyis sam /
translated: because it is either one or the other of the similar and dissimilar classes.

original: sgra dang nam mkha' gnyis nye bar yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra dang nam mkha' gnyis nye bar yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, sound and a pot or sound and space are not present as two things.

original: 'on kyang smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pas byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pas byas pa yin te /
translated: However, they are made by the speaker‚Äôs wish to express.

original: de med na brjod par 'dod pa dang cig shos dag gis nye ba dang bskal pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na brjod par 'dod pa dang cig shos dag gis nye ba dang bskal pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it does not exist, then the one who desires to express it and the other are not in proximity or separation.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin yin na ni yang gzhan du brjod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin yin na ni yang gzhan du brjod par 'dod pas /
translated: If it were the nature of an entity, then it would not be tenable to express it as something else,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / gcig la cig car yon tan 'gal ba bsdu ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / gcig la cig car yon tan 'gal ba bsdu ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable for a single thing to possess contradictory qualities simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir chos 'di dag ni byed pa po'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa yin @189b gyi ;
analyzed: de'i phyir chos 'di dag ni byed pa po'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa yin @189b gyi ;
translated: Therefore these phenomena follow the desire of the agent,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but they do not follow the nature of an entity.

original: de ni de ltar mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de ltar mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not engage in that way.

original: de'i phyir de las ni don mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las ni don mi 'grub ste /
translated: Therefore, an object is not established from that,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin dag nye ba dang bskal par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin dag nye ba dang bskal par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the proximity or separation of the nature of an entity is not established.

original: grub na ni 'gyur te /
analyzed: grub na ni 'gyur te /
translated: If it were established, it would be like this.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig tu de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi chos mthun pa mthong nas gong bu 'di ni rva can yin te /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig tu de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi chos mthun pa mthong nas gong bu 'di ni rva can yin te /
translated: For example, if one sees a similar nature in some cases, one says, ‚ÄúThis lump is horned,‚Äù

original: ba lang dang ba min gang yang rung ba zhig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang dang ba min gang yang rung ba zhig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is either a cow or not a cow.

original: ci ste yang ngas de ltar brjod par 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste yang ngas de ltar brjod par 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúI want to say it that way,‚Äù

original: zhes smras pa de'i tshe don gyis stong pa'i brjod par 'dod pa tsam zhig 'grub kyi /
analyzed: zhes smras pa de'i tshe don gyis stong pa'i brjod par 'dod pa tsam zhig 'grub kyi /
translated: then the mere desire to say something that is empty of meaning is established.

original: de las don 'grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las don 'grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But from that, the meaning is not established.

original: de'i 'dod pa ni dngos po la 'jug par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa ni dngos po la 'jug par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no certainty that his desire engages with the thing.

original: 'di ltar gang la de'i 'dod pa yod pa der dngos po yod pa yin no zhes de ltar ni blta bar nus pa ma yin pas khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'dis ni ngas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la de'i 'dod pa yod pa der dngos po yod pa yin no zhes de ltar ni blta bar nus pa ma yin pas khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ro // 'dis ni ngas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not possible to see it like this: ‚ÄúIf his desire exists for that, then the thing exists.‚Äù Therefore, because the pervasion is not established, there is error.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba dang / lung las grub pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba dang / lung las grub pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the application of the reason, ‚ÄúBecause I have taken it,‚Äù and so on, and the establishment from scripture.

original: tshig ni smra ba po'i 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig ni smra ba po'i 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the words engage by the mere desire of the speaker.

original: rtog dang lung dag byed pa po'i //
analyzed: rtog dang lung dag byed pa po'i //
translated: The desire of the one who speaks, the scriptures, and the reasonings,

original: 'dod pa tsam dang rjes 'brel dang // dngos po la yang srid pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam dang rjes 'brel dang // dngos po la yang srid pa'i phyir //
translated: are related to mere desire, and are possible in regard to things,

original: des byas pa ni 'khrul ba yin //
analyzed: des byas pa ni 'khrul ba yin //
translated: therefore, the one who is confused by them is mistaken.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is the summary verse.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags bstan par byed pa gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags bstan par byed pa gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The statement of the reason having the three modes is inference for the sake of others,

original: don gyis na phyogs kyi tshig ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don gyis na phyogs kyi tshig ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: therefore, the words of the proposition are not the proof, it should be understood that this is the meaning.

original: ji ltar sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: How are they not the proof?

original: zhe na / dngos sam ba rgyud pas de la grub pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //üîΩre zhig dngos su ni don gyi don rtog phyir don la //
analyzed: zhe na / dngos sam ba rgyud pas de la grub pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro // re zhig dngos su ni don gyi don rtog phyir don la //
translated: Because the understanding of the proposition does not arise from them, either directly or indirectly.üîΩFirst, directly, the words of the proposition cannot express the meaning of the proposition,

original: phyogs dang gtan tshigs brjod nus med //üîΩdes na de dag rang nyid las //
analyzed: phyogs dang gtan tshigs brjod nus med // des na de dag rang nyid las //
translated: because the meaning of the proposition is understood through the reason and example.

original: sgrub par byed pa gnas ma yin //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa gnas ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the words of the proposition do not remain as the proof.

original: don nyid kyis don go bar byed de /
analyzed: don nyid kyis don go bar byed de /
translated: The meaning itself makes the meaning understood,

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no mistake.

original: brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not stated.

original: 'brel ba nges pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba nges pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no certainty of connection.

original: @190a * // des na phyogs dang gtan tshigs kyi tshig rang nyid kyis don grub pa'i phyir ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @190a * // des na phyogs dang gtan tshigs kyi tshig rang nyid kyis don grub pa'i phyir ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the words of the thesis and reason are established by themselves, they are not proof.

original: phyogs kyi tshig las ni don la the tshom za bar mthong gi /üîΩnges pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi tshig las ni don la the tshom za bar mthong gi / nges pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From the words of the thesis, the meaning is seen to be doubtful,üîΩbut not certain.

original: dngos su sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos su sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not actual proof.

original: bsgrub bya brjod phyir phyogs kyi tshig / brgyud pa yis kyang nus pa med //üîΩgtan tshigs brjod pa rang nyid la //
analyzed: bsgrub bya brjod phyir phyogs kyi tshig / brgyud pa yis kyang nus pa med // gtan tshigs brjod pa rang nyid la //
translated: The words of the thesis are not capable of proving the probandum, even indirectly.üîΩThe words of the reason

original: nus pa med kyang nus ston byed //
analyzed: nus pa med kyang nus ston byed //
translated: are not capable by themselves, but they indicate the capability.

original: brgyud pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: brgyud pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: They are not even indirectly capable,

original: bsgrub par bya ba brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they state the probandum.

original: gtan tshigs kyi tshig ni rang nyid nus pa med kyang nus pa brjod par bya ba yin phyir nye bar btags nas sgrub par byed pa 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi tshig ni rang nyid nus pa med kyang nus pa brjod par bya ba yin phyir nye bar btags nas sgrub par byed pa 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Although the words of the reason are not capable by themselves, they are accepted as proof by implication, because they indicate the capability.

original: de las gtan tshigs kyi tshigs su 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de las gtan tshigs kyi tshigs su 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: because the statement of the reason is based on that.

original: de yang nus pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de yang nus pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: And that is the capacity.

original: the tshom las shes par 'dod pa dang / skabs 'jug pa'i phyir de dag las thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom las shes par 'dod pa dang / skabs 'jug pa'i phyir de dag las thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you maintain that knowledge is from doubt, then it would follow from those two, because of the desire to know and the engagement in the occasion.

original: mi mthun pa'i tshig tsam las kyang the tshom za bas gnyen po gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug pas srid pa'i phyir de yang de dang lhan cig sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i tshig tsam las kyang the tshom za bas gnyen po gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug pas srid pa'i phyir de yang de dang lhan cig sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of the possibility of doubt from mere incompatible words, the statement of the reason as the antidote would engage, and so that would also be the proof.

original: de'i phyir nang gi yan lag gi don 'grub pa'i nus pa ni tshul gsum nyid la gnas pa yin la ;
analyzed: de'i phyir nang gi yan lag gi don 'grub pa'i nus pa ni tshul gsum nyid la gnas pa yin la ;
translated: Therefore, the capacity to establish the meaning of the internal member rests on the three modes.

original: de la dran pa 'jog par byed pa ni de'i tshig la gnas pa'i phyir /üîΩde nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dran pa 'jog par byed pa ni de'i tshig la gnas pa'i phyir / de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: And the statement of the reason is the proof, because it is based on the words of that.

original: yul ma bstan na gtan tshigs 'jug pa mi srid pas yul ston pa nyid kyis nus pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul ma bstan na gtan tshigs 'jug pa mi srid pas yul ston pa nyid kyis nus pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the statement of the reason is the capacity because it is impossible for the reason to engage without the object being stated, then the statement of the object itself is the capacity.

original: 'di la bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: gzhan yang de med kyang gang cung zad byas pa de thams cad ni mi rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang de med kyang gang cung zad byas pa de thams cad ni mi rtag pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, even if that is not the case, all that is produced is impermanent.üîΩAnd sound is produced.

original: sgra yang byas pa yin no zhes brjod pas kyang sgra mi rtag pa'o zhes don gyis go ba nyid do //
analyzed: sgra yang byas pa yin no zhes brjod pas kyang sgra mi rtag pa'o zhes don gyis go ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is understood by implication that sound is impermanent.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni gdon mi za bar bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni gdon mi za bar bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this must be stated.

original: des na phyogs ni ma brjod kyang 'grub pa la gegs med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na phyogs ni ma brjod kyang 'grub pa la gegs med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, even though the position is not stated, since there is no impediment to establishing the thesis,

original: gsum las tshul gang yang rung ba zhig ma smras na sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum las tshul gang yang rung ba zhig ma smras na sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that if any of the three modes is not stated, the fault of the thesis being incomplete is incurred.

original: 'o na da ni sgrub par byed pa de bstan pa med na med pa ma yin pa'i phyir phyogs kyi mtshan nyid brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na da ni sgrub par byed pa de bstan pa med na med pa ma yin pa'i phyir phyogs kyi mtshan nyid brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: Now, if the proof is not stated, since it does not exist without it, the definition of the position should not be stated.

original: @190b brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: @190b brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: It should be stated,

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa la phyin ci log tu log par rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa la phyin ci log tu log par rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is seen that there is mistaken understanding of what is to be established and what is not to be established.

original: de bzlog pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i don du yin no //
translated: and it is for the purpose of refuting that that the reason is stated.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba de yang /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba de yang /
translated: And that which is to be inferred

original: ngo bo kho nar bstan par bya //
analyzed: ngo bo kho nar bstan par bya //
translated: is taught just in terms of its own nature,

original: rang nyid 'dod dang ma bsal ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid 'dod dang ma bsal ba'o //
translated: not being refuted by what is accepted by oneself.

original: 'dir rang gi ngo bo dang / tshig phrad dang / 'dod pa dang / rang nyid kyi tshig bzhis /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi ngo bo dang / tshig phrad dang / 'dod pa dang / rang nyid kyi tshig bzhis /
translated: Here, by means of its own nature, by means of the words, by means of what is accepted, and by means of its own words,

original: ma grub sgrub byed min don brjod //
analyzed: ma grub sgrub byed min don brjod //
translated: the unestablished is not established, and the meaning is stated.

original: rgol bas khas blangs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: rgol bas khas blangs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The opponent's acceptance is taken.

original: zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus it should be known.

original: des na grub pa dper na sgra ni mnyan par bya ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / ma grub kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa dper na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang / dpe dag dang / skabs kyi rten ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: des na grub pa dper na sgra ni mnyan par bya ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / ma grub kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa dper na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang / dpe dag dang / skabs kyi rten ma yin pa dang /
translated: Therefore, the established, for example, Sound is audible, and the unestablished, but accepted as the means of establishing, for example, the unestablished reason and example, and the non-basis of the context,

original: bstan bcos khas blangs kyang med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa rgol ba'i khas blangs pa ma yin pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos khas blangs kyang med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa rgol ba'i khas blangs pa ma yin pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: and the treatise, even though accepted, are not the unarisen non-existence, and the opponent's acceptance is refuted.

original: da ni ji ltar ma thos na bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa yin no zhes rtogs she na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar ma thos na bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa yin no zhes rtogs she na /
translated: Now, how can it be understood that what is not heard is accepted as the probandum?

original: skabs kyis so //
analyzed: skabs kyis so //
translated: By context.

original: dper na 'dus pa rnams gzhan gyi don yin par grub pa na bdag gi don nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dus pa rnams gzhan gyi don yin par grub pa na bdag gi don nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, when the collection is established as the object of another, it is like the object of self.

original: de ni ma smras su zin kyang 'dod pas khyab pa'i bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni ma smras su zin kyang 'dod pas khyab pa'i bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa smos so //
translated: Even though that is not stated, it is stated because it is accepted as the probandum pervaded by that.

original: de nyid ltos pa las chos dang chos can gyi khyad par du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ltos pa las chos dang chos can gyi khyad par du bshad pa yin te /
translated: That itself is explained as the distinction of property and subject based on dependence.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus pa ma yin pa'i yul can gzhan gyi don yin no zhes brjod pas na /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus pa ma yin pa'i yul can gzhan gyi don yin no zhes brjod pas na /
translated: Since it is said that these are the objects of the non-collection, which is the object of another,

original: chos kyi khyad par du nye bar gzung ba'i phyir de de'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi khyad par du nye bar gzung ba'i phyir de de'i khyad par yin no //
translated: it is the distinction of that because it is taken as the distinction of the property.

original: mig la sogs pa 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don dag ni //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don dag ni //
translated: The objects of the non-collection of eye and so on

original: gzhan gyi don du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni chos can gyis khyad par yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni chos can gyis khyad par yin no //
translated: are the object of another. This is the distinction of the subject.

original: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa tsam zhig tha dad par zad kyi don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa tsam zhig tha dad par zad kyi don ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the only difference is in the mere presentation, not in the meaning.

original: khyad par du gyur pa'i bsgrub bar bya ba skabs su bab pa las don gzhan yin /
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa'i bsgrub bar bya ba skabs su bab pa las don gzhan yin /
translated: The probandum is not something different from the subject.

original: gang gis de ltar smras pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos kyis pan par 'gyur ba 'brel pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: gang gis de ltar smras pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos kyis pan par 'gyur ba 'brel pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: What connection is there between the probandum and the reason, since the probandum is not established by the reason?

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta yin dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba dang dpe sgrub par byed pas stong @191a * //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de lta yin dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba dang dpe sgrub par byed pas stong @191a * //
translated: Because it would lead to absurdity.

original: par 'gyur te /
analyzed: par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the reason would be contradictory and the example would be devoid of the probandum.

original: chos kyi tshogs de nyid ni 'gar yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi tshogs de nyid ni 'gar yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that collection of properties is never concomitant.

original: de'i phyir gang las kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang las kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would not be understood from anywhere.

original: smras pa'i chos rjes su 'gro ba med na skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: smras pa'i chos rjes su 'gro ba med na skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the stated property is not concomitant, this fault would occur,

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not for others.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du khyab par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du khyab par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the probandum is not pervaded by the subject.

original: skyon med na ni 'dod pa la gnod pa byed par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyon med na ni 'dod pa la gnod pa byed par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no fault, then the thesis would not be harmed.

original: de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la 'jug pas de las bzlog pa bsgrub pa mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la 'jug pas de las bzlog pa bsgrub pa mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason is the very opposite of the probandum, and the definition of the reason is that it is the opposite of that.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i chos dang chos can gyi khyad par la ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i chos dang chos can gyi khyad par la ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: The fault of non-pervasion is accepted in regard to the property and property-possessor as they have been explained.

original: ji skad du bdag gzhan yin no zhe na ni de ma grub po zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bdag gzhan yin no zhe na ni de ma grub po zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: As it was said, ‚ÄúIf it is said that the self is different from the aggregates, that is not established.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba'i chos kyang 'dod pa de nyid la gnod par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos kyang 'dod pa de nyid la gnod par byas pa yin no //
translated: The property of contradiction is also accepted as harming that very thesis.

original: ma brjod pa'i phyir de yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma brjod pa'i phyir de yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is not the probandum because it is not stated,

original: gal te gang la rtsod pas sgrub par byed pa bkod pa de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin na bsgrub par bya ba ci yin /
analyzed: gal te gang la rtsod pas sgrub par byed pa bkod pa de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin na bsgrub par bya ba ci yin /
translated: then if the thesis is not the probandum because it is the object of dispute and the statement of the proof, what is the probandum?

original: de lta yin na phyin ci log tu grub pa'am don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na phyin ci log tu grub pa'am don med par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, it would be established in a distorted way or it would be pointless.

original: dper na sgra'i ngo bo ni ming can dang 'brel pa'i sngon rol nas don dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na sgra'i ngo bo ni ming can dang 'brel pa'i sngon rol nas don dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: For example, it might be argued: ‚ÄúThe nature of sound is meaningful prior to its relation with a name,üîΩbecause it is seen to have a division.‚Äù

original: rnam par dbye ba dang ldan par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis don dang ldan par ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba dang ldan par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis don dang ldan par ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: But it is not to be established that it is meaningful by its mere nature,

original: don dang ldan par yang mthong ba de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don dang ldan pa nyid mi 'dod pa grub par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: don dang ldan par yang mthong ba de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don dang ldan pa nyid mi 'dod pa grub par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: and because it is seen to be meaningful, it is established that it is not accepted to be meaningful in terms of an external object.

original: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
translated: Similarly, it might be argued: ‚ÄúThe eyes and so on are for the sake of another,

original: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: because they are a collection.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi don tsam khyad par med par grub kyang bdag gi don ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don tsam khyad par med par grub kyang bdag gi don ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Although it is established that they are for the sake of another without distinction, they are not for the sake of the self.

original: de dag 'dus pa gzhan gyi don byed par ni khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa gzhan gyi don byed par ni khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is accepted that their collection is for the sake of another,

original: sgrub par byed pa 'bras bu med pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa 'bras bu med pa yin no //
translated: the proof is pointless.

original: de phyir ma smras kyang 'dod pas khyab pa ni bsgrub par bya ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de phyir ma smras kyang 'dod pas khyab pa ni bsgrub par bya ba yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, although not stated, it is the thesis that the subject is pervaded by the reason.

original: de ma tshang ba la sogs pa yang dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma tshang ba la sogs pa yang dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: And the non-establishment of the reason and so on are faults in the example that is empty of the probandum.

original: 'dis ni gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba rnams la yang @191b rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i nyes pa bshad pa yin te /üîΩdper na bum pa ni mngon par gsal ba'i sems pa can lus kyi mtshan nyid kyi skyes bu dang bum pa gang yang rung bas /
analyzed: 'dis ni gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba rnams la yang @191b rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i nyes pa bshad pa yin te / dper na bum pa ni mngon par gsal ba'i sems pa can lus kyi mtshan nyid kyi skyes bu dang bum pa gang yang rung bas /
translated: This also explains the fault of non-pervasion in syllogisms that have a second part.

original: gnyis pa dang bcas pas yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa dang bcas pas yin te /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúThe subject, pot, is with a second part because of being a mental object of manifest cognition, like either a person with the characteristics of a body or a pot.‚ÄùüîΩHere, the example is not established as having a second part by either a person with the characteristics of a body or a pot.

original: autpala ma yin pa'i phyir rtsig pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: autpala ma yin pa'i phyir rtsig pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, ‚ÄúThe subject, wall, is with a second part because of not being an utpala flower, like a pot.‚Äù

original: rtsig pa ni de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bus gnyis pa dang bcas pa ma grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsig pa ni de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bus gnyis pa dang bcas pa ma grub pa bzhin no //
translated: Here, the wall is not established as having a second part by a person who is like that.

original: 'on te spyi bsgrub par bya ba 'dod pa'i phyir khyad par 'phen pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi bsgrub par bya ba 'dod pa'i phyir khyad par 'phen pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you assert that the general is the probandum, then the particular is not being projected.

original: 'di la ni de mi 'phen na sgrub par byed pa'i 'bras bu ci yin /
analyzed: 'di la ni de mi 'phen na sgrub par byed pa'i 'bras bu ci yin /
translated: If it does not impel that, then what is the result of the proof?

original: yang na ni mi 'dod par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: yang na ni mi 'dod par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Or else, it would be unacceptable.

original: gal te sgrub par byed pas yul du byas pa ma yin na ji ltar des de 'grub /
analyzed: gal te sgrub par byed pas yul du byas pa ma yin na ji ltar des de 'grub /
translated: If it is not an object of the proof, then how can it be established by that?

original: 'grub na yang ji ltar yul ma yin /
analyzed: 'grub na yang ji ltar yul ma yin /
translated: And if it is established, then how can it not be an object?

original: yul yin no zhe na ni rang la brten pa'i nyes pa'i rnam pas ji ltar ma reg par 'gyur /
analyzed: yul yin no zhe na ni rang la brten pa'i nyes pa'i rnam pas ji ltar ma reg par 'gyur /
translated: If it is an object, then how can it not be touched by the faults that are based on it?

original: des de la brten pa'i sgrub par byed pa las rnyed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: des de la brten pa'i sgrub par byed pa las rnyed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: It is found by the proof that is based on it,

original: gzhan sun 'byin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gsal bar rgyal po'i gra sa'i rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sun 'byin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gsal bar rgyal po'i gra sa'i rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: and not by refuting something else. This is the clear presentation of the king‚Äôs court.

original: des na grub pa 'phen pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i nus pas khyab pa'i don gyis rnam pa ji snyed pa de thams cad ni sun 'byin pas kyang yin no //
analyzed: des na grub pa 'phen pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i nus pas khyab pa'i don gyis rnam pa ji snyed pa de thams cad ni sun 'byin pas kyang yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the proof impels, the meaning of the pervasion by the power of the proof is that all the aspects are also refutations.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i lus bum pa las don gzhan gyi ngo bor khas mi len na spyi sgrub pa yang mi srid de /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i lus bum pa las don gzhan gyi ngo bor khas mi len na spyi sgrub pa yang mi srid de /
translated: If you do not accept that the body is an entity that is different from the pot, then it is impossible to establish the general characteristic,

original: gang yang rung ba'i don gzhan gyi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i don gzhan gyi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no entity that is different from any other.

original: gnyi ga de lta bu'i dngos por srid na gang yang rung ba brjod par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga de lta bu'i dngos por srid na gang yang rung ba brjod par nus pa yin te /
translated: If both are possible as entities, then it is possible to say that either one is the case,

original: dper na lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin gang yang rung ba zhig pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin gyi //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin gang yang rung ba zhig pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin gyi //
translated: just as in the case of saying that either Devadatta or Yaj√±adatta is coming.

original: gang yang rung ba gcig za mi srid pa'am 'dod pa med na ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba gcig za mi srid pa'am 'dod pa med na ma yin no //
translated: But if it is impossible or undesirable to say that either one is the case, then that is not so.

original: 'di las kyang gang yang rung ba don gzhan gyi ngo bo med pa yin te bum pa rang nyid kyis don gzhan gyi ngo bor khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las kyang gang yang rung ba don gzhan gyi ngo bo med pa yin te bum pa rang nyid kyis don gzhan gyi ngo bor khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And in this case, it is not possible to say that either one is the case, because the pot does not accept that it is an entity that is different from itself, and because that is contradictory.

original: shugs kyis lus nyid kyi don gzhan du gyur ba yin no zhes ngag gi don du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba zhes smos pa ni don med do //
analyzed: shugs kyis lus nyid kyi don gzhan du gyur ba yin no zhes ngag gi don du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba zhes smos pa ni don med do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the sentence is that the body itself is the meaning of something else, and since it is established as the meaning of the sentence, it is meaningless to say ‚Äúsomething else.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na tshig 'di 'gal @192a * //üîΩpar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshig 'di 'gal @192a * // par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, the sentence would be contradictory.

original: bum pa bdag nyid ni de ma yin pa don gzhan gyi ngo bor 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa bdag nyid ni de ma yin pa don gzhan gyi ngo bor 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for a pot to be the entity of something else, which is not itself.

original: gal te lus nyid kyis don gzhan gyi ngo bo yin na ni de nyid de skad du brjod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te lus nyid kyis don gzhan gyi ngo bo yin na ni de nyid de skad du brjod par 'gyur na /
translated: If the body itself were the entity of something else, then that would be stated,

original: gang yang rung ba smos pa'i shugs kyis bum pa yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba smos pa'i shugs kyis bum pa yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
translated: but since it is stated that ‚Äúsomething else‚Äù is so, it is contradictory because the pot would be so by the force of the statement.

original: 'di'i phyir yang spyi la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang spyi la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: For this reason also, it is not based on universals,

original: gsal ba thams cad yod par mi srid na de'i spyi mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdper na bram ze la sogs pa ma yin pa nyid la rig nyid dam /
analyzed: gsal ba thams cad yod par mi srid na de'i spyi mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // dper na bram ze la sogs pa ma yin pa nyid la rig nyid dam /
translated: because it is not tenable that a universal exists when all instances do not exist.

original: rtog pa'i shes pa la dbang po la brten pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa la dbang po la brten pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the fact that the state of being a non-brahmin is not the state of being a brahmin, or the fact that a conceptual consciousness is not based on the sense faculties.

original: 'di ltar de mig la brten pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de mig la brten pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the universal does not depend on the eye,

original: de'i shes pa bzhin du de'i don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir dang / de 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir dang / de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i shes pa bzhin du de'i don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir dang / de 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir dang / de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not perceived when the object is perceived, because it does not follow the changes in the eye, and because it exists even when the eye does not exist.

original: de bzhin du snang ba la sogs pa la log pa las byung ba yang ma yin pa'i dbang po la brten pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du snang ba la sogs pa la log pa las byung ba yang ma yin pa'i dbang po la brten pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, the universal does not depend on the sense faculty, because it is not a product of error.

original: de bzhin du de gnyis de ltar khas len na bum pa dang lus dag las gang yang rung ba'i don gzhan du gyur pa zhes spyir gang yang rung ba'i don gzhan gyi ngo bo 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du de gnyis de ltar khas len na bum pa dang lus dag las gang yang rung ba'i don gzhan du gyur pa zhes spyir gang yang rung ba'i don gzhan gyi ngo bo 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If you accept that the universal is like this, then either the universal is the same as the object, such as a pot or a body, or the universal is a different object.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: But this is not so.

original: lus rjes su 'gro ba med par dogs pa bum pa dang yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus rjes su 'gro ba med par dogs pa bum pa dang yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal is not the same as the pot, and because the universal is not different from the pot.

original: de'i phyir yang spyi srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang spyi srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the universal does not exist.

original: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin dag las gang yang rung ba gcig la zas sbyin par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin dag las gang yang rung ba gcig la zas sbyin par bya ba yin te /
translated: If Devadatta and Yajnadatta are eating, then either one of them is Devadatta, or both of them are Devadatta.

original: lha sbyin la ma yin zhing mchod sbyin la ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di lta bu yod pa srid dam /
analyzed: lha sbyin la ma yin zhing mchod sbyin la ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di lta bu yod pa srid dam /
translated: Is it possible to say, ‚ÄúIt is not Devadatta, it is not Yaj√±adatta‚Äù?

original: lha sbyin 'ba' zhig la ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: lha sbyin 'ba' zhig la ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: There is no error, because it is thought that it is not Devadatta alone.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gang yang rung ba smos pa nyid kyis thal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba smos pa nyid kyis thal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the absurd consequence does not occur when one or the other is mentioned.

original: de'i phyir gcig yongs su gzung yang mi 'gal ba yin na gang yang rung ba smos pa 'di nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig yongs su gzung yang mi 'gal ba yin na gang yang rung ba smos pa 'di nus par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if there is no contradiction in apprehending one, then this mention of one or the other would be possible,

original: dper na gcig za yang gang yang rung ba za'o zhes brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gcig za yang gang yang rung ba za'o zhes brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: just as when one eats, it is said that one or the other eats.

original: 'di'i yul ni rnam par brtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i yul ni rnam par brtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of this is a conceptual distinction.

original: de la bum pa kho na'am lus kho nas gnyis pa dang bcas par ni mi @192b 'dod do //
analyzed: de la bum pa kho na'am lus kho nas gnyis pa dang bcas par ni mi @192b 'dod do //
translated: It is not maintained that the second is associated with only a pot or only a body.

original: sgrub pa mi 'thad pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: sgrub pa mi 'thad pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: Also, because the proof is untenable.

original: gnyis gcig la bsgrub pa la yang rnam par brtag pa dang bsdu ba yang mi 'thad pa yin na da ci zhig sgrub par nus te /
analyzed: gnyis gcig la bsgrub pa la yang rnam par brtag pa dang bsdu ba yang mi 'thad pa yin na da ci zhig sgrub par nus te /
translated: If the proof of one in two is untenable, then since conceptual distinction and inclusion are also untenable, what can be proven?

original: de'i phyir tshig gi tshul ni gsog yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gi tshul ni gsog yin no //
translated: Therefore, the method of expression is faulty.

original: 'dis ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba nyid kyang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba nyid kyang gsal ba yin no //
translated: This also makes clear that the reason is indeterminate, since it is present in both the similar and the dissimilar instances.

original: gzhan yang gnyi gar yang srid pa mi 'gal na de de ltar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnyi gar yang srid pa mi 'gal na de de ltar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Moreover, if it were not contradictory for the reason to be present in both the similar and dissimilar instances, then the reason would be established as present in the similar instances alone.

original: de lta ma yin na ni de sgra la ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni de sgra la ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: But since that is not the case, the reason is not established as present in the similar instances.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa de lta bu'i sgra de ni phyogs nyid yin te /üîΩphyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa de lta bu'i sgra de ni phyogs nyid yin te / phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The reason is present in the similar instances alone, because sound is a quality of space, like sound that is a quality of space.üîΩThe reason is not present in the dissimilar instances, because sound is not a quality of space, like a pot.

original: rnam par brtag pa dang gcig tu so sor nges pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa dang gcig tu so sor nges pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is not contradictory, because it is impossible for a single entity to be both a quality of space and not a quality of space.

original: don rnams la yang spyir brjod kyang shugs kyi khyad par gnas pa'i phyir yang lus nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi bum pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don rnams la yang spyir brjod kyang shugs kyi khyad par gnas pa'i phyir yang lus nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi bum pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even when a general term is used for objects, the specific meaning is understood through implication, so the body is understood, not the pot.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig 'ongs so zhes bya bas ri'am shing la ni dogs par 'gyur ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig 'ongs so zhes bya bas ri'am shing la ni dogs par 'gyur ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when someone says he has come, one does not suspect a mountain or a tree.

original: khyad par gyi sgra nye bar byas pa nyid ni spyi'i sgra rnams kyi khyad par rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgra nye bar byas pa nyid ni spyi'i sgra rnams kyi khyad par rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúparticular‚Äù does not serve as the cause for positing the particular of the words ‚Äúuniversal,‚Äù

original: 'on kyang skabs dang shugs la sogs pa gang yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang skabs dang shugs la sogs pa gang yang yin no //
translated: but rather it is the context, the force, and so on.

original: de'i phyir gang yang rung ba'i spyi don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang rung ba'i spyi don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the universal is not a different object from the particular,

original: don gzhan du gyur pa gnyi ga'i mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa gnyi ga'i mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that a different object is both.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there any other object that is different,

original: gnyis las gcig kyang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis las gcig kyang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one of the two is not accepted.

original: sgra dang bum pa'i khyad par gyis rtogs na ni mi rtag pa la yang mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: sgra dang bum pa'i khyad par gyis rtogs na ni mi rtag pa la yang mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: If one understands the difference between sound and pot, then impermanence is the same.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: mi rtag pa nyid grub pas na sgra de dang ldan par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid grub pas na sgra de dang ldan par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because impermanence is established, it is established as having that sound.

original: de bzhin du 'ga' zhig don gzhan du gyur pas khas len na gang yang rung ba don gzhan gyi ngo bor 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'ga' zhig don gzhan du gyur pas khas len na gang yang rung ba don gzhan gyi ngo bor 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, if one accepts that something is different, then anything is a different entity.

original: 'dod pa bsgrub byar brjod pa 'dis ni chos dang chos can dag gis khyad par du byas pa'i chos dang chos can dag 'gog pa yang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa bsgrub byar brjod pa 'dis ni chos dang chos can dag gis khyad par du byas pa'i chos dang chos can dag 'gog pa yang bsal ba yin te /
translated: This statement that the thesis is to be established refutes the objection that the subject and predicate are refuted by the distinction between the subject and the predicate.

original: dper na sgra ni mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa ma yin pa'am sgra'i mi rtag pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste /üîΩchos can @193a * //
analyzed: dper na sgra ni mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa ma yin pa'am sgra'i mi rtag pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste / chos can @193a * //
translated: For example, it is like saying ‚Äúsound is not qualified by impermanence‚Äù or ‚Äúsound is not qualified by the impermanence of sound.‚Äù

original: la spyi bkag pa ni 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la spyi bkag pa ni 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction in the general refutation of the subject.

original: sgra de mi rtag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra de mi rtag pa yin gyi /
translated: Sound is impermanent,

original: sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa ma yin no de ltar gyur par 'dod na ni sgra la mi rtag pa'i sgra sgrub pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa ma yin no de ltar gyur par 'dod na ni sgra la mi rtag pa'i sgra sgrub pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: but sound is not qualified by the impermanence of sound. If you accept that, then because the sound of impermanence is established in sound, sound is not impermanent.

original: sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Sound is qualified by the sound of impermanence.

original: de yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa la gnod pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa la gnod pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore there is no fault in the thesis.

original: de'i phyir chos 'ba' zhig kho na chos can la sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos 'ba' zhig kho na chos can la sgrub pa'am /
translated: Therefore only the predicate is established in the subject.

original: phyin ci log tu bya ba yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu bya ba yin te /
translated: It is a contradiction,

original: de ltar na 'dod pa'i spyi grub ba ma gnod par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa'i spyi grub ba ma gnod par byas pa yin no //
translated: and thus the general thesis of the desire is not harmed.

original: 'gal ba ni thams cad du spyi de phyin ci log tu byed pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni thams cad du spyi de phyin ci log tu byed pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a contradiction because it always contradicts the universal.

original: de ni res 'ga' chos kyi sgo nas sam /
analyzed: de ni res 'ga' chos kyi sgo nas sam /
translated: Sometimes it is done by way of the property,

original: chos can gyi sgo nas sam /
analyzed: chos can gyi sgo nas sam /
translated: sometimes by way of the subject,

original: de'i khyad par gyi sgo nas byed pa'i phyir des tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: de'i khyad par gyi sgo nas byed pa'i phyir des tha snyad du byed do //
translated: and sometimes by way of its distinction.

original: rang nyid kyi sgra ni chos can gcig la bstan bcos las chos du ma rnam par gzhag kyang rang nyid bdag nyid 'dod pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi sgra ni chos can gcig la bstan bcos las chos du ma rnam par gzhag kyang rang nyid bdag nyid 'dod pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is used because, although many properties are posited in a treatise with respect to one subject, it is only one‚Äôs own thesis that is to be proven.

original: bstan bcos khas blangs su zin kyang gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos khas blangs su zin kyang gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if one accepts the treatise, the other is not.

original: der gzhan gyi 'dod pa thams cad bzlog tu zin kyang mdo mdzad pas rang gi 'brel par rang nyid ces bya ba ni bstan bcos la ma ltos par khas blangs pas ston par byed pa'o zhes rang nyid kyi sgras dgos pa'i gnas bzlog par bshad do //
analyzed: der gzhan gyi 'dod pa thams cad bzlog tu zin kyang mdo mdzad pas rang gi 'brel par rang nyid ces bya ba ni bstan bcos la ma ltos par khas blangs pas ston par byed pa'o zhes rang nyid kyi sgras dgos pa'i gnas bzlog par bshad do //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù in the treatise is used to refute the assertion of the opponent.

original: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir de la mthong ba thams cad bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes dogs pa srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir de la mthong ba thams cad bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes dogs pa srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: The opponent might think that because the treatise is asserted, everything that is seen in the treatise must be established.

original: log par rtogs pa yang mthong ba nyid de /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa yang mthong ba nyid de /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs misunderstanding is seen.

original: kha cig na re bstan bcos las mthong ba ni bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re bstan bcos las mthong ba ni bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin la /
translated: Some say that what is seen in the treatise is only what is to be established.

original: de gnod na yang gtan tshigs dang dam bca' ba dag gi skyon yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩde dag gi ltar na byas pa nyid kyi /
analyzed: de gnod na yang gtan tshigs dang dam bca' ba dag gi skyon yin no zhes zer ro // de dag gi ltar na byas pa nyid kyi /
translated: If that is refuted, then the fault lies with the reason and the thesis.

original: sgra mi rtag par sgrub pa dri la sogs pa'i yon tan bzlog pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag par sgrub pa dri la sogs pa'i yon tan bzlog pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: According to them, the reason in the proof that sound is impermanent because of being produced would be contradictory because it would refute the qualities of smell and so on.

original: skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na de ni gzhan la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na de ni gzhan la yang mtshungs so //
translated: If you say that it is not so because it is not the proper occasion, that is the same for the other.

original: mi mtshungs te 'dir chos can gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi mtshungs te 'dir chos can gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is not the same, because it is the occasion for the subject.

original: ma yin te chos can gyi skabs @193b su bab pa yin yang dngos po la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te chos can gyi skabs @193b su bab pa yin yang dngos po la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because even though it is the occasion for the subject, there is no connection with the thing.

original: 'on kyang 'di dag ni bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i sgo kho na nas 'brel pa yin na de ni thams cad la mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir 'di gnyis la bye brag med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di dag ni bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i sgo kho na nas 'brel pa yin na de ni thams cad la mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir 'di gnyis la bye brag med do //
translated: Moreover, if these are connected only by the acceptance of the treatise, that is the same for all, so there is no difference between these two.

original: 'on te rgol bas kyang 'dod pas sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'on te rgol bas kyang 'dod pas sgrub par byed do //
translated: But if the opponent also accepts the proof.

original: bsgrub par bya ba spyi'i phyogs gcig tu gyur ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba spyi'i phyogs gcig tu gyur ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Because the difference is a part of the general probandum, it is like the property of the probandum.

original: spyi'i phyogs gcig tu gyur pa'i khyad par yin pa zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni skabs ma yin pa 'dod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyi'i phyogs gcig tu gyur pa'i khyad par yin pa zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni skabs ma yin pa 'dod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: By the mere fact that it is a difference that is a part of the general, the occasion is not accepted.
