original: don ni de'i ngo bo mi 'dor ba'i phyir 'dod pa dang 'jug pa dag ldog pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ni de'i ngo bo mi 'dor ba'i phyir 'dod pa dang 'jug pa dag ldog pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the word would not be abandoned, and it would follow that the desire and engagement would not be reversed.

original: de'i phyir na 'di ni skabs 'ga' zhig las 'gyur ba dang de nyid kyis shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'di ni skabs 'ga' zhig las 'gyur ba dang de nyid kyis shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is to be understood by means of the context in some cases.

original: bzlog pa nyams su myong bas dgag pa 'jug kyang bla ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa nyams su myong bas dgag pa 'jug kyang bla ste /
translated: It is all right to engage in negation by experiencing the opposite.

original: skabs dang mi ldan pa de nan gyis yod do zhes bsgrub pa mngon sum dang 'gal bar spyod do //
analyzed: skabs dang mi ldan pa de nan gyis yod do zhes bsgrub pa mngon sum dang 'gal bar spyod do //
translated: But when the context is not appropriate, to insist that something exists is to act in contradiction to direct perception.

original: gnas skabs 'ga' yi 'dod 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'ga' yi 'dod 'gyur zhing //
translated: There is desire for some states,

original: de rtogs pa yang de dag gis //
analyzed: de rtogs pa yang de dag gis //
translated: and those who understand that

original: nan gyis khyod 'di 'dod ces pa //
analyzed: nan gyis khyod 'di 'dod ces pa //
translated: insist that you desire this.

original: gsal bar dbang phyug spyod pa yin //
analyzed: gsal bar dbang phyug spyod pa yin //
translated: This is the activity of ƒ™≈õvara made clear.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags can ming brjod de //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags can ming brjod de //
translated: The name is stated to have the effect as its mark,

original: 'khrul pa yis ni gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yis ni gnod par 'gyur //
translated: but it is harmed by error.

original: med na mi 'byung min don la //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung min don la //
translated: If it is not the case that the meaning does not occur without it,

original: gnod kyang gzhan la ci zhig gnod //üîΩrjes dpag rang gi spyod yul la //
analyzed: gnod kyang gzhan la ci zhig gnod // rjes dpag rang gi spyod yul la //
translated: then even if it is harmed, what harm is there to the other?üîΩInference is explained to be independent of scripture

original: lung la ltos pa med par bshad //
analyzed: lung la ltos pa med par bshad //
translated: with regard to its own domain.

original: des grub de ni legs par grub //
analyzed: des grub de ni legs par grub //
translated: And that which is established by that is well established.

original: de tshe bstan bcos ltos ma yin //
analyzed: de tshe bstan bcos ltos ma yin //
translated: At that time, the treatise is not relied upon.

original: de tshe gcod dor 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: de tshe gcod dor 'gyur zhe na //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúAt that time, it would be abandoned,‚Äù

original: de tshe khas blangs med phyir min //
analyzed: de tshe khas blangs med phyir min //
translated: It is not because there is no acceptance at that time.

original: 'di ni khas len thabs yin pas //
analyzed: 'di ni khas len thabs yin pas //
translated: This is the method of acceptance,

original: de tshe yod kyang de rgyu min //
analyzed: de tshe yod kyang de rgyu min //
translated: So even if it exists at that time, it is not a cause.

original: de ltar yul gnyis rnam dag na //
analyzed: de ltar yul gnyis rnam dag na //
translated: In that way, when the two objects are pure,

original: de tshe bstan bcos yongs 'dzin par //
analyzed: de tshe bstan bcos yongs 'dzin par //
translated: At that time, the treatise is fully accepted.

original: 'dod pa'i dus min de yi tshe //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dus min de yi tshe //
translated: When it is not the time to assert, at that time,

original: bstan bcos kyis ni gnod par 'gyur //üîΩdes grub don la de dang ni //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyis ni gnod par 'gyur // des grub don la de dang ni //
translated: The treatise is harmful.üîΩBecause it is not suitable to think that which is established by that

original: 'gal bar sems pa mi rung phyir //
analyzed: 'gal bar sems pa mi rung phyir //
translated: And that which contradicts it are the same,

original: gnas gsum par ni 'pho ba na //
analyzed: gnas gsum par ni 'pho ba na //
translated: When it moves to the third stage,

original: bstan bcos len pa rigs ldan yin //
analyzed: bstan bcos len pa rigs ldan yin //
translated: Accepting the treatise is suitable.

original: der yang bsgrub bya'i chos dang ni //
analyzed: der yang bsgrub bya'i chos dang ni //
translated: There also, the object to be established and

original: med na mi 'byung la gnod nyid //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung la gnod nyid //
translated: The absence of which would make it impossible are harmed.

original: spang par bya yi gzhan min te //
analyzed: spang par bya yi gzhan min te //
translated: It is to be abandoned, not anything else,

original: @194a * // thug pa med par thal phyir ro //
analyzed: @194a * // thug pa med par thal phyir ro //
translated: Because of the consequence of infinite regress.üîΩBy whom was this system made,

original: dpyod pa kun la bstan bcos dag / gzung zhes lugs 'di gang gis byas //
analyzed: dpyod pa kun la bstan bcos dag / gzung zhes lugs 'di gang gis byas //
translated: That all analyses are to be accepted as treatises?

original: da ni grub mtha' med rnams kyis //
analyzed: da ni grub mtha' med rnams kyis //
translated: Now, those who have no philosophical position

original: du bas me ni 'dzin mi 'gyur //
analyzed: du bas me ni 'dzin mi 'gyur //
translated: do not apprehend fire from smoke.

original: gal te dpe la bstan bcos kun //
analyzed: gal te dpe la bstan bcos kun //
translated: If all treatises

original: sgrub par byed pa gcig nyid la //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa gcig nyid la //
translated: are established by a single proof,

original: bstan pa sgrub byed 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: bstan pa sgrub byed 'gyur zhe na //
translated: then the teaching would be established, you say.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten 'das lugs yin //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten 'das lugs yin //
translated: This is the way of transcending the world.

original: 'brel med chos ni ma grub pas //
analyzed: 'brel med chos ni ma grub pas //
translated: Since unrelated phenomena are not established,

original: ma grub par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: ma grub par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could they be non-established?

original: de sgrub yin na de sgrub brjod //
analyzed: de sgrub yin na de sgrub brjod //
translated: If that is the proof, it is called the proof.

original: gtan tshigs skyon ldan ji ltar yin //
analyzed: gtan tshigs skyon ldan ji ltar yin //
translated: How can the reason be faulty?

original: chos can chos ni ma lus pa //
analyzed: chos can chos ni ma lus pa //
translated: All phenomena and the subject

original: dper bstan med pa kho nar ni //
analyzed: dper bstan med pa kho nar ni //
translated: are only shown to be non-existent in the example.

original: 'gro ba sogs dang dus sogs las //
analyzed: 'gro ba sogs dang dus sogs las //
translated: From going and so on, and from time and so on,

original: sems ldan me sogs rjes dbog byed //
analyzed: sems ldan me sogs rjes dbog byed //
translated: the mind and so on are inferred from fire and so on.

original: mi 'khrul bas na ngo bo dang // rgyu dag sgrub par byed pa'i don //
analyzed: mi 'khrul bas na ngo bo dang // rgyu dag sgrub par byed pa'i don //
translated: Because of non-deception, the nature and causes are established.

original: 'ga' yis smra ba la gnod kyang //
analyzed: 'ga' yis smra ba la gnod kyang //
translated: Although some object to the statement,

original: ngo bo nyid la ldog mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la ldog mi 'gyur //
translated: the nature itself cannot be refuted.

original: de ni 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya yi //üîΩdon dang med na mi 'byung bar //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya yi // don dang med na mi 'byung bar //
translated: That is the desired probandum.üîΩThe meaning is that without it,

original: rtogs pa gzhan dag gtan tshigs des //
analyzed: rtogs pa gzhan dag gtan tshigs des //
translated: other realizations are not possible. That reason

original: ci ste rtogs par 'gyur ma yin //üîΩgal te bstan bcos la lar 'ga' //üîΩrigs min pas na rigs smra ba //
analyzed: ci ste rtogs par 'gyur ma yin // gal te bstan bcos la lar 'ga' // rigs min pas na rigs smra ba //
translated: But if it is not understood,

original: gzhan pa dag kyang dgag bya zhes //
analyzed: gzhan pa dag kyang dgag bya zhes //
translated: then why not refute the other treatises?üîΩIf one does not understand the meaning of a treatise,üîΩthen one should not criticize it.

original: bya ba rgyal rigs lugs yin no ;
analyzed: bya ba rgyal rigs lugs yin no ;
translated: It is the king‚Äôs duty to refuteüîΩthose who speak falsely about the Dharma.

original: / don rnams thams cad mtshungs byas nas //
analyzed: / don rnams thams cad mtshungs byas nas //
translated: Having examined all the meanings,

original: sgrub byed brjod pa nus ma yin //
analyzed: sgrub byed brjod pa nus ma yin //
translated: one is not able to state a proof.üîΩTherefore, this method of positing

original: des na kun la bsgrub bya dang // sgrub byed gzhag pa 'di nyams 'gyur //
analyzed: des na kun la bsgrub bya dang // sgrub byed gzhag pa 'di nyams 'gyur //
translated: a probandum and a proof is undermined.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: This is the verse in the middle.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba la gnod par byed pa kho na 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba la gnod par byed pa kho na 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, only that which contradicts the probandum is contradictory.

original: gnod bya gnod byed ma yin pa dag gcig las grub pa 'gal ba med kyang /
analyzed: gnod bya gnod byed ma yin pa dag gcig las grub pa 'gal ba med kyang /
translated: That which is not contradicted and that which does not contradict are not contradictory.

original: gal te bstan bcos la gnod pas 'gal bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos la gnod pas 'gal bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that contradiction is the contradiction of a treatise,

original: de ni yul gzhan la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni yul gzhan la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then that is the same in regard to other objects, and so there would be contradiction.

original: des na de nyid la gnod 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na de nyid la gnod 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, it would contradict reality.

original: de lta ma yin na ni 'gyur re zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni 'gyur re zhe na /
translated: If it did not, then it would not.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: gtan tshigs thams cad kyis skyon dang yon tan ni rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la ltos nas bsam par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad kyis skyon dang yon tan ni rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la ltos nas bsam par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all reasons are to be considered in terms of their own probandum.

original: de ni rang gi sgrub par bya ba 'gog pa ma yin yang bstan bcos la gnod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin na /
analyzed: de ni rang gi sgrub par bya ba 'gog pa ma yin yang bstan bcos la gnod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin na /
translated: If that were a contradiction because it contradicts the treatise, even though it does not contradict its own probandum,

original: @194b de ni gzhan gyis byas na yang mtshungs pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @194b de ni gzhan gyis byas na yang mtshungs pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be a contradiction because it is the same when done by another.

original: gzhan gyis byas na yang dam bca' ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas na yang dam bca' ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If it is a fault of the thesis when done by another,

original: 'gyur mod yul la de ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gyur mod yul la de ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: then why is it not so for you?

original: gnod par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can gyi rjod pa'i phyir 'di nyid la gzhan gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnod par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can gyi rjod pa'i phyir 'di nyid la gzhan gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Because it expresses a subject that possesses a property to be negated, it is so in this case, but not for others.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: gnod par bya ba'i don can gyi bstan bcos khas blangs pas na gzhan du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba'i don can gyi bstan bcos khas blangs pas na gzhan du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because one accepts a treatise that has the meaning of what is to be negated, it is so for others as well.

original: des na 'di ni dam bca' ba'i skyon gyi mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: des na 'di ni dam bca' ba'i skyon gyi mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, this is not the definition of the fault of a thesis.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that the entire treatise would be the probandum.

original: gzhan yang gal te bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir bstan bcos la mthong ba thams cad bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod pa yin nam grub pa'i gtan tshigs rjod pa yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir bstan bcos la mthong ba thams cad bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod pa yin nam grub pa'i gtan tshigs rjod pa yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if you accept the treatise, then would all that is seen in the treatise be the probandum? And if you accept that, then the statement of the established reason would also be a thesis.

original: tshig phrad smos pas sgrub byed du 'dod pa spangs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: tshig phrad smos pas sgrub byed du 'dod pa spangs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: You may reply, There is no fault because we accept that the words 'it follows that' are the proof and not the thesis.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: rigs pas thob pa ni tshig gis bzlog par mi mus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pas thob pa ni tshig gis bzlog par mi mus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because what is established by reasoning cannot be refuted by words.

original: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don can rang nyid kyi sgras kyang don cung zad rgyas par mi byed do //
analyzed: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don can rang nyid kyi sgras kyang don cung zad rgyas par mi byed do //
translated: And even if the words themselves are not the subject, they do not add anything to the meaning of the subject, which is something external to the definition of the subject.

original: gal te bstan bcos la 'jug pas 'dod du yin no //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos la 'jug pas 'dod du yin no //
translated: You may reply, We accept that the treatise is the subject.

original: gang gis de'i don du 'bad par byed par dgos pas 'di ga las yin /
analyzed: gang gis de'i don du 'bad par byed par dgos pas 'di ga las yin /
translated: But then, since the purpose of the treatise is to strive for the meaning of the subject, where is the need for this?

original: gal te tshad mas ma bzlog na de 'jug pa sus bzlog cing /
analyzed: gal te tshad mas ma bzlog na de 'jug pa sus bzlog cing /
translated: If it is not refuted by valid cognition, who can refute its subject?

original: tshad mas bzlog na yang sus tshig gis 'jug par byed nus /
analyzed: tshad mas bzlog na yang sus tshig gis 'jug par byed nus /
translated: But who can refute it by means of a valid cognition?

original: gzhan dag ni rang nyid kyi sgra gzhung lugs kyi mtshan nyid kyis bskyed pa'i khyad par gyi chos can yongs su spangs nas rab tu grags pa'i chos can yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rang nyid kyi sgra gzhung lugs kyi mtshan nyid kyis bskyed pa'i khyad par gyi chos can yongs su spangs nas rab tu grags pa'i chos can yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'dzer to //
translated: Others say that the subject is completely abandoned when it is generated by the definition of the treatise itself, and that the subject is completely taken up when it is completely renowned.

original: de la yang rnam par dpyod pa'i skabs nyid kyis gzhi rab tu grags pa yin par grub pa'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang rnam par dpyod pa'i skabs nyid kyis gzhi rab tu grags pa yin par grub pa'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: But in that case, since the basis is established as completely renowned by the very occasion of the analysis, this is nothing at all.

original: rang gi 'dod pas brtags pa khyad par can don la gtsor nye bar sbyor ba med pa'i don dag la nye bar bkod pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni 'ga' yang bzlog par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas brtags pa khyad par can don la gtsor nye bar sbyor ba med pa'i don dag la nye bar bkod pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni 'ga' yang bzlog par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: One should not refute the presentation of things that are not primarily applied to the object in the sense of being specifically imagined by oneself.

original: de ltar rab tu bkod pa'i ngo bo mtshungs par ma grub can dag ni khyad par gyi rten can gyi tha snyad rten ma yin pa'i @195a * //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu bkod pa'i ngo bo mtshungs par ma grub can dag ni khyad par gyi rten can gyi tha snyad rten ma yin pa'i @195a * //
translated: Thus, those who have not established the equivalence of the nature of the presentation should not use the convention of the basis of distinction.

original: phyir ro // 'on te rab tu grags pa nye bar bstan pa'i sgo nas grub pa'i chos can bsgrub par bya ba ma yin bshad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyir ro // 'on te rab tu grags pa nye bar bstan pa'i sgo nas grub pa'i chos can bsgrub par bya ba ma yin bshad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the established subject is not to be established, because it is taught by way of teaching what is well known,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nar bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nar bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood by this very statement, ‚ÄúIt is taught as just its own nature.‚Äù

original: grub pa dang sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bor bstan pa yin par dgos na bsgrub par bya ba kho nar bstan par bya ba zhes bya ba 'di 'bras bu bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub pa dang sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bor bstan pa yin par dgos na bsgrub par bya ba kho nar bstan par bya ba zhes bya ba 'di 'bras bu bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is necessary to teach it as the nature of the established and the establishing, then this statement, ‚ÄúIt is to be taught as just the established,‚Äù would have a point.

original: rang nyid grub pa'i chos can yongs su bzung bar ma brjod na chos can nyid du sgrub byar byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang nyid grub pa'i chos can yongs su bzung bar ma brjod na chos can nyid du sgrub byar byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that if the subject that is established by itself is not stated as being taken up, then the subject itself would be the established,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: rjes su dpag pa spyi'i yul can yin pa nyid kyis don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa spyi'i yul can yin pa nyid kyis don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is understood by the inferential cognition itself being a general subject.

original: chos can yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos can yod par 'gyur /
translated: The subject would exist.

original: bsgrub par bya ba yin na rang gi mtshan nyid bsgrub byar 'gyur na de yang spangs zin to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yin na rang gi mtshan nyid bsgrub byar 'gyur na de yang spangs zin to //
translated: If it were to be established, then its own nature would be the established, but that has already been rejected.

original: de'i phyir 'dir de skad ma brjod kyang phyogs la 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir de skad ma brjod kyang phyogs la 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, although it is not stated here, there is not the slightest contradiction in the position.

original: ci ste chos can nyid bsgrub byar byas na de las cir 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste chos can nyid bsgrub byar byas na de las cir 'gyur /
translated: But if the subject itself is taken as the probandum, what is the problem?

original: de ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni mi nus so //
translated: It is not possible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gtan tshigs ni khyad par dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni khyad par dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the reason is not a property of the subject and is not concomitant with the subject.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs dang dpe dag gi skyon yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs dang dpe dag gi skyon yin gyi /
translated: This is a fault of the reason and example,

original: phyogs kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not a fault of the position,

original: yan lag phyi ma la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag phyi ma la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on the subsequent part.

original: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i skyon mtha' dag phyogs kyi skyon yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i skyon mtha' dag phyogs kyi skyon yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then all faults of the reason and so on would be faults of the position,

original: thams cad du phyogs nyid la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du phyogs nyid la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in all cases the position itself is harmed.

original: de'i phyir de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa kho na phyogs kyi skyon yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa kho na phyogs kyi skyon yin te /
translated: Therefore, only that which is related to the reason is a fault of the position,

original: mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba bzhin no //
translated: just as contradiction with perception and so on is.

original: rgyu sogs mtshan nyid gsal bya la //
analyzed: rgyu sogs mtshan nyid gsal bya la //
translated: The characteristics of the cause and so on are to be clarified.

original: ltos pa med par ma khyab dang // ldog pa dag ni spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ltos pa med par ma khyab dang // ldog pa dag ni spang ba'i phyir //
translated: To exclude the non-pervading and the contradictory,

original: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid rjod pa yin //
analyzed: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid rjod pa yin //
translated: The definition of the thesis is stated.

original: bdag nyid tshig phrad ngo bo'i sgra //
analyzed: bdag nyid tshig phrad ngo bo'i sgra //
translated: The words ‚Äúonly‚Äù and ‚Äúessentially‚Äù

original: ma gsal ba dang bcas pa rnams //üîΩldog pa sel bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: ma gsal ba dang bcas pa rnams // ldog pa sel bar byed pa yin //
translated: Are used to exclude the non-evident.üîΩThe word ‚Äújust‚Äù is used to exclude the contradictory.

original: 'dod sgras ma khyab sel bar byed //
analyzed: 'dod sgras ma khyab sel bar byed //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used to exclude the non-pervading.

original: bsgrub bya khas blangs phyogs mtshan nyid //
analyzed: bsgrub bya khas blangs phyogs mtshan nyid //
translated: The definition of the thesis is the position that is accepted.

original: de rnams la ni phyogs nyid med //üîΩbsal ba gnod dang lhag ma la //
analyzed: de rnams la ni phyogs nyid med // bsal ba gnod dang lhag ma la //
translated: These are not theses,

original: mtshan nyid 'jug pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'jug pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because the definition is not applicable to them.üîΩThe definition is not applicable to them,üîΩBecause they are refuted, are redundant, or are not established.üîΩThe word ‚Äújust‚Äù is used to exclude

original: log par @195b rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: log par @195b rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: The wrong understanding that is seen.

original: 'dir ni bdag nyid sgra mdzad pa //üîΩ'dod gnod med dang bsgrub bya min //
analyzed: 'dir ni bdag nyid sgra mdzad pa // 'dod gnod med dang bsgrub bya min //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used to exclude

original: thug pa med pa stan pa yin //
analyzed: thug pa med pa stan pa yin //
translated: The unwanted, the impossible, and the unestablished.

original: zhes bya ba dag ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: These are the verses in the middle.

original: 'dir rang nyid dang 'dod pa'i sgra dag gi nges par gzung ba'i don rtogs kyang /
analyzed: 'dir rang nyid dang 'dod pa'i sgra dag gi nges par gzung ba'i don rtogs kyang /
translated: Here, even though the definite objects of the words ‚Äúitself‚Äù and ‚Äúonly‚Äù are understood,

original: byed pa dang ldan pa'i mtha' can dang 'brel pa'i phyir ston par 'gyur ba la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de bcas pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa dang ldan pa'i mtha' can dang 'brel pa'i phyir ston par 'gyur ba la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de bcas pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
translated: Since the suffix indicative of the present tense is connected with the one who has the action, it would follow that the present tense would be used, and so it is explained in order to include that.

original: 'dir ni 'dod pa'i skad kyi dbyings la nashte yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'dod pa'i skad kyi dbyings la nashte yan lag ma yin no //
translated: Here, the present tense is not a part of the language of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i tshig la yan lag nyid yin pas des gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs pa 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i tshig la yan lag nyid yin pas des gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs pa 'gog par byed do //
translated: Since it is a part of the language of desire, it refutes the reason that is not established and so on.

original: rgol ba bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid du rjod pa 'dis ni mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa'i 'dod pa yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rgol ba bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid du rjod pa 'dis ni mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa'i 'dod pa yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: By this statement that what is to be inferred is itself desired by the proponent, even a desire mixed with the undesired is not the probandum.

original: de la gnod na yang phyogs dang gtan tshigs kyi skyon du 'gyur ba med par rig bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la gnod na yang phyogs dang gtan tshigs kyi skyon du 'gyur ba med par rig bar bya ste /
translated: And even if it is damaged, it should be understood that there is no fault of the thesis or reason.

original: ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin pa bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin pa bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no negation of what is to be established.

original: dper na nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dang don gcig la 'du ba can mi rtag pa nyid med par yang sgrub par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dang don gcig la 'du ba can mi rtag pa nyid med par yang sgrub par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like proving that the quality of space itself is impermanent, but not that it is impermanent in the sense of being composite.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus su bstan bcos la mi brten par rjod pa 'di nyid kyis skabs su gtogs pa ma yin pa phyogs su byed pa yang gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus su bstan bcos la mi brten par rjod pa 'di nyid kyis skabs su gtogs pa ma yin pa phyogs su byed pa yang gsal ba yin la /
translated: By this very statement that one does not rely on treatises at the time of inference, it is also clear that one should not take as one's position something that is not part of the context.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag pa'am rtag pa yin zhes bya ba'i skabs su tha dad pa dbang pos gzung bar bya ba'i spyi dang don gcig la 'du pa can gyi mi rtag pa nyid dang / sgra ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag pa'am rtag pa yin zhes bya ba'i skabs su tha dad pa dbang pos gzung bar bya ba'i spyi dang don gcig la 'du pa can gyi mi rtag pa nyid dang / sgra ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the context of Is sound impermanent or permanent? one should not take as one's position the impermanence that is the same as the universal apprehended by a different sense faculty, or the fact that sound possesses sound.

original: bstan bcos la brten pa'am phyir rgol ba de rtogs pa don du gnyer ba yin na ni don te phyogs su byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos la brten pa'am phyir rgol ba de rtogs pa don du gnyer ba yin na ni don te phyogs su byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one relies on treatises or if one is seeking to understand the opponent, then one should take as one's position something that is the same as the opponent's position.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di ma 'brel pa brjod pa nyid yin pas rna gtad par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di ma 'brel pa brjod pa nyid yin pas rna gtad par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not like that, then it is just a statement that is not connected, so it should not be taken as one's position.

original: gnyi ga bstan bcos la mi brten par 'ga' zhig yongs su rtog pa na skabs ma yin pa phyogs su byed pa'i skabs ci zhig yod /üîΩgal te khyad par gyi spyi 'phen pa'i phyir de grub na 'dod pa nyid 'grub @196a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga bstan bcos la mi brten par 'ga' zhig yongs su rtog pa na skabs ma yin pa phyogs su byed pa'i skabs ci zhig yod / gal te khyad par gyi spyi 'phen pa'i phyir de grub na 'dod pa nyid 'grub @196a * //
translated: If neither is based on a treatise, then what occasion is there for someone to imagine that an occasion is not appropriate?

original: pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is established in order to indicate a specific universal, then is it not established just as we wanted?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: rtogs pa po 'dod pa ni skabs su bab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa po 'dod pa ni skabs su bab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the one who understands it wants it to be appropriate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skabs kyis bsgrub bya'i chos su 'dod pa ldog pa yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skabs kyis bsgrub bya'i chos su 'dod pa ldog pa yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, we say that the predicate is reversed because of the occasion.

original: spyi don du gnyer ba ni gdon mi za bar so sor nges pa'i khyad par don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi don du gnyer ba ni gdon mi za bar so sor nges pa'i khyad par don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: One who seeks a universal does not necessarily seek a specific individual.

original: khyad par gzhan la rtsod pa med pa yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan la rtsod pa med pa yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is possible that there is no dispute about another specific individual.

original: bstan bcos kyi sgo nas ni rtsod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi sgo nas ni rtsod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not a dispute about a treatise,

original: de'i tshe de med na med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de med na med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time it is not the case that if one does not exist, the other does not exist.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i chos ni 'gar yang gzhung lugs las mi gnas pa la rjes su 'gro ba grub pa ma yin zhing mi 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i chos ni 'gar yang gzhung lugs las mi gnas pa la rjes su 'gro ba grub pa ma yin zhing mi 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: A property of that sort is not established by the mere fact that it is found in some scriptural source, and there is no non-erroneous logical reason for it.

original: gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba dag kyang bsal zin to //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba dag kyang bsal zin to //
translated: We have already refuted the argument that the two are related because they are related in the treatise.

original: bstan bcos la brten kyang skabs las 'das na ha cang thal ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: bstan bcos la brten kyang skabs las 'das na ha cang thal ba bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained the absurd consequence that if one goes beyond the context, the treatise is useless.

original: de'i phyir skabs su rtogs pa khyad med pa'i chos tsam nyid bsgrub par bya ba dang sna bstad par 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skabs su rtogs pa khyad med pa'i chos tsam nyid bsgrub par bya ba dang sna bstad par 'os pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is proper to prove and to refute only those properties that are understood in the context, without any distinction.

original: de lta ma yin na don gzhan du 'gro ba'i phyir tshar gcad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don gzhan du 'gro ba'i phyir tshar gcad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would be subject to defeat because one would be talking about something else.

original: khas blangs pa de yang /
analyzed: khas blangs pa de yang /
translated: The thesis is also stated as follows:üîΩDirect perception, inference,

original: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches grags pas ma bsal ba //
analyzed: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches grags pas ma bsal ba //
translated: and testimony are not refuted.

original: bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: They are the means of knowledge.

original: gal te bstan par bya ba yin du chug na mngon sum gyi don dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa dag dang / grags pas ma bsal ba'i khas blangs pa gtan tshigs la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te bstan par bya ba yin du chug na mngon sum gyi don dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa dag dang / grags pas ma bsal ba'i khas blangs pa gtan tshigs la ltos pa yin no //
translated: If it is granted that it is to be taught, then it is dependent on a reason, which is either perception, inference, testimony, or an acknowledged fact not contradicted by perception or inference.

original: mngon sum la don smos pa ni dbang po'i shes pa kha cig don phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir de spangs nas tshad ma'i yul yongs su dag pa gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum la don smos pa ni dbang po'i shes pa kha cig don phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir de spangs nas tshad ma'i yul yongs su dag pa gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúperception‚Äù is used to refer to the object, in order to exclude some cognitions of the senses which are erroneous, and to include only the pure object of valid cognition.

original: yang ci'i phyir gsal ba phyogs ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gsal ba phyogs ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the manifest not a logical reason?

original: gtan tshigs the tshom la rjod phyir //
analyzed: gtan tshigs the tshom la rjod phyir //
translated: Because a logical reason is stated to resolve doubt.

original: gsal ba gtan tshigs rten ma yin //üîΩgsal ba ni tshad ma dag gis bzlog pa yin pas zla bo'i tshad ma'i rten ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba gtan tshigs rten ma yin // gsal ba ni tshad ma dag gis bzlog pa yin pas zla bo'i tshad ma'i rten ma yin te /
translated: The manifest is not a basis for a logical reason.

original: bzlog pa la tshad ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa la tshad ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The manifest is not a basis for a valid cognition that contradicts it, because a valid cognition does not engage with what is contradictory.üîΩAnd it is not a basis for a valid cognition that establishes it, because it is already established by a valid cognition.

original: 'gal ba dag ni gcig la yang dag pa'i shes par mi 'thad pa'i phyir @196b ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba dag ni gcig la yang dag pa'i shes par mi 'thad pa'i phyir @196b ro //
translated: And it is not a basis for a valid cognition that is inconclusive, because it is impossible for a valid cognition to be inconclusive with regard to a manifest object.

original: yul rab tu bstan pa'i phyir phyogs rjod pa yin na gsal ba la ni yul can mi srid pa'i phyir de phyogs ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: yul rab tu bstan pa'i phyir phyogs rjod pa yin na gsal ba la ni yul can mi srid pa'i phyir de phyogs ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The term ‚Äúdirection‚Äù is used to indicate the domain of the object. But since the domain of the object is impossible in the case of a manifestation, that is not a direction.

original: de'i phyir the tshom gyi yul ni gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom gyi yul ni gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul yin no //
translated: Therefore, the domain of doubt is the domain of the activity of the logical reason.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba yis //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba yis //
translated: The division of inference

original: gnod pa de ni rnams bzhir bshad //
analyzed: gnod pa de ni rnams bzhir bshad //
translated: is explained as the fourfold division of the fault of the position.

original: rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gsum du phye bas na phyogs kyi gnod pa de bzhir bstan to //üîΩde la khas blangs 'bras rtags te //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gsum du phye bas na phyogs kyi gnod pa de bzhir bstan to // de la khas blangs 'bras rtags te //
translated: The fault of the position is explained as a fourfold division because inference is divided into three types.üîΩThe reason of the effect and the reason of natureüîΩare known respectively as the effect and nature.

original: 'gro la grags pa rang bzhin rang rtags yid ches pa'i tshig ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi rtags yin la /
analyzed: 'gro la grags pa rang bzhin rang rtags yid ches pa'i tshig ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi rtags yin la /
translated: The reason that has the characteristic of the effect is a reason that is known as the effect.

original: grags pa ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: grags pa ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The reason that has the characteristic of the nature is known as the nature.

original: bdag gam gzhan don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i sgo nas ngag 'jug par 'dod pa ni yid ches pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gam gzhan don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i sgo nas ngag 'jug par 'dod pa ni yid ches pa yin te /
translated: A trustworthy person is one who is known to speak in accordance with what he has seen for the benefit of himself or others.

original: de'i tshig ni de lta bu'i don gyi dngos po med na mi 'jug pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yin no //üîΩrang gi 'bras bu yang dag par bstan pa de ni rang las phyin ci log tu khas blangs pa'i gegs byed do //üîΩde'i phyir de lta mtshungs pas na rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos bsdus te gcig tu brjod do //
analyzed: de'i tshig ni de lta bu'i don gyi dngos po med na mi 'jug pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yin no // rang gi 'bras bu yang dag par bstan pa de ni rang las phyin ci log tu khas blangs pa'i gegs byed do // de'i phyir de lta mtshungs pas na rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos bsdus te gcig tu brjod do //
translated: The treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.

original: stobs kyi rten nyid la bstan bcos gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa'i don du ji ltar bdag nyid tshad ma ma yin na tshig mi 'jug pa de bzhin du bstan bcos la ma brten par des grags pas la dpyod pa mi
analyzed: stobs kyi rten nyid la bstan bcos gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa'i don du ji ltar bdag nyid tshad ma ma yin na tshig mi 'jug pa de bzhin du bstan bcos la ma brten par des grags pas la dpyod pa mi
translated: The treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.

original: 'jug go zhes mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir 'di rang gi tshig dang lhan cig tu brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'jug go zhes mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir 'di rang gi tshig dang lhan cig tu brjod par mdzad do //
translated: The treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of the words.üîΩThe treatise is the cause of the words, because it is the basis of

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhal bya'i don can gyi tshad ma dag med do zhes 'di la dper brjod pa yang 'dra bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhal bya'i don can gyi tshad ma dag med do zhes 'di la dper brjod pa yang 'dra bar mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, the example of the statement ‚ÄúThere is no valid cognition that has an object to be cognized‚Äù is similar.

original: tshad ma rnams med na bstan bcos dang tshig dag mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams med na bstan bcos dang tshig dag mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if there were no valid cognitions, treatises and words would be impossible.

original: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba la gsal ba'i dper brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba la gsal ba'i dper brjod pa yin la /
translated: This is a clear example of contradiction with one‚Äôs own words.

original: lung la ni 'di phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lung la ni 'di phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin no //
translated: As for scripture, this is just a partial example.

original: 'di la dper brjod pa ni chos 'phos nas bde ba ster bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la dper brjod pa ni chos 'phos nas bde ba ster bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The example here is that the transference of the property does not bestow happiness.

original: chos can rnam @197a * //üîΩpar gzhag pa de la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos can rnam @197a * // par gzhag pa de la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: The property is the basis of the attribute.

original: de la gnod na gzhi med pas khyad par la dpyod pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i yul la ni gdon mi za bar bstan bcos tshad mar 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: de la gnod na gzhi med pas khyad par la dpyod pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i yul la ni gdon mi za bar bstan bcos tshad mar 'gyur dgos so //
translated: If it is undermined, then the attribute is baseless, and the analysis of the attribute is not engaged. Therefore, in regard to such a type of object, the treatise must be valid without doubt.

original: da ni ji ltar 'jug ngogs su khrus byas pa la sogs pa chos ma yin pa dag par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba khas blangs pa'i gnod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'jug ngogs su khrus byas pa la sogs pa chos ma yin pa dag par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba khas blangs pa'i gnod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: does not purify what is not Dharma?

original: ma mthong ba rtogs par byed pa'i bstan bcos thams cad de skad ma brjod pa'i phyir bkag pa la skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba rtogs par byed pa'i bstan bcos thams cad de skad ma brjod pa'i phyir bkag pa la skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since no treatise that reveals the unseen states that, there is no fault in refuting that.

original: rang gi khas len pa'i rten gyis bstan bcos dang 'gal ba gnod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rang gi khas len pa'i rten gyis bstan bcos dang 'gal ba gnod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is a contradiction to the treatise of one‚Äôs own tenets, but

original: gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not a contradiction to the treatises of others,

original: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not accepted.

original: khrus kyi dag par smra ba'i bstan bcos de'i rang gi tshig gis kyang don de la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khrus kyi dag par smra ba'i bstan bcos de'i rang gi tshig gis kyang don de la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the treatise that advocates purification by bathing itself contradicts that meaning.

original: chos ma yin pa ni bstan bcos thams cad las chags pa la sogs pa'i rtsa ba can du rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa ni bstan bcos thams cad las chags pa la sogs pa'i rtsa ba can du rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: All treatises state that what is not Dharma is rooted in attachment, etc.

original: ma chags pa dang / sdang ba med pa dang / ma rmongs pa rnams la ni sdig par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma chags pa dang / sdang ba med pa dang / ma rmongs pa rnams la ni sdig par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not accept that nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion are sins.

original: rnam par gzhag pa des ni khrus la sogs pa sdig pa dag par byed par sma ba la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa des ni khrus la sogs pa sdig pa dag par byed par sma ba la gnod pa yin no //
translated: This presentation contradicts the claim that bathing and so on purify sins.

original: rgyu ma zad na 'bras bu mi zlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu ma zad na 'bras bu mi zlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because as long as the cause is not exhausted, the effect cannot be averted.

original: mngar ba dang / bsil ba dang / snum pa dag gis bad kan las gyur pa'i nang bzhin no //
analyzed: mngar ba dang / bsil ba dang / snum pa dag gis bad kan las gyur pa'i nang bzhin no //
translated: For example, phlegm disorders are not averted by sweet, cold, and oily substances.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lung gis mthong ba'i don dag la ni 'gal ba brjod pa phal cher sems pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lung gis mthong ba'i don dag la ni 'gal ba brjod pa phal cher sems pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the majority of the contradictions that are stated with regard to the meaning of the scriptures are due to a lack of understanding.

original: bstan bcos gang zhig mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i yul dag la dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad ma dang / rang gi tshig gis mi gnod pa de gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos gang zhig mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i yul dag la dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshad ma dang / rang gi tshig gis mi gnod pa de gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: A treatise should be accepted if it does not contradict valid cognitions that are based on facts and if it does not contradict itself.

original: de la mi brten pa'i dngos po la ni bstan bcos dang ldan pas 'gal ba rjod kyang gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la mi brten pa'i dngos po la ni bstan bcos dang ldan pas 'gal ba rjod kyang gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: If it does not contradict facts, then even if it is contradicted by a treatise, it is not harmed.

original: gegs byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gegs byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be a hindrance.

original: gnyi ga stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyi ga stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because both are equal in strength,

original: dper na rang gi tshig bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rang gi tshig bzhin no //
translated: like one‚Äôs own words.

original: de'i tshe ni de'i rang @197b gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni de'i rang @197b gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin gyi /
translated: At that time, it would contradict one‚Äôs own words,

original: bstan bcos dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the treatise.

original: de dag las gang la tshad ma yod pa de ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag las gang la tshad ma yod pa de ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa yin te /
translated: Among them, that which has valid cognition contradicts the other.

original: de lta ma yin na dam bca' ba stobs mtshungs pa'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dam bca' ba stobs mtshungs pa'am /
translated: Otherwise, if the proposition were equal in strength,

original: rjes su dpag pa dang ldan pa don ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa la rigs pa med pa'i dam bcas pas ji ltar gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang ldan pa don ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa la rigs pa med pa'i dam bcas pas ji ltar gnod par 'gyur /
translated: or if the inference were engaged in accordance with the meaning, how could the unreasonable proposition be contradicted?

original: lung rnams tshad ma yin pa yang bkag zin to //üîΩde'i phyir khas blangs nas gcod pa dag la skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung rnams tshad ma yin pa yang bkag zin to // de'i phyir khas blangs nas gcod pa dag la skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: And it has already been refuted that scriptures are valid cognition.üîΩTherefore, this fault would arise for those who accept and refute.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnod pas byed pas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnod pas byed pas /
translated: For that very reason, it contradicts what is accepted.

original: khas blangs pas na rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol tu gyur pa ma yin yang khas blangs pa logs shig tu byas pa ni yul gyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khas blangs pas na rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol tu gyur pa ma yin yang khas blangs pa logs shig tu byas pa ni yul gyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Although it is not external to inference because it is accepted, it is stated separately because it is a classification of objects.

original: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal ba'am logs shig tu byas pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal ba'am logs shig tu byas pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, it would be absurd or stating it separately would be pointless.

original: rang gi tshig logs shig tu byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yang tshig tsam rjod pa la gegs byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi tshig logs shig tu byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yang tshig tsam rjod pa la gegs byed pa yin no //
translated: The reason for stating it separately is that it is an obstacle to merely stating words.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid ni bstan bcos la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir der yang gegs byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid ni bstan bcos la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir der yang gegs byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since it is similar that treatises are not valid cognition, it would also be an obstacle there.

original: gzhi yod na gegs su 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhi yod na gegs su 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: It would be an obstacle if there were a basis.

original: dper na grub pa'i tshig la tshad ma dang cig shos dag phan tshun dang / grub pa'i bud med la chos la brten pa bu skyed pa dang cig shos kyi chos dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grub pa'i tshig la tshad ma dang cig shos dag phan tshun dang / grub pa'i bud med la chos la brten pa bu skyed pa dang cig shos kyi chos dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, in established words, valid cognition and the other mutually, and in established women, the qualities of giving birth to a son and the other qualities are based on phenomena.

original: gang du chos can nyid ma grub pa der gang la gang gis gegs bya ste /
analyzed: gang du chos can nyid ma grub pa der gang la gang gis gegs bya ste /
translated: Where the subject itself is not established, what is to be obstructed by what?

original: skabs nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no occasion for it.

original: des na chos can rnam par 'jog pas ni bstan bcos tshad mar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: des na chos can rnam par 'jog pas ni bstan bcos tshad mar byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the treatise is authoritative because it posits the subject.

original: des na de ni gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ni gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a refutation.

original: bstan bcos de tshad ma ma yin na 'o na ni ji ltar chos can rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos de tshad ma ma yin na 'o na ni ji ltar chos can rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If the treatise is not authoritative, then how does it posit the subject?

original: tshad mar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted as authoritative.

original: 'o na ni tshad mar byed pa'i phyir khas blangs pa nyid chos can rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na ni tshad mar byed pa'i phyir khas blangs pa nyid chos can rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin la /
translated: If it is accepted as authoritative, then it is accepted as positing the subject.

original: chos gzhan yang de nyid kyis 'jog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos gzhan yang de nyid kyis 'jog pa'i phyir /
translated: And because it posits other phenomena,

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba las tha mi @198a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba las tha mi @198a * //
translated: it is not different from a contradiction of one's own words.

original: dad pa des na gegs byed pa yin gyi gnod par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dad pa des na gegs byed pa yin gyi gnod par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a hindrance, but it is not a refutation.

original: 'o na da 'di la dbye ba ci yod /
analyzed: 'o na da 'di la dbye ba ci yod /
translated: Well then, what is the difference between these two?

original: cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest difference.

original: 'o na ji ltar so sor rjod ce na //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar so sor rjod ce na //
translated: Well then, how are they stated separately?

original: dag gi dbye bas de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag gi dbye bas de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are stated separately because of the difference in the way they are stated.

original: snga mas bzhag pa phyi mas nyams par byed pa'i phyir khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: snga mas bzhag pa phyi mas nyams par byed pa'i phyir khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: because the latter contradicts the former.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sngar khas blangs pa dang zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sngar khas blangs pa dang zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúcontradicts what was previously accepted.

original: ngag de nyid kyis rang gi don dang 'gal ba ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: ngag de nyid kyis rang gi don dang 'gal ba ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: ‚Äù Contradicts one‚Äôs own words means that the words themselves contradict their own purport.

original: dper na rjes su dpog pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpog pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúInference is not a means of valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: tshad ma ma yin na gegs byed par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin na gegs byed par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is not a means of valid knowledge, how can it be a hindrance?

original: de nyid kyi phyir stobs mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir stobs mtshungs pas so //
translated: Because it is equal in strength.

original: gal te de la gcig tshad ma ma yin na grub pa kho nar 'gyur gyi gegs byed par ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de la gcig tshad ma ma yin na grub pa kho nar 'gyur gyi gegs byed par ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not a means of valid knowledge, it is established as just that, but it is not a hindrance,

original: tshad mas tshad ma ma yin pa la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas tshad ma ma yin pa la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a means of valid knowledge does not contradict a means of valid knowledge.

original: de khas blangs pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad la bstan bcos tshad ma yin pas gnod par byed pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de khas blangs pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad la bstan bcos tshad ma yin pas gnod par byed pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Because it is accepted, the treatise is a means of valid knowledge with regard to all things, and therefore it is a hindrance.

original: khas blangs par khyad par med kyang ji ltar gcig ni tshad ma dang gnod par byed pa yin la /üîΩgzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khas blangs par khyad par med kyang ji ltar gcig ni tshad ma dang gnod par byed pa yin la / gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Although there is no difference in the acceptance of the thesis, one is a valid cognition and the other is not.

original: des ni 'di na gyi na'o //
analyzed: des ni 'di na gyi na'o //
translated: How is that?

original: 'di ni tshad ma nyid skyes bu'i 'dod pas byas pa yang yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma nyid skyes bu'i 'dod pas byas pa yang yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the complete statement of the valid cognition that is produced by the desire of a person.

original: gal te rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos dang 'gal ba la gegs byed pa'i skyon yod pa de lta na yang de las don la the tshom du 'gyur ba kho nar zad la /
analyzed: gal te rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos dang 'gal ba la gegs byed pa'i skyon yod pa de lta na yang de las don la the tshom du 'gyur ba kho nar zad la /
translated: Even if there is the fault of contradiction with one's own words and treatises, it is only a doubt about the meaning.

original: de ni phyogs kha na ma tho ba med par bstan pa la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ji ltar phyogs kyi skyon yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ni phyogs kha na ma tho ba med par bstan pa la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ji ltar phyogs kyi skyon yin zhe na /
translated: Since that is the same for a faultless position, how can it be a fault of the position?

original: de'i tshig las nges pa mi skye ba'i phyir tshig skyon yon chags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshig las nges pa mi skye ba'i phyir tshig skyon yon chags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The fault of the words is not that certainty does not arise from them.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how?

original: gang zhig tshig ji tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba de mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig tshig ji tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba de mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not establish what is to be established by just those words.

original: dam bca' ba'i tshig gis ni rang gis bsam pa srid par bstan par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i tshig gis ni rang gis bsam pa srid par bstan par bya ba yin na /
translated: The words of a thesis are meant to indicate what one intends to prove.

original: de ni ji ltar tshad mas gnod na mi srid pa bzhin du gcig la 'gal ba nye bar sdud na yang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar tshad mas gnod na mi srid pa bzhin du gcig la 'gal ba nye bar sdud na yang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it is contradicted by a valid cognition, then it is impossible, just as it is impossible for a contradiction to be present in a single thing.

original: @198b gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par ni tshig gi skyon gtsor byed pa yin gyi don gyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: @198b gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par ni tshig gi skyon gtsor byed pa yin gyi don gyi ni ma yin te /
translated: In an inference for the sake of others, verbal faults are primary, not faults of meaning.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par rjod pas smra ba po la klan kar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par rjod pas smra ba po la klan kar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the speaker is open to criticism if he expresses the meaning incorrectly.

original: gal te rang gi tshig dang khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba dag la bye brag ci yang med na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi tshig dang khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba dag la bye brag ci yang med na /
translated: If there is no difference between contradicting one‚Äôs own words and contradicting what one has accepted,

original: 'o na sngar khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba'i yul la bye brag ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na sngar khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba'i yul la bye brag ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: then what is the difference between contradicting what one has previously accepted and contradicting a subject that is established for both oneself and one‚Äôs opponent?

original: gzhung lugs 'ga' zhig la ma brten par gang la spyod pa mi 'jug pa de ni med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar brten par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhung lugs 'ga' zhig la ma brten par gang la spyod pa mi 'jug pa de ni med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar brten par bya ba yin no //
translated: If one does not engage in debate without relying on some scriptural tradition, then one must rely on that tradition, because one cannot debate without it.

original: des na 'di'i gegs byed pa'i yul ni de nyid yin la /
analyzed: des na 'di'i gegs byed pa'i yul ni de nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, the object that is the impediment to this is just that.

original: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i thams cad du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i thams cad du brjod pa yin no //
translated: And it is expressed everywhere in contradiction to your own words.

original: 'di la yang gzhan la gdon mi za bar brten pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: 'di la yang gzhan la gdon mi za bar brten pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: And here, what is there to rely on for the other?

original: de nyid kyis don de gzhan gyi kha nas rnam par gzhag nas yang 'gog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis don de gzhan gyi kha nas rnam par gzhag nas yang 'gog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he himself, having established the meaning from the words of another, then refutes it.

original: grags pa yang 'gal ba'i don gyi dam bca' ba la gnod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: grags pa yang 'gal ba'i don gyi dam bca' ba la gnod par byed pa yin te /
translated: And also, the meaning of the thesis that is contradictory to what is renowned is undermined.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pas 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ni don rnams la dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pas 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ni don rnams la dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to negate the fact that things are expressed by the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù due to their connection with mere desire, which is the wish of a person.

original: tha snyad las skyes pa'i chos de ni grags pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: tha snyad las skyes pa'i chos de ni grags pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: That property that arises from convention is expressed by the word ‚Äúrenowned.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i phyir thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis byas pa dang ma byas pa'i sgrar rung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa'i phyir thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis byas pa dang ma byas pa'i sgrar rung ba yin la /
translated: Because it operates due to mere desire, everything is suitable as the word ‚Äúmade‚Äù or ‚Äúunmade‚Äù by nature.

original: byung ba'am 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sgra'i rung ba nyid don tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa des ni de 'gog pa la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: byung ba'am 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sgra'i rung ba nyid don tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa des ni de 'gog pa la gnod pa yin no //
translated: The mere fact that a word is applicable to something, whether it has occurred in that sense before or not, is the basis for the refutation of the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de rung ba'i stobs nyid kyis dngos su na sgra thams cad de la 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir de la grags pa med kyang de grub par bshad de /
analyzed: de rung ba'i stobs nyid kyis dngos su na sgra thams cad de la 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir de la grags pa med kyang de grub par bshad de /
translated: Since the word is directly related to the mere fact of applicability, the word is related to that fact, even if it is not well known.

original: gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med la /
analyzed: gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med la /
translated: Since it is not shared by others, there is no inference.

original: sgra las byung ba'i grags pa dang 'gal ba'i don gyis na bsal ba de yang phyogs ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i grags pa dang 'gal ba'i don gyis na bsal ba de yang phyogs ma yin no zhes so //
translated: And since the meaning is not contradicted by what is well known from the word, it is not a non-locus.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnod pa'i gtan tshigs ni thun mong ma yin pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnod pa'i gtan tshigs ni thun mong ma yin pa yin te /
translated: For this very reason, the reason for the refutation is not shared by others,

original: gang la yang zla bo ma yin pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde @199a * //üîΩskad du rjod pa ni 'di dgag par mi nus pa nyid dam /
analyzed: gang la yang zla bo ma yin pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro // de @199a * // skad du rjod pa ni 'di dgag par mi nus pa nyid dam /
translated: because it is not established for anyone else.üîΩThe statement that it is impossible to refute that is because

original: zla bo'i tshad ma med pas nges par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla bo'i tshad ma med pas nges par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is certain that there is no valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: de 'gog pa ni rjes su dpag pa las 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'gog pa ni rjes su dpag pa las 'gyur te /
translated: Its refutation is by inference,

original: mngon sum gyis ni rung ba nyid mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni rung ba nyid mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because direct perception does not ascertain the possibility.

original: gang la yod pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba med pa de la ni gtan tshigs thams cad thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la yod pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba med pa de la ni gtan tshigs thams cad thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
translated: And when something does not have the pervasion of existence, then all reasons are inconclusive.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni dper brjod pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni dper brjod pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the result of the example.

original: sgra ni brda la brten pa yin la de yang 'dod pa tsam la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni brda la brten pa yin la de yang 'dod pa tsam la brten pa yin te /
translated: Sound is based on convention, and that is based on mere desire.

original: des na sgras grub pa dag ni ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i grags pa dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na sgras grub pa dag ni ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i grags pa dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in order to show that what is established by sound is not established, he says, ‚Äúwhat is well known from sound.‚Äù

original: gegs yod par dogs pa rnams ni the tshom za bas mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gegs yod par dogs pa rnams ni the tshom za bas mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Those who doubt the existence of an obstruction are not established because of doubt.

original: yun ring por ma mthong ba rnams la yang phyis snang ba skye ba mthong ba'i phyir srid pa yin na skyes bu tsam gyis de med pa mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring por ma mthong ba rnams la yang phyis snang ba skye ba mthong ba'i phyir srid pa yin na skyes bu tsam gyis de med pa mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is possible that what is not seen for a long time will appear later, because it is seen that appearances arise. But a mere person does not ascertain its nonexistence.

original: des na tshad mas nges par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na tshad mas nges par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is ascertained by a valid cognition,

original: don gyis go bas rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba la mi 'khrul ba can med par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyis go bas rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba la mi 'khrul ba can med par ston pa yin no //
translated: it is shown that there is no non-erroneous object of inference that is understood by implication.

original: 'dis ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag bshad pa yin te /
translated: This explains direct perception and inference,

original: gnyi ga yang tshad mar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang tshad mar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between the two in terms of being valid cognitions.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa gcig la 'gran zla mthong ba'i phyir mngon sum yang de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa gcig la 'gran zla mthong ba'i phyir mngon sum yang de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Direct perception would also be like that, because it sees a rival of a single thing that possesses a defining characteristic.

original: gang zhig nges par sgrub par byed par 'jog pa tshad ma'i mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'i khyad par ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig nges par sgrub par byed par 'jog pa tshad ma'i mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'i khyad par ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no difference from the definition of a valid cognition in positing that which definitely establishes,

original: gang gi phyir khyad par de las phyi rol du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par de las phyi rol du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: because that which is external to that difference would be an inference that is a valid cognition.

original: rjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can nyid kyis 'gran zla ma bstan pa tshad ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: rjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can nyid kyis 'gran zla ma bstan pa tshad ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: There is no fault, because a valid cognition that does not indicate a rival is a valid cognition by virtue of having the number of one that is desired to be expressed.

original: 'di la 'gran zla med do zhes 'di 'dra ba'i nges pa srid pa yod dam /
analyzed: 'di la 'gran zla med do zhes 'di 'dra ba'i nges pa srid pa yod dam /
translated: Is it possible to have such a certainty as this: ‚ÄúThere is no rival to this‚Äù?

original: mtshan nyid khyad par med pa la mthong ba ni gzhan la ldog pa nges par byed mi nus @199b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid khyad par med pa la mthong ba ni gzhan la ldog pa nges par byed mi nus @199b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one sees a non-difference in the definition, one cannot ascertain the difference in the instances.

original: zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: skyes bu'i spobs pa'i dbang gis tshad ma dag gi mtshan nyid rjod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i spobs pa'i dbang gis tshad ma dag gi mtshan nyid rjod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not that the definition of the valid cognitions is stated by the power of the speaker‚Äôs eloquence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: dngos po gnas pas yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gnas pas yin no //
translated: It is because of the stability of the entity.

original: de yang de ltar nges par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang de ltar nges par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And that cannot be ascertained in that way.

original: des na mtshan nyid la the tshom za ba de ni tha snyad du mi rung ste /
analyzed: des na mtshan nyid la the tshom za ba de ni tha snyad du mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, when there is doubt about the definition, it is not suitable for conventional usage,

original: phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa la the tshom za ba bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa la the tshom za ba bzhin no //
translated: just like when there is doubt about the property of the position and so on.

original: mtshan nyid la shes pa smos pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid la shes pa smos pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because the definition mentions knowledge.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis rjes su dpag pa la ni de'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gran zla mi srid pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can med pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis rjes su dpag pa la ni de'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gran zla mi srid pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can med pa yin no //
translated: In the case of an inference having the characteristics as explained, there is no possibility of a rival having the same characteristics, and therefore there is no contradiction in the case of an inference.

original: de'i phyir rjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can nyid kyang yul 'di la mi 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can nyid kyang yul 'di la mi 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: And so, the one-sidedness of the thesis is not acceptable in this case.

original: 'di'i yul ni bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yul ni bshad par bya'o //
translated: The subject matter of this is to be explained.

original: de'i phyir de ltar tshad ma dag gnod par byed par rjod pa ni de las ngas par rjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar tshad ma dag gnod par byed par rjod pa ni de las ngas par rjod pa yin no //
translated: So, the statement that the valid cognitions are contradictory is a statement of what is not the case.

original: des na gnyen po bcas pa srid pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: des na gnyen po bcas pa srid pa sel bar byed do //
translated: And so, the opponent is eliminated along with his antidote.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can med par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can med par ston pa yin no //
translated: And so, it is shown that there is no contradiction in the case of an inference.

original: yang na 'jig rten gyi rjod pa la rjes su dpag pa med par rjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gyi rjod pa la rjes su dpag pa med par rjod pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it is said that there is no inference in worldly discourse.

original: des ni grags pa rjes su dpag pa las yul tha dad pa yin no zhes rjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni grags pa rjes su dpag pa las yul tha dad pa yin no zhes rjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And so, it is said that the subject matter of an inference is different from that of a popular convention.

original: des na dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa las grags pa yul tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa las grags pa yul tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the inference is known to have a different object,

original: de dngos po'i dbang gis 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dngos po'i dbang gis 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: it does not operate by the power of real entities.

original: ri bong can zla bar mi 'dod pa de grags pa gzhan gang zhig 'dod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ri bong can zla bar mi 'dod pa de grags pa gzhan gang zhig 'dod par 'gyur te /
translated: What other well-known object is accepted as the moon, if the rabbit-bearer is not accepted as the moon?

original: de'i phyir de la rjes su dpag pa'i dpe med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la rjes su dpag pa'i dpe med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it has no example in inference.

original: des na thun mong ma yin par bshad do //
analyzed: des na thun mong ma yin par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained as not being common.

original: gang gi phyir dpe gcig po de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas de skad bshad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dpe gcig po de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas de skad bshad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that this is explained in terms of that very single example,

original: mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a characteristic.

original: 'di ltar shing sha pa shing ma yin no zhes bya ba la yang gnod pa'i @200a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar shing sha pa shing ma yin no zhes bya ba la yang gnod pa'i @200a * //
translated: Because it would contradict the statement, ‚ÄúA ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is not a tree.‚Äù

original: phyir ro // 'jig rten na ga pur dang dngul la sogs pa la mthong ba'i phyir 'dir yang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir ro // 'jig rten na ga pur dang dngul la sogs pa la mthong ba'i phyir 'dir yang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because camphor, silver, and so on are seen in the world, it would not be uncommon here.

original: brda la 'jug pa la ni thun mong ma yin pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: brda la 'jug pa la ni thun mong ma yin pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But in the case of a conventional expression, there is no such thing as a unique expression.

original: gal te de la 'ga' zhig tu grub na dngos po'i dbang gis grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de la 'ga' zhig tu grub na dngos po'i dbang gis grub pa yin te /
translated: If it were established in some cases, it would be established by the power of the thing.
