translated: That fault does not exist, because it is like this.

original: gcig dmigs nyams su myong ba las //
analyzed: gcig dmigs nyams su myong ba las //
translated: From the experience of the apprehension of one,

original: 'di ni dmigs so zhes bya'am //
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs so zhes bya'am //
translated: it is said, This is apprehended.

original: mi dmigs so zhes rtog can gyi //
analyzed: mi dmigs so zhes rtog can gyi //
translated: ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù you say, ‚Äúit is not so.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: blo ni skye bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: blo ni skye bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-apprehension‚Äù is the cognition of the conceptualist.

original: gang las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba dngos po rnams kyi rang gi yul can gyi shes pa med pa tsam gyis ni 'di mi dmigs so zhes bya ba de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba dngos po rnams kyi rang gi yul can gyi shes pa med pa tsam gyis ni 'di mi dmigs so zhes bya ba de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The mere absence of a cognition that has an object of its own does not constitute the non-apprehension of that object, from which the expression ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù would follow.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then, does constitute it?

original: rang las khyad par can gyi shes pa yod pa las te /
analyzed: rang las khyad par can gyi shes pa yod pa las te /
translated: The existence of a cognition that is different from it.

original: 'ga' zhig tu thams cad ma rtogs na dngos po med par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir 'ga' zhig mngon sum du gyur na de'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis 'di ni dmigs so zhe'am /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu thams cad ma rtogs na dngos po med par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir 'ga' zhig mngon sum du gyur na de'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis 'di ni dmigs so zhe'am /
translated: For if one does not cognize everything, one does not cognize the non-existence of an entity.

original: gzhan dmigs so zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dmigs so zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when something is directly perceived, the two concepts ‚Äúthis is apprehended‚Äù or ‚Äúthat is apprehended‚Äù arise by the power of the valid cognition of that [perception].

original: gang gi phyir don gyi @206b khyad par rtogs pa ni myong ba'i khyad par las yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gyi @206b khyad par rtogs pa ni myong ba'i khyad par las yin la /
translated: The cognition of a particular object is due to the experience of a particular object.

original: myong ba'i khyad par rtogs pa ni rnam pa de lta bu'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba las yin no //
analyzed: myong ba'i khyad par rtogs pa ni rnam pa de lta bu'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba las yin no //
translated: The difference in experience is understood from the experience of that kind of aspect.

original: des na rang nyid grub pa'i khyad par ni don gyi don khyad par du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang nyid grub pa'i khyad par ni don gyi don khyad par du byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the difference in establishment is the difference in the object.

original: de lta ma yin na ni myong ba'i khyad par yang myong ba gzhan gyi khyad par las yin /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni myong ba'i khyad par yang myong ba gzhan gyi khyad par las yin /
translated: Otherwise, the difference in experience would be from the difference in another experience.

original: de'i yang gzhan las yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i yang gzhan las yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And that would be from another, and so on,

original: thug pa med par 'gyur bas khyad par 'ga' yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur bas khyad par 'ga' yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: so that no difference would be established at all, because there would be an infinite regress.

original: don ni rang gi yod pa dang khyad par dag gi de bsgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don ni rang gi yod pa dang khyad par dag gi de bsgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: The object is not established by the existence and difference of itself.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: rang gi shes pa'i yod pa dang khyad par dag gis te /
analyzed: rang gi shes pa'i yod pa dang khyad par dag gis te /
translated: It is established by the existence and difference of its own cognition.

original: des na rang dbang du grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rang dbang du grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not established independently.

original: da bzhin du myong ba na myong ba gzhan gyi yod pa dang khyad par dag las de grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da bzhin du myong ba na myong ba gzhan gyi yod pa dang khyad par dag las de grub pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, when it is experienced, it is not established from the existence and difference of another experience,

original: thams cad mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that everything would be cognized.

original: de'i phyir / rang bzhin khyad par can myong las //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rang bzhin khyad par can myong las //
translated: The experience of a special nature

original: gzhan gsal ba ni gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan gsal ba ni gzhan ma yin //
translated: Is not different from the other.

original: de phyir de mi dmigs pa yang //
analyzed: de phyir de mi dmigs pa yang //
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of that

original: de las khyad par can dmigs nyid //
analyzed: de las khyad par can dmigs nyid //
translated: Is the apprehension of something special.

original: des na mi dmigs pa 'di ni //
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa 'di ni //
translated: Thus, this non-apprehension

original: mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa yin //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa yin //
translated: Is established by direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir ma 'brel pa nyams su myong ba rnam pa gcig tu so sor nges pa las gzhan gsal ba ni gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma 'brel pa nyams su myong ba rnam pa gcig tu so sor nges pa las gzhan gsal ba ni gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Because the experience of a disconnected object is not different from the other, which is ascertained in one aspect.

original: de nyid ni nges pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid yod do //
analyzed: de nyid ni nges pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid yod do //
translated: Since that is ascertained, it is ascertained that it exists.

original: zhes nges par byed pa shugs kyis gzhan nam gzhan myong ba med do zhes nges par byed do //
analyzed: zhes nges par byed pa shugs kyis gzhan nam gzhan myong ba med do zhes nges par byed do //
translated: Thus, by implication, it is ascertained that there is no experience of another or of something else.

original: de'i phyir gcig tu nges pa dmigs pa ni gzhan mi dmigs pa dang de med pa'i tha snyad 'grub pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig tu nges pa dmigs pa ni gzhan mi dmigs pa dang de med pa'i tha snyad 'grub pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of something ascertained as one is the non-apprehension of another and the cause for establishing the convention of its non-existence.

original: de yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa yin no //
translated: And that is established by the reflexive awareness of direct perception.

original: gal te rang las khyad par can gyi shes pa med kyang med pa'i blor 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rang las khyad par can gyi shes pa med kyang med pa'i blor 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if there is no consciousness that is superior to itself, then would not the mind become nonexistent?

original: dper na mun khung du lag pa byug pa bzhin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na mun khung du lag pa byug pa bzhin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: For example, it is like the hand that is placed in the dark.

original: der yang de ltar byug pa'i lag pa'i nang gi reg pa'i khyad par dmigs pa las gzhan med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der yang de ltar byug pa'i lag pa'i nang gi reg pa'i khyad par dmigs pa las gzhan med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because in that case, one would understand that there is no other special tactile sensation in the hand that is placed there.

original: nang gi reg pa'i khyad par dmigs pa gang las rtsol ba yod dam med kyang bla ste /
analyzed: nang gi reg pa'i khyad par dmigs pa gang las rtsol ba yod dam med kyang bla ste /
translated: Whether there is or is not a special tactile sensation in the hand, it is still the case that

original: nga'i lag pa byugs so zhes bya bar 'gyur ba de nyid las med par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: nga'i lag pa byugs so zhes bya bar 'gyur ba de nyid las med par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: one understands that the hand is placed there because of the tactile sensation.

original: de med na med par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te dmigs pa'i @207a * //
analyzed: de med na med par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro // gal te dmigs pa'i @207a * //
translated: If there were no tactile sensation, one would not understand that the hand is placed there.üîΩIf the objective conditions exist, then the object is perceived.

original: rkyen rnams yod pa na dmigs su rung ba ma dmigs pas med par 'grub bo //
analyzed: rkyen rnams yod pa na dmigs su rung ba ma dmigs pas med par 'grub bo //
translated: But if the object is not perceived, one understands that it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'ga' zhig med par rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'ga' zhig med par rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, one would not understand that something does not exist in a state of sleep, etc.

original: de na dbang po nus pa ma nyams pa la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na dbang po nus pa ma nyams pa la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the objective condition itself is impaired, such as the impaired potency of the sense faculty.

original: des na khyad par can gyi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir na der 'ga' yang med par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par can gyi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir na der 'ga' yang med par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because there is no objective condition, it is not that one realizes that nothing exists there.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: de 'dra ba'i mi dmigs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i mi dmigs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is because there is no such non-observation.

original: 'dir yang dmigs pa'i rgyu yod pa na /
analyzed: 'dir yang dmigs pa'i rgyu yod pa na /
translated: Here, the statement ‚Äúwhen the cause of observation exists‚Äù

original: zhes bya bas dbang po la sogs pa de dag shes pa la nus pa nyams pa med pas dmigs pa'i 'jug pa bstan par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas dbang po la sogs pa de dag shes pa la nus pa nyams pa med pas dmigs pa'i 'jug pa bstan par byed pa yin te /
translated: indicates that since the sense faculties and so on are not impaired in relation to consciousness, the engagement of observation is taught.

original: gang gi tshe de dag gi 'bras bu 'jug pa de'i tshe de dag nus pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag gi 'bras bu 'jug pa de'i tshe de dag nus pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because when their effect engages, at that time they are not impaired.

original: de yang dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: And that is the objective condition.

original: dmigs su rung ba ma dmigs pas kyang khyad par can dmigs pa de nyid kyi rnam pa gcig tu nges pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs su rung ba ma dmigs pas kyang khyad par can dmigs pa de nyid kyi rnam pa gcig tu nges pa yin te /
translated: Even when the observable object is not observed, the observed object itself is ascertained as one aspect.

original: de'i phyir khyad par can dmigs pa de nyid gzhan mi dmigs pa yin no //üîΩgzhan du don med pa nyid ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par can dmigs pa de nyid gzhan mi dmigs pa yin no // gzhan du don med pa nyid ni //
translated: Therefore, the very perception of the qualified is the non-perception of the other.

original: mi dmigs pa las rtogs par 'gyur //üîΩgzhan gyis dmigs pa med pa nyid //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las rtogs par 'gyur // gzhan gyis dmigs pa med pa nyid //
translated: Non-perception is understood from non-perception of the other.

original: yin pa'i phyir na thug med 'gyur //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir na thug med 'gyur //
translated: Because of the non-perception of the other, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not so.

original: gal te rang gi yul can gyi shes pa med pas dngos po med par 'grub na de med par yang mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub dgos pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur bas dngos po med pa mi rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang gi yul can gyi shes pa med pas dngos po med par 'grub na de med par yang mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub dgos pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur bas dngos po med pa mi rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If non-existence of a thing is established by the non-existence of a cognition having that as its object, then, because it would be necessary to establish that non-existence by another non-perception, there would be an infinite regress, and the non-existence would not be understood.

original: myong ba med pa ni rang nyid 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: myong ba med pa ni rang nyid 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Non-experience does not establish itself,

original: de dang khyad par med pas yul la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang khyad par med pas yul la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the object would also be like that, since it is not different from it.

original: myong ba ni bdag nyid kyi khyad par la sgrub par byed pa gzhan med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: myong ba ni bdag nyid kyi khyad par la sgrub par byed pa gzhan med pa yin gyi /
translated: Experience is not established by another proof with regard to a particular of itself.

original: med pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Non-existence is not like that.

original: gal te gang las skyon 'dir 'gyur ba rang gi yul can gyi shes pa med pas dngos po med pa grub pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te gang las skyon 'dir 'gyur ba rang gi yul can gyi shes pa med pas dngos po med pa grub pa yin la /
translated: If you think that the nonexistence of things is established because the consciousness that perceives them does not exist, then that is not so.

original: rang las khyad par can gyi shes pa yod pa las kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rang las khyad par can gyi shes pa yod pa las kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it established from the existence of a consciousness that is different from itself.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: bum pa dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba dngos po med pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid las yin la de yang tshad ma rang rgyud pa yin no @207b zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba dngos po med pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid las yin la de yang tshad ma rang rgyud pa yin no @207b zhe na /
translated: It is that which is called the nonapprehension of a pot, the apprehension of a nonthing. It is a valid knowledge that is autonomous.

original: de lta na 'o na dngos po med pa rtogs pa de gang las 'gyur te dngos po med pa 'ga'i yang rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na dngos po med pa rtogs pa de gang las 'gyur te dngos po med pa 'ga'i yang rgyu ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then what is the cause of the understanding of a nonthing? A nonthing is not the cause of anything.

original: nus pa med pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: nus pa med pa'i phyir te //
translated: Because it is not a potentiality.

original: nus pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de nyams pa med pas de de las skye ba rtag tu 'byung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de nyams pa med pas de de las skye ba rtag tu 'byung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because potentiality is the characteristic of a thing, and because if it were not impaired, it would follow that it would always arise from it.

original: ltos pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not dependent.

original: ltos pa ni khyad par thob pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltos pa ni khyad par thob pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because dependence is the characteristic of obtaining a distinction, and that is the characteristic of an entity, therefore it is not a non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba yang dngos po bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba yang dngos po bkag pa yin te /
translated: And that which is called a non-entity is the negation of an entity.

original: des na dngos po med pa las skye'o zhes bya bas ni dngos po las mi skye'o zhes rgyu bkag pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa las skye'o zhes bya bas ni dngos po las mi skye'o zhes rgyu bkag pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when it is said that ‚Äúit arises from a non-entity,‚Äù the cause is negated, i.e., ‚Äúit does not arise from an entity.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na ni dngos po med pa zhes dngos po med pa zhes dngos po nyid 'ga' zhig ming gzhan gyis brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni dngos po med pa zhes dngos po med pa zhes dngos po nyid 'ga' zhig ming gzhan gyis brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the expression ‚Äúa non-entity‚Äù would refer to an entity, i.e., it would be a synonym for an entity.

original: de'i phyir rtogs pa de ni srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs pa de ni srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that understanding is not possible.

original: mthong ba'i de ma thag pa yang rang rgyud par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i de ma thag pa yang rang rgyud par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Nor is the immediately preceding condition of seeing autonomous.

original: de'i stobs las skyes pa yin na ni de nyid de la nub pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i stobs las skyes pa yin na ni de nyid de la nub pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it arises from the power of that, then that itself is the sunset of that, and therefore that itself would be valid cognition.

original: de'i rnam pa nges pa'i shugs kyis gzhan spong ba'i phyir te rnam pa gzhan dang 'dres na de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa nges pa'i shugs kyis gzhan spong ba'i phyir te rnam pa gzhan dang 'dres na de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the force of the ascertainment of its aspect excludes the other, because it is not mixed with another aspect.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma gzhan gyi stobs las skyes pa dbang po dang rtags la mi brten pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma gzhan gyi stobs las skyes pa dbang po dang rtags la mi brten pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this non-apprehension that is born from the power of another valid cognition, and that does not depend on a sense faculty or a logical mark, is not a valid cognition.

original: gang gi de ma thag par sgrub pa dang / dgag pa rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba de ltar skyes pa de ni mthong ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi de ma thag par sgrub pa dang / dgag pa rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba de ltar skyes pa de ni mthong ba nyid yin no //
translated: That which is born in such a way that it becomes a conceptual thought that affirms or negates immediately after it, is seeing.

original: dper na sngon po mthong ba ni 'di ni sngon po yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sngon po mthong ba ni 'di ni sngon po yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one sees blue, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is blue, not yellow.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de dag ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, those are not valid cognitions.

original: mi snang nges pa mi rung phyir //
analyzed: mi snang nges pa mi rung phyir //
translated: Because it is not possible to ascertain the non-appearance,

original: gzhan du gzhag pa 'gog 'gyur dper //
analyzed: gzhan du gzhag pa 'gog 'gyur dper //
translated: the exclusion of the other is negated, as in the example

original: sems can gzhan la rtags med kyi //
analyzed: sems can gzhan la rtags med kyi //
translated: of the non-existence of the logical mark in another sentient being,

original: rnam rtog la sogs mi 'grub bzhin //
analyzed: rnam rtog la sogs mi 'grub bzhin //
translated: because the conceptual thought, etc., are not established.

original: 'bras bu nges med can de dag / ldog pa sgrub par nus ma yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu nges med can de dag / ldog pa sgrub par nus ma yin //
translated: and it is not possible to establish the contrapositive.

original: nges pa bsgrub phyir gtan tshigs la //
analyzed: nges pa bsgrub phyir gtan tshigs la //
translated: The reason is for the sake of establishing the definite.

original: dang po dbang du byas pa yin //
analyzed: dang po dbang du byas pa yin //
translated: The first is taken into consideration.üîΩThese are the verses in the middle.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go / rang gi sbyor ba dag la de'i //üîΩrang gi ngo bo sbyor ba'am //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go / rang gi sbyor ba dag la de'i // rang gi ngo bo sbyor ba'am //
translated: In one‚Äôs own application, it is the nature ofüîΩone‚Äôs own nature that is applied,

original: don la gnod byed ngo bo ste //üîΩyod na yod las med phyir ram //
analyzed: don la gnod byed ngo bo ste // yod na yod las med phyir ram //
translated: or the nature that is the refutation of the object.

original: gang gi tshe med par nges @208a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe med par nges @208a * //
translated: If it exists, it is because it exists, and if it does not exist, it is because it does not exist.

original: pa'i 'bras bu can ldog pa bsgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa de rang nyid med pa bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba de'i tshe rang gi ngo bos sbyor te /
analyzed: pa'i 'bras bu can ldog pa bsgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa de rang nyid med pa bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba de'i tshe rang gi ngo bos sbyor te /
translated: When nonapprehension that has the result of the definite negation of the absence is applied for the sake of establishing the absence itself, at that time it is applied by way of its own nature.

original: dper na 'di na du ba med de ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na 'di na du ba med de ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no smoke because it is not apprehended.‚Äù

original: 'di na shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di na shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHere there is no shasha tree because there is no tree.‚Äù

original: 'di na du ba med de me med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: 'di na du ba med de me med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'am /
translated: ‚ÄúHere there is no smoke because there is no fire.‚Äù

original: yang na dgag par bya ba'i don la gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo nye bar bkod pa'i sgo nas rab tu sbyor te /
analyzed: yang na dgag par bya ba'i don la gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo nye bar bkod pa'i sgo nas rab tu sbyor te /
translated: Or else, it is applied by way of positing the nature of the object of negation as that which is to be refuted.

original: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
analyzed: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch,

original: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: because there is fire.‚Äù

original: star dper brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: star dper brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the example of the myrobalan.

original: 'gal ba de yang ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'gal ba de yang ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How is that contradiction understood?

original: 'ga' zhig tu rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba las gzhan yod na med pa'i phyir 'gal bar rtogs te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba las gzhan yod na med pa'i phyir 'gal bar rtogs te /
translated: It is understood as contradictory because when the cause is complete, it does not occur, but something else does.

original: dper na grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the touch of cold and the touch of heat.

original: phan tshun tha dad grub phyir te //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad grub phyir te //
translated: Because they are established as mutually different,

original: brtan dngos dang ni 'jig pa bzhin //
analyzed: brtan dngos dang ni 'jig pa bzhin //
translated: like a stable thing and a disintegrating thing.

original: yang na phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Or else, they are contradictory by the character of mutually excluding each other,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
translated: like permanent and impermanent.

original: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir yang ste //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir yang ste //
translated: And because they are harmed by valid knowledge,

original: ltos bcas dang ni nges dngos bzhin //
analyzed: ltos bcas dang ni nges dngos bzhin //
translated: like that which is dependent and that which is real.

original: yang na gal te de nyid la tshad mas gnod par byed pa yin na de'i rtags dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gal te de nyid la tshad mas gnod par byed pa yin na de'i rtags dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or, if it is damaged by a valid cognition in reality, then the reason would be contradictory.

original: dper na ltos pa dang nges pa'i dngos po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ltos pa dang nges pa'i dngos po bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the case of a thing that is dependent and ascertained.

original: tshad ma yang de'i rgyu smra ba rnams kyi skye ba dang ldan par khas blangs pa dag ni 'jig par nges pa med do //
analyzed: tshad ma yang de'i rgyu smra ba rnams kyi skye ba dang ldan par khas blangs pa dag ni 'jig par nges pa med do //
translated: Also, the cause of a valid cognition is not definitely destroyed by the proponents of the existence of arising, because they accept that it depends on another that is of the same nature.

original: de'i ngo bor 'gyur ba gzhan la ltos par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bor 'gyur ba gzhan la ltos par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that it depends on another that is of the same nature.

original: gang zhig gang ngo bor 'gyur ba gzhan la ltos par khas blangs pa de ni de'i ngo bor nges par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang ngo bor 'gyur ba gzhan la ltos par khas blangs pa de ni de'i ngo bor nges par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is accepted as depending on another that is of the same nature is not ascertained as being of that nature.

original: dper na gos la tshon bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gos la tshon bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a cloth and dye.

original: de'i rgyu rnams kyang der nges pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu rnams kyang der nges pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that there is no error because its causes are ascertained as that, that is not so.

original: de dag tshang ba dang gegs med par ma nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag tshang ba dang gegs med par ma nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not ascertained that they are complete and without obstruction.

original: de yod na rang gi rgyu'i tshogs pa la rag las pa de la mngon du phyogs pa gzhan dag kyang yod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yod na rang gi rgyu'i tshogs pa la rag las pa de la mngon du phyogs pa gzhan dag kyang yod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: If it exists, then it would not be the case that other things that are dependent on the collection of their own causes would also exist,

original: rag ma las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rag ma las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not dependent.

original: de'i chos ma yin na yang de nyid las de skad cig ma nyid du 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i chos ma yin na yang de nyid las de skad cig ma nyid du 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not its property, then it would be just that which is asserted to be momentary.

original: de nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir sngar med pa ni phyis kyang med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir sngar med pa ni phyis kyang med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from that, it follows that what did not exist previously would not exist later.

original: de'am de'i rgyu mi @208b rtag pa nyid kyi rgyu nges par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin na de'i ngo bo'am de skyed par byed par ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: de'am de'i rgyu mi @208b rtag pa nyid kyi rgyu nges par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin na de'i ngo bo'am de skyed par byed par ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: If it or its cause is the nature that determines the cause of impermanence, then why not assert that it is its nature or that it produces it?

original: brgyud pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: brgyud pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the use of a succession?

original: mthar de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid de'i ngo bor nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid de'i ngo bor nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the end, it is capable of that nature, its own nature.

original: 'dis ni res 'ga' ba'i ngo bo nyid ltos pa med pa dang 'gal ba yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni res 'ga' ba'i ngo bo nyid ltos pa med pa dang 'gal ba yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the contradiction of a nature that sometimes exists without depending on anything else.

original: gal te 'gal ba de lta bu dag kyang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kho nas 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba de lta bu dag kyang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kho nas 'gal ba yin te /
translated: But even such contradictions are contradictory only because they are mutually exclusive and directly contradictory.

original: nges pa med pas nges pa la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med pas nges pa la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they are not certain, they do not contradict certainty.

original: tshad mas ni 'gal zla sgrub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: tshad mas ni 'gal zla sgrub par byed pa yin la /
translated: Valid cognition establishes the contradictory of the object of negation.

original: gnod pa ni de nyid kyis yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa ni de nyid kyis yin te /
translated: And it is that which contradicts it.

original: de'i phyir tshad mas gnod pas 'gal ba ni ma yin no zhe na bden te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad mas gnod pas 'gal ba ni ma yin no zhe na bden te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that contradiction is contradicted by valid cognition.

original: 'gal bas khyad pa'i rang bzhin gyis kyang don du 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal bas khyad pa'i rang bzhin gyis kyang don du 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That is true, but because the nature of contradiction is also contradictory,

original: de nye bar bkod pas mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de skad brjod de /
analyzed: de nye bar bkod pas mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de skad brjod de /
translated: it is stated in that way in order to demonstrate that the statement of contradiction is a syllogism of nonobservation.

original: dper na dper brjod ma thag pa'i sbyor ba de nyid bzhin no //üîΩci ste gtso bo la sogs pa de dag ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na dper brjod ma thag pa'i sbyor ba de nyid bzhin no // ci ste gtso bo la sogs pa de dag ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, it is like the syllogism just explained.

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la ji ltar med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa'am yod pa'i tha snyad bkag par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la ji ltar med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa'am yod pa'i tha snyad bkag par 'gyur /
translated: But if you say that those things such as prakriti do not exist because they are not observed, then how could the statement of their nonexistence establish a convention or contradict a convention of existence?

original: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it not so?

original: don de dgag pa la chos can brjod pa'i tshig sbyar ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don de dgag pa la chos can brjod pa'i tshig sbyar ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because in the negation of the object, the words expressing the subject are not applied.

original: de ma bkag pa'i phyir yul med pa'i bkag pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ma bkag pa'i phyir yul med pa'i bkag pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because that is not negated, it is not possible to negate the object.

original: skyon 'di ni med de /üîΩ'di ltar / thog med bag chags las byung ba'i //
analyzed: skyon 'di ni med de / 'di ltar / thog med bag chags las byung ba'i //
translated: This fault does not exist.üîΩThus:üîΩThe conceptual thought that arises from beginningless latent propensities

original: rnam par rtog pas yongs bsgrub pa //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas yongs bsgrub pa //
translated: Fully establishes

original: yod med gnyi ga la brten pa //
analyzed: yod med gnyi ga la brten pa //
translated: The object of expression of words, which is based on both existence and nonexistence,

original: sgra don chos ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: sgra don chos ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: The phenomenon that has three aspects.

original: de dngos nyer len can min par //
analyzed: de dngos nyer len can min par //
translated: That is not the substantial entity that appropriates,

original: sgrub la de ni de lta bur //üîΩmi dmigs gtan tshigs de nyid ni //
analyzed: sgrub la de ni de lta bur // mi dmigs gtan tshigs de nyid ni //
translated: But in the proof of that, it is like that.

original: med pa ma yin sgra sbyor phyir //
analyzed: med pa ma yin sgra sbyor phyir //
translated: The reason is that non-apprehension is not nonexistence, because the word is applied.

original: sgra 'di dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra 'di dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni ma yin te /
translated: These words are not the objects of their own characteristics.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi bag chags las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don nyid du bdag gir byed do //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi bag chags las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don nyid du bdag gir byed do //
translated: They are taken as the very objects that appear to conceptual thought that arises from latent propensities that have existed since beginningless time.

original: de ni 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i rnam par rtog pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: This shows the conceptualization of the expounder and the listener.

original: ji ltar snang ba'i dngos po bstan par 'dod pas sbyor ba'i phyir dang / de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnye bar len pa dang 'bras bu'i shes pa la snang ba ma yin @209a * //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba'i dngos po bstan par 'dod pas sbyor ba'i phyir dang / de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro // nye bar len pa dang 'bras bu'i shes pa la snang ba ma yin @209a * //
translated: Because it is the basis for the desire to teach the thing as it appears, and because it generates the conceptualization that has the form of that.

original: pa'i rang bzhin ni de'i yul nyid du nges par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin ni de'i yul nyid du nges par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the object that does not appear in the cognition of the appropriator and the result is not capable of being ascertained as its object.

original: rnam par rtog pa de ni yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i shes pas bskyed pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i phyir de la snang ba'i rnam par zhen pa'i dbang gis dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga'i chos zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de ni yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i shes pas bskyed pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i phyir de la snang ba'i rnam par zhen pa'i dbang gis dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga'i chos zhes brjod do //
translated: That conceptualization arises from the latent impressions produced by the cognitions of existence, nonexistence, and both. Therefore, it is said that the appearance in that conceptualization is the adherence to the nature of things, nonthings, and both.

original: de'i phyir chos can de la gnas pa rnams kyi gtso bo'i sgra las snang ba'i don 'di dngos po'i nye bar len pa can yin nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can de la gnas pa rnams kyi gtso bo'i sgra las snang ba'i don 'di dngos po'i nye bar len pa can yin nam /
translated: Therefore, in regard to that subject, the word ‚Äúprincipal‚Äù refers to the object of appearance, which is the appropriator of the thing.

original: 'on te ma yin zhes yod pa dang med pa nyid du sems par byed do //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes yod pa dang med pa nyid du sems par byed do //
translated: Or else, one thinks that it is not so, that it is nonexistent.

original: de dngos po'i nye bar len pa can ma yin par sgrub pa la so so rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir spang bar 'os pa ma yin pa'i don de ni chos can yin no //
analyzed: de dngos po'i nye bar len pa can ma yin par sgrub pa la so so rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir spang bar 'os pa ma yin pa'i don de ni chos can yin no //
translated: This object, which is not to be abandoned because it is established as not having a real substratum and because it is intuited by each one for himself, is the subject.

original: don de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes ni brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: don de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes ni brjod par mi nus te /
translated: But it cannot be said that this object is the own-characteristic,

original: ma thob pa dang 'gags pa'i don dag la yang de mi ldog pa'i phyir dang / dngos po la phyin ci log gi rnam par mngon par zhen pa mu stegs byed gzhan gyi shes pa la yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma thob pa dang 'gags pa'i don dag la yang de mi ldog pa'i phyir dang / dngos po la phyin ci log gi rnam par mngon par zhen pa mu stegs byed gzhan gyi shes pa la yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not excluded that it is the object of the knowledge of other heretics who are attached to the false notion of a real entity, even though the object is not present and has ceased.

original: gcig tu don dam la 'jug na //üîΩlta ba'i bye brag gzhan dag gi //
analyzed: gcig tu don dam la 'jug na // lta ba'i bye brag gzhan dag gi //
translated: When one enters into the ultimate reality in a single way,üîΩthe words do not apply to the objects of the other views,

original: don rnams la ni sgra rnams dag / rgyu med can 'jug mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: don rnams la ni sgra rnams dag / rgyu med can 'jug mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: because they do not apply without a cause.

original: 'das dang ma skyes pa la yang //
analyzed: 'das dang ma skyes pa la yang //
translated: And also with regard to the past and future,

original: tshig 'ga' zhig kyang brdzun pa yi //
analyzed: tshig 'ga' zhig kyang brdzun pa yi //
translated: no word is false.

original: don can nyid du mi 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: don can nyid du mi 'gyur phyir //
translated: because it is not the case that they are not meaningful.

original: 'di dag blo don yul can 'dod //
analyzed: 'di dag blo don yul can 'dod //
translated: They are asserted to be the objects of the cognition of the meaning.

original: ces bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: These are the verses that summarize the chapter.

original: de la ji ltar 'dod pa'i rang bzhin gyi nye bar len pa can ma yin par bsgrub par bya ba la de ltar mi dmigs pa'i chos yod pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ji ltar 'dod pa'i rang bzhin gyi nye bar len pa can ma yin par bsgrub par bya ba la de ltar mi dmigs pa'i chos yod pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: In this context, the non-establishment of the property of the probandum is not the case, because the non-perception of the object of the desire is established in the proof of the absence of the nature of desire as the appropriator.

original: 'dir sgra'i rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don de nyid la bsnyen pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sgra'i rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don de nyid la bsnyen pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Here, the object that appears in the conceptualization of the word is not the referent,

original: de blo la bzhag pa'i don du sgra sbyar ba'i phyir dang / de med na de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de blo la bzhag pa'i don du sgra sbyar ba'i phyir dang / de med na de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word is applied to the object that is posited in the cognition, and because if that does not exist, that is not possible.

original: gzhan yang / sgra don bsnyon pa med rnams kyis //üîΩyod med phyogs kyi bye brag gis //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sgra don bsnyon pa med rnams kyis // yod med phyogs kyi bye brag gis //
translated: Moreover,üîΩThe existence and non-existence of things

original: dngos po nyid ni dpyad bya ste //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni dpyad bya ste //
translated: are to be analyzed by means of the distinctions of the positionsüîΩof the non-mistaken meanings of the words.

original: de la 'bras 'byung rag las phyir //
analyzed: de la 'bras 'byung rag las phyir //
translated: Because the arising of the effect depends on that.

original: sgra'i don ni yod dam med kyang rung skyes bu'i don cung zad nyams pa'am 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i don ni yod dam med kyang rung skyes bu'i don cung zad nyams pa'am 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Whether the meaning of the word exists or does not exist, the meaning of the person is not in the least diminished or established.

original: ji ltar mngon par zhen pa bzhin de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de kho @209b na nyid ji lta ba bzhin 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par zhen pa bzhin de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de kho @209b na nyid ji lta ba bzhin 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reality as it is imagined, and because reality as it is is not accepted.

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe 'di yod pa dang med par spyod pa 'jug pa na rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba spangs te gang la skyes bu'i don 'di 'brel pa dngos po nyid la gnas par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe 'di yod pa dang med par spyod pa 'jug pa na rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba spangs te gang la skyes bu'i don 'di 'brel pa dngos po nyid la gnas par byed de /
translated: Therefore, at all times, when engaging in the existence or nonexistence of this, one should abandon the appearance of conceptualization and abide in the reality that is connected with the meaning of the person.

original: ji ltar grang ba sel ba la sogs pa la me bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar grang ba sel ba la sogs pa la me bzhin no //
translated: Just as one uses fire to dispel cold and so on.

original: de la sgra'i don ni nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sgra'i don ni nus pa ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, the meaning of the word is not the capacity,

original: de nyams su myong bar gyur kyang de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyams su myong bar gyur kyang de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if it is experienced, it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir don bya ba don du gnyer ba 'di de mi nus pa la ched du gnyer bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don bya ba don du gnyer ba 'di de mi nus pa la ched du gnyer bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable for one who seeks the meaning of the purpose to strive for that which is incapable.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dag ma ning gzugs bzang ba dang ngan pa brtags pa la lhur gnyer ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dag ma ning gzugs bzang ba dang ngan pa brtags pa la lhur gnyer ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Those who possess desire do not strive to examine whether a neuter is beautiful or ugly.

original: gang yang de skad du brtags pa'i chos mi dmigs pa zhes bshad pa'i don ci yin zhe na /üîΩrtog pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid kyis sgra'i don nyid brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: gang yang de skad du brtags pa'i chos mi dmigs pa zhes bshad pa'i don ci yin zhe na / rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid kyis sgra'i don nyid brtags pa yin la /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement that the non-apprehension of the imagined reality is the non-apprehension of the object of conceptual differentiation?

original: dngos po la brten par mi dmigs pa nyid ni de'i chos yin no zhes dgongs pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la brten par mi dmigs pa nyid ni de'i chos yin no zhes dgongs pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that the object of conceptual cognition is the object of the word, and the non-apprehension of that which is based on an entity is its reality.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas pa yin te /
translated: The non-apprehension of intrinsic reality is included in the reason of intrinsic reality. This is the correct position.

original: de'i phyir de ni dper brjod pa nyid kyi dper brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni dper brjod pa nyid kyi dper brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is an example of an example.

original: de yang 'jigs pa la byas pa dang yod pa nyid bzhin du khyad par gyi bye brag la ltos pa'am 'ba' zhig bstan par bya ba yin no zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: de yang 'jigs pa la byas pa dang yod pa nyid bzhin du khyad par gyi bye brag la ltos pa'am 'ba' zhig bstan par bya ba yin no zhes brjod zin to //
translated: Moreover, it has already been stated that this is to be demonstrated either in dependence on a particular distinction, like the existence of fear, or by itself.

original: de la / gal te gtan tshigs yod rang bzhin //
analyzed: de la / gal te gtan tshigs yod rang bzhin //
translated: If the reason is existent,

original: yod pa ji ltar bsgrub bya min //
analyzed: yod pa ji ltar bsgrub bya min //
translated: How can it be the probandum?

original: bye brag rjes 'gro med pa ni //
analyzed: bye brag rjes 'gro med pa ni //
translated: If it is not concomitant with the specific,

original: gtan tshigs bsgrub bya dag 'gal nyid //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bsgrub bya dag 'gal nyid //
translated: The reason is contradictory to the probandum.

original: gal te yod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dam gzhan la gtan tshigs yin na bsgrub par bya bar yang ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: gal te yod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dam gzhan la gtan tshigs yin na bsgrub par bya bar yang ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: If the impermanence of the existent or the other is the reason, why is it not accepted as the probandum?

original: de de ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin na khyad par can du 'gyur na /
analyzed: de de ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin na khyad par can du 'gyur na /
translated: If it is the probandum in that way, it becomes the specific.

original: khyad par ni bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par ni bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: But the specific cannot be proven,

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not concomitant.

original: zhes grags te /
analyzed: zhes grags te /
translated: This is well known.

original: ji skad du tshad ma'i yul mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du tshad ma'i yul mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúBecause the object of valid knowledge is not known.‚Äù

original: khyad par de bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'gal bar ni ma zad do //
analyzed: khyad par de bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'gal bar ni ma zad do //
translated: Not only is it contradictory for that specific to be the probandum,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: but what else?

original: gtan tshigs su yang skyon mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs su yang skyon mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fault is similar in the reason.

original: gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni grub pa'i yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni grub pa'i yan lag ma yin te /
translated: A reason that is not concomitant is not a part of the proof.

original: de las the tshom za @210a * //
analyzed: de las the tshom za @210a * //
translated: Because of that, there is doubt.üîΩThis fault does not exist.

original: ba'i phyir ro zhe na skyon 'di ni med de /üîΩ'di ltar / dngos po'i khyad par tsam zhig ni //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ro zhe na skyon 'di ni med de / 'di ltar / dngos po'i khyad par tsam zhig ni //
translated: Because:üîΩThe mere specific thingüîΩIs established as a general property.

original: spyi yi chos can la bsgrubs na //
analyzed: spyi yi chos can la bsgrubs na //
translated: If one establishes a specific thing,

original: don 'ga' zhig kyang 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: don 'ga' zhig kyang 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: One does not establish any meaning.

original: de 'dra ba ni bkag pa med //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni bkag pa med //
translated: Such is not refuted.

original: thams cad du yod pa bsgrubs na khyad par bsgrub par gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du yod pa bsgrubs na khyad par bsgrub par gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If one establishes that something exists in all aspects, it is not that one establishes a specific thing.

original: chos 'ga' zhig yod do zhes dngos po tsam gyi khyad par sgrub pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par ma bstan par 'ga' zhig yod pa tsam la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos 'ga' zhig yod do zhes dngos po tsam gyi khyad par sgrub pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par ma bstan par 'ga' zhig yod pa tsam la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: If one establishes the mere specific thing ‚Äúsomething exists,‚Äù without teaching a specific nature that establishes it, there is no contradiction in saying ‚Äúsomething exists.‚Äù

original: 'dir re zhig yod pa'i sgrub byed 'gog pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir re zhig yod pa'i sgrub byed 'gog pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, one does not refute the proof of existence.

original: 'on kyang de ltar 'ga' zhig yod do zhes 'di'i khyad par 'gal ba yang ma reg par smra bas rang gi don ci zig rgyas par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar 'ga' zhig yod do zhes 'di'i khyad par 'gal ba yang ma reg par smra bas rang gi don ci zig rgyas par 'gyur /
translated: However, if one says ‚Äúsomething exists in that way,‚Äù without touching on the contradiction of its specific thing, one‚Äôs own purpose is not accomplished.

original: de'i phyir khyad par gyis zin pa nyid 'dis bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par gyis zin pa nyid 'dis bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is this that is to be established by the specific thing.

original: khyad par gyis zin bsgrub bya 'dir //üîΩgtan tshigs rjes 'gro med par 'gyur //üîΩdes na yod pa bsgrub bya na //
analyzed: khyad par gyis zin bsgrub bya 'dir // gtan tshigs rjes 'gro med par 'gyur // des na yod pa bsgrub bya na //
translated: But if the existence of the subject is to be established, then the qualification is what is to be established.

original: khyad par bsgrub byar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: khyad par bsgrub byar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: And if the existence is what is to be established, then the qualification is what is to be established.

original: chos can gtso bo'i mtshan nyid de gcig pu dang rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid dam gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: chos can gtso bo'i mtshan nyid de gcig pu dang rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid dam gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: The definition of the primary subject is that it is either the nature of the self, such as being one, being permanent, being blissful, and so on, or something else.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam pa ji ltar yang rung bas khyad par du gyur pa bsgrub par 'gyur na de ni da ltar rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam pa ji ltar yang rung bas khyad par du gyur pa bsgrub par 'gyur na de ni da ltar rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: If the nature of that is established in some way, then the qualification is established. But it does not exist now.

original: gang yang yod pa tsam rjes su 'gro ba grub pas ni cung zad kyang byar med do //
analyzed: gang yang yod pa tsam rjes su 'gro ba grub pas ni cung zad kyang byar med do //
translated: And if the mere existence is established, then nothing is done.

original: gal te de bzhin du me la sogs pa yang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin du me la sogs pa yang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that fire and so on are also entailed?

original: de la yang me yod pa la ni rtsod pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: de la yang me yod pa la ni rtsod pa 'ga' yang med de /
translated: But there is no dispute that fire exists.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par can gyi gzhi'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir mi 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par can gyi gzhi'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir mi 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the particular of the special basis that is desired is not established because it is not concomitant,

original: gzhi des de khyad par du byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhi des de khyad par du byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so, because that basis does not make it special.

original: mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pas khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pas khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is made special by the exclusion of non-possession.

original: zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: de'i phyir der ni de dang mi ldan pa rnam par gcad pas spyi nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir der ni de dang mi ldan pa rnam par gcad pas spyi nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in that case, it is the universal itself that is to be established by the exclusion of non-possession of that.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang 'ga' zhig la yod pa bsgrub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang 'ga' zhig la yod pa bsgrub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, here also, it is not the establishment of existence in some things,

original: gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i den nyid 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i den nyid 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no such thing as reality that is expressed by the words principle and so on.

original: de ni khyad par med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de ni khyad par med pa kho na yin no //
translated: That is only without distinction.

original: ji ltar med de de yang shes @210b bya dang gzhal bya dang brjod bya nyid du grub pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar med de de yang shes @210b bya dang gzhal bya dang brjod bya nyid du grub pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: How is it nonexistent? That is established as the object of cognition, the object of comprehension, and the object of expression.

original: ci da ni shes bya yod do zhes te de bsgrub par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci da ni shes bya yod do zhes te de bsgrub par 'gyur ram /
translated: If you say that, then is it now established that the object of cognition exists?

original: de lta na yang ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: But what is established by that?

original: gal te blos bskyed pa rnam par rtog pa la snang ba ni sgra'i don yin la /
analyzed: gal te blos bskyed pa rnam par rtog pa la snang ba ni sgra'i don yin la /
translated: If you say that the meaning of a word is the appearance in the conceptual cognition that is generated by the mind,

original: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi nye bar len pa can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi nye bar len pa can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: and that it is established as having the nature of a particular characteristic,

original: bsgrub par bya ba yin du zad mod /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yin du zad mod /
translated: then it is established, but

original: 'on kyang gtso bo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par gyi rten ma yin pas na de yang sgra'i don tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gtso bo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par gyi rten ma yin pas na de yang sgra'i don tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: since it is not the basis of the distinction of the particular characteristic of the primary nature, it is only the meaning of a word.

original: de lta yin dang snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya ba 'ga' zhig yod do zhes bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya ba 'ga' zhig yod do zhes bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then as before, it would be established that there is some object of expression.

original: sgra'i don rang nyid ni yon tan gyi khyad par 'ga' zhig la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i don rang nyid ni yon tan gyi khyad par 'ga' zhig la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of a word is not based on some particular quality,

original: nye bar len pa'i chos de dag la 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i chos de dag la 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: because it is imputed to those phenomena that are appropriated.

original: de'i phyir nye bar len pa ma grub pa dag la mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar len pa ma grub pa dag la mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for it to exist in those that are not established as appropriated.

original: des na 'di dag ni khyad par med pa yin pas de dag la don gyi nye bar len pa can nyid sgrub pa ni don yod pa tsam nyid bsgrub pa yin /
analyzed: des na 'di dag ni khyad par med pa yin pas de dag la don gyi nye bar len pa can nyid sgrub pa ni don yod pa tsam nyid bsgrub pa yin /
translated: Therefore, since there is no difference between them, the proof of the mere existence of the object is the proof of the mere existence of the object‚Äôs universal.

original: khyad par sgrub pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir don med do //
analyzed: khyad par sgrub pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir don med do //
translated: Since there is no proof of a difference, the proof is pointless.

original: gzhan du ni me'i spyi de nyid der ma grub pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni me'i spyi de nyid der ma grub pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: But in the other case, the universal of fire is not established there, so it is the object to be proven.

original: gal te der yang de dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa'i spyi dang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te der yang de dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa'i spyi dang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the universal that is not devoid of that and the pervasion not established there?

original: de lta bus ni 'ga' yang rjes su 'gro ba byed pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bus ni 'ga' yang rjes su 'gro ba byed pa med do //
translated: In that case, nothing would be a universal.

original: gzhan la sgrub par byed pas ni gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod do zhes du ba me med na mi 'byung bar bstan par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la sgrub par byed pas ni gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod do zhes du ba me med na mi 'byung bar bstan par bya ba yin la /
translated: But in the other case, the proof is that where there is smoke there is fire, and smoke is taught to be the invariable concomitant of fire.

original: de ltar me tsam gyis khyab pa grub pa de ni gang du rang nyid snang ba de nyid du me'i blo skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar me tsam gyis khyab pa grub pa de ni gang du rang nyid snang ba de nyid du me'i blo skyed par byed do //
translated: And when the pervasion by mere fire is established in that way, then wherever it appears, it generates the cognition of fire.

original: de la bsgrub par bya ba bstan pas ni ci yang mi dgos te /
analyzed: de la bsgrub par bya ba bstan pas ni ci yang mi dgos te /
translated: In that case, there is no need to teach the probandum,

original: de la mthong ba dang 'brel pa bstan pa tsam gyis 'dod pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mthong ba dang 'brel pa bstan pa tsam gyis 'dod pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mere teaching of the connection with the perception establishes the thesis.

original: de la ma bstan na yang ji ltar de'i khyad par can gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin /
analyzed: de la ma bstan na yang ji ltar de'i khyad par can gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin /
translated: But if it is not taught, how can it be the pervasion of that?

original: de'i phyir 'di me med na mi 'byung bar grub pa'i shugs nyid kyi me phyogs de dang mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa'i phyir de de ltar bsgrub bya yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di me med na mi 'byung bar grub pa'i shugs nyid kyi me phyogs de dang mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa'i phyir de de ltar bsgrub bya yin par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, since the mere power of establishing that it does not occur without fire excludes the absence of fire in that place, it is said that it is thus to be established.

original: 'di'i khyab pa ni de ltar nye bar bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i khyab pa ni de ltar nye bar bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin te /
translated: The pervasion of this is not preceded by the arrangement of that,

original: bsgrub bya brjod pa 'di la yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde sngon @211a * //
analyzed: bsgrub bya brjod pa 'di la yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro // de sngon @211a * //
translated: because the statement of the probandum is not a part of this.

original: du 'gro ba can yin na yang dam bca' ba sgrub par byed pa las sus zlog par byed /
analyzed: du 'gro ba can yin na yang dam bca' ba sgrub par byed pa las sus zlog par byed /
translated: Even if it is preceded by that, who can prevent the proof of the thesis?

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: In that case,

original: rtags ni chos dang mi 'khrul bar //
analyzed: rtags ni chos dang mi 'khrul bar //
translated: the reason is taught as nonerroneous with respect to the property,

original: gzhan du bstan par bya ba ste //
analyzed: gzhan du bstan par bya ba ste //
translated: and as different from that.

original: de la rab grub de ldan par //
analyzed: de la rab grub de ldan par //
translated: The one who possesses that supreme attainmentüîΩ

original: chos can rtogs par 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos can rtogs par 'gyur ba yin // zhes bshad do //
translated: And the property-possessor is understood to have that property.üîΩTherefore, the proof of existence is not free from fault, just like the proof of fire.

original: de'i phyir me la sogs pa bsgrub pa bzhin du yod pa bsgrub pa yang kha na ma tho ba med pa ni ma yin no //üîΩde yi khyad par gzung med par //üîΩdngos po tsam zhig sgrub byed la //
analyzed: de'i phyir me la sogs pa bsgrub pa bzhin du yod pa bsgrub pa yang kha na ma tho ba med pa ni ma yin no // de yi khyad par gzung med par // dngos po tsam zhig sgrub byed la //
translated: When the particular is not apprehended,üîΩthe mere thing is established as the probandum.

original: de tsam khyab byed bsgrub bya yi //
analyzed: de tsam khyab byed bsgrub bya yi //
translated: The mere thing is pervaded by the probandum,

original: rjes su 'gro ba nyams pa med //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba nyams pa med //
translated: and the concomitance is not lost.

original: rang bzhin gyi khyab par yongs su ma gzung bar dngos po tsam khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la yod pa sgrub par byed pa nyid la ni rjes su 'gro ba nyams pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khyab par yongs su ma gzung bar dngos po tsam khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la yod pa sgrub par byed pa nyid la ni rjes su 'gro ba nyams pa med do //
translated: When the natural pervasion is not apprehended, the mere thing is established as the probandum. The mere thing is pervaded by the probandum. The mere thing is the property-possessor. The existence of the probandum in the property-possessor is the proof. In this, the concomitance is not lost.

original: de la gdon mi za bar yongs su gzung bar bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gdon mi za bar yongs su gzung bar bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: There, it is not necessarily to be apprehended.

original: yod pa tsam la brten na yang sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa tsam la brten na yang sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even when based on mere existence, there is the capacity of the proof.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the probandum.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is without effect.

original: gzhan yang / ma grub pa la yod chos med //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ma grub pa la yod chos med //
translated: If the property of the nonexistent is not established,üîΩIf the error is based on both, and if the nonexistent property

original: gnyi ga la brten 'khrul pa dang // med pa'i chos ni 'gal 'gyur na //
analyzed: gnyi ga la brten 'khrul pa dang // med pa'i chos ni 'gal 'gyur na //
translated: Is contradictory,

original: yod de ji ltar bsgrub bya yin //
analyzed: yod de ji ltar bsgrub bya yin //
translated: How can the existent be the probandum?

original: yod pa bsgrub par bya ba la de'i gtan tshigs thams cad skyon gyi rigs gsum las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: yod pa bsgrub par bya ba la de'i gtan tshigs thams cad skyon gyi rigs gsum las mi 'da' ste /
translated: In the proof of the existent, all of its reasons do not go beyond three types of faults:

original: ma grub pa dang / 'khrul pa dang / 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa dang / 'khrul pa dang / 'gal ba'o //
translated: nonestablishment, error, and contradiction.

original: de la gal te dngos po'i chos gtan tshigs su 'dod pa de de ji ltar dang dngos por mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de la gal te dngos po'i chos gtan tshigs su 'dod pa de de ji ltar dang dngos por mi 'dod de /
translated: If the property of an entity is asserted as a reason, how could it not be asserted as an entity?

original: 'ga' zhig la ltos nas rang gi ngo dang dngos por mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la ltos nas rang gi ngo dang dngos por mi 'dod de /
translated: It is not asserted as an entity in relation to some,

original: 'ga' zhig la ltos nas rang gi ngo las tha dad pa lta bur bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la ltos nas rang gi ngo las tha dad pa lta bur bstan pa yin no //
translated: but it is taught as if it were different from its own nature in relation to some.

original: chos dang chos can brjod pa'i sgra dag gis brjod par bya ba la ni khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes 'di ni tshad ma rnam 'grel du bstan zin to //
analyzed: chos dang chos can brjod pa'i sgra dag gis brjod par bya ba la ni khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes 'di ni tshad ma rnam 'grel du bstan zin to //
translated: There is not any difference in what is expressed by the terms that express the property and the subject. This has already been taught in the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika.

original: ci ste gnyi ga'i chos brjod do zhe na yang ma yin pa ma yin pas na dngos po la mi brten pa'i ldog pa tsam ni med pa la yang mi 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci ste gnyi ga'i chos brjod do zhe na yang ma yin pa ma yin pas na dngos po la mi brten pa'i ldog pa tsam ni med pa la yang mi 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: But if you say that both properties are expressed, then it is not the case that it is not so. Therefore, a mere negation that does not depend on a positive object is not inconsistent even with respect to a nonexistent.

original: dper na lus can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i lus med pa nyid ni nye bar brjod pa med pa la yang 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lus can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i lus med pa nyid ni nye bar brjod pa med pa la yang 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is just as in the case of the expression ‚Äúnonembodiment,‚Äù where the absence of a body is not inconsistent with the absence of expression.

original: nye bar brjod pa med pa ni med pa'i phyir dgag pa'i yul ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar brjod pa med pa ni med pa'i phyir dgag pa'i yul ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the absence of expression is not a negation because it does not exist,

original: ci da ni de sgrub pa'i @211b yul yin nam /
analyzed: ci da ni de sgrub pa'i @211b yul yin nam /
translated: then is it now the object of affirmation?

original: de yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not,

original: da ni ji ltar dgag pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar dgag pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: then how can it not be the object of negation?

original: dgag pa ni sgrub pa log pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa ni sgrub pa log pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For a negation is by nature the opposite of an affirmation.

original: gal te dgag pa ni yongs su chad pa kho na la gnas par 'dod pa de'i phyir nye bar brjod pa med pa la ni lus can nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dgag pa ni yongs su chad pa kho na la gnas par 'dod pa de'i phyir nye bar brjod pa med pa la ni lus can nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you maintain that a negation is only present in a delimited object, then in the absence of expression, there is no nonembodiment, etc.

original: kye ma brda las byung pa 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pa'i don nges par 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pa 'di ni dka' bas 'tsho ste /
analyzed: kye ma brda las byung pa 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pa'i don nges par 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pa 'di ni dka' bas 'tsho ste /
translated: Alas, this afflicted person who desires to ascertain the meaning that merely follows from the conventions is difficult to sustain,

original: de'i brang brdungs shing cho nges btab kyang 'jig rten mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i brang brdungs shing cho nges btab kyang 'jig rten mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if one were to beat one‚Äôs chest and cry out, the world would not turn back.

original: brda ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir dang / sgra sbyar ba'i dgongs pa yang de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir dang / sgra sbyar ba'i dgongs pa yang de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one understands the convention just as it is, and because the intention of the grammatical analysis is just that.

original: 'dod pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir gnyi gar yang mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir gnyi gar yang mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that one would not understand both, since there is no difference between desire and the other.

original: de las rtogs pa yang brda la brten pa'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: de las rtogs pa yang brda la brten pa'i phyir yin la /
translated: Because understanding from that is based on the convention,

original: de ni gzhan du yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhan du yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that is the same in the other case.

original: des na de rnam par bcad pa tsam de ni gnyi ga la yang yod /
analyzed: des na de rnam par bcad pa tsam de ni gnyi ga la yang yod /
translated: Therefore, that mere exclusion exists in both.

original: srid pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa srid pa'i dgos pa rnam par chad pas thob pa'i go bar byed pa nyid bdag gir byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: srid pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa srid pa'i dgos pa rnam par chad pas thob pa'i go bar byed pa nyid bdag gir byed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be that the non-existence of the object of refutation by reasons is the mode of being of the object of refutation by reasons?

original: shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnam par bcad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dag kyang ci zhig ltar dngos po med pa dag la yang blos rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pas de dag kyang 'dis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnam par bcad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dag kyang ci zhig ltar dngos po med pa dag la yang blos rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pas de dag kyang 'dis bshad pa yin no //
translated: Also, the non-existence of the object of refutation by reasons is not the mode of being of the object of refutation by reasons, but it is posited by the mind in regard to the non-existence of the object of refutation by reasons.

original: de rang gi tshig gis gnyi ga'i chos su smras pas 'di yod pa las gzhan la yang 'jug pa dang / yod pa la yang mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ji ltar bsnyon pa ma yin /
analyzed: de rang gi tshig gis gnyi ga'i chos su smras pas 'di yod pa las gzhan la yang 'jug pa dang / yod pa la yang mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ji ltar bsnyon pa ma yin /
translated: Since he himself said that it is a quality of both, how can he not be refuted, since it applies to what is other than existence and it is not mistaken in regard to existence?

original: 'khrul pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pas yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pas yin te /
translated: Mistakenness is being applied to a discordant object.

original: des na phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gang yang rung ba la sogs pa dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i chos yin yang skyon med do //
analyzed: des na phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gang yang rung ba la sogs pa dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i chos yin yang skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in the reason being a property of both, because the property of the similar class does not occur in the dissimilar class.

original: phyogs nyid ni 'khrul pa'i yul ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs nyid ni 'khrul pa'i yul ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The property of the similar class is not the domain of error.

original: 'dir gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gtogs /
analyzed: 'dir gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gtogs /
translated: Here, what is included in the dissimilar class?

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa'o //
translated: The absence of the object to be established.

original: 'o na da ji ltar gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa gnyi ga'i chos su 'gyur /üîΩgtan tshigs kyi mi 'khrul pa phyogs dang mthun pa'i @212a * //
analyzed: 'o na da ji ltar gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa gnyi ga'i chos su 'gyur / gtan tshigs kyi mi 'khrul pa phyogs dang mthun pa'i @212a * //
translated: Well then, how can the reason be a property of both, not occurring in the dissimilar class?

original: phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The non-error of the reason does not depend on the division of the similar class,

original: dngos por gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a real entity.

original: phyogs ma gtogs pa'i byas pa mi rtag pa yin no zhes gtan tshigs kyi med na mi 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pas bstan par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyogs ma gtogs pa'i byas pa mi rtag pa yin no zhes gtan tshigs kyi med na mi 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pas bstan par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The non-occurrence of the reason is not taught by positing the non-existence of the reason in the dissimilar class, as in ‚ÄúThe produced is impermanent.‚Äù

original: 'on ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: byas pa thams cad mi rtag pa yin no zhes dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa'i khyab pa nyid tshad mas bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byas pa thams cad mi rtag pa yin no zhes dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa'i khyab pa nyid tshad mas bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: This pervasion, which is established by the power of fact, is to be taught by means of a valid cognition.

original: de ltar grub na tshos de'i go bar byed par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar grub na tshos de'i go bar byed par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is established in this way, then it will be understood. Otherwise, it will not.

original: gang zhig skyes bus bsgrub par 'dod pa de phyogs yin pas na gang 'khrul pa'i yul du mthong ba de nyid nges phyogs su byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig skyes bus bsgrub par 'dod pa de phyogs yin pas na gang 'khrul pa'i yul du mthong ba de nyid nges phyogs su byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Since that which is to be accomplished by a person is a position, whatever is seen as the domain of error is made into a definite position.

original: skyes bu'i 'jug pa ni dngos po gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'jug pa ni dngos po gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the engagement of a person is not under the power of another thing.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ni mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ni mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the domain of inference, there is no contradiction by direct perception and so on.

original: tshad ma la tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod na de tshad ma ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma la tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod na de tshad ma ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If a valid cognition is contradicted by another valid cognition, then it follows that it is not a valid cognition.
