original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod na de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod na de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is contradicted in regard to that which has the characteristics, then its characteristics are refuted.

original: zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: gnod pa med pa yang mtshan nyid yin na de'i mtshan nyid mi nges pa can nyid yin la /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa yang mtshan nyid yin na de'i mtshan nyid mi nges pa can nyid yin la /
translated: If the absence of harm is a characteristic, then its characteristic is indefinite.

original: de ltan yang go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang gi don du mi 'khrul /
analyzed: de ltan yang go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang gi don du mi 'khrul /
translated: And in that case, since it is not an illuminator, it is not nonerroneous with regard to its object.

original: bsam pa gang zhig gang gis sgrub par byed pa yin /
analyzed: bsam pa gang zhig gang gis sgrub par byed pa yin /
translated: And what is the intention that is established by what?

original: de'i phyir dngos po la gang zhig gang gas khyab pa'am ma khyab pa de'i go bar bya ba'am go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyes bu'i 'dod pas dngos po'i chos rnam par gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po la gang zhig gang gas khyab pa'am ma khyab pa de'i go bar bya ba'am go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyes bu'i 'dod pas dngos po'i chos rnam par gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since that which pervades or does not pervade a thing is not an illuminator or that which is illuminated, the nature of things is not established by the desire of a person.

original: gang gi tshe 'di phyogs su byed pa de'i tshe mi 'khrul la gzhan gyi tshe des 'khrul pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di phyogs su byed pa de'i tshe mi 'khrul la gzhan gyi tshe des 'khrul pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: When it is used in this way, it is nonerroneous, but when it is used in another way, it is erroneous. Therefore it is a very pure means of valid knowledge.

original: dngos po tsam khyab pa'i don rnam par bcad pa med pa'i chos yod pa la gtan tshigs su brjod na ni de'i gtan tshigs 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po tsam khyab pa'i don rnam par bcad pa med pa'i chos yod pa la gtan tshigs su brjod na ni de'i gtan tshigs 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one states as a reason the existence of a property that is not the exclusion of the meaning that pervades mere things, then that reason is contradictory.

original: rnam par bcad pa de ni dngos po 'ga' la yang mi srid pa'i phyir dang / dngos po med pa mtha' dag la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa de ni dngos po 'ga' la yang mi srid pa'i phyir dang / dngos po med pa mtha' dag la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that exclusion is not possible for any existent thing, and because it exists for all non-existent things.

original: de'i phyir chos rnam pa 'di gsum ka yang yod pa bsgrub pa la gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bsten pa ma yin la rnam pa gzhan yang mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos rnam pa 'di gsum ka yang yod pa bsgrub pa la gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bsten pa ma yin la rnam pa gzhan yang mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, none of these three types of properties are the definition of a logical reason that proves existence, and there is no other possibility.

original: des na yod na @212b bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na yod na @212b bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if it is existent, it is not to be proven.

original: de tsam khyab pa'i dngos po'i chos la 'di sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa la ni yod par grub pa'i chos can la spyi ma grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de tsam khyab pa'i dngos po'i chos la 'di sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa la ni yod par grub pa'i chos can la spyi ma grub pa ma yin la /
translated: If it is a property of an existent thing that is pervaded by that much, it is a proof of that, and the property of the subject is not unestablished in the case of an existent subject.

original: gal te rnam pa ji zhig ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos des khyab pa des na 'gal ba dang ma nges pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir thal ba der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa ji zhig ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos des khyab pa des na 'gal ba dang ma nges pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir thal ba der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is pervaded by the property to be proven in some way, then it is not contradictory or uncertain, so that consequence does not apply.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid rnam pa 'di gnyis ni gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid rnam pa 'di gnyis ni gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: Thus, these two types of nature are the characteristics of a logical reason.

original: de nyid rang gi khyab par byed pa las bzlog pa bsgrub par bya ba la 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos rnam pa bzhi bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid rang gi khyab par byed pa las bzlog pa bsgrub par bya ba la 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos rnam pa bzhi bshad do //
translated: In order to show that the pervasion of that is the opposite of the probandum, the four types of property of the subject are explained.

original: khyad par dad sbyin ma nges pa dag kyang nges par smra ba bsal ba'i ba'i phyir gnyis te /
analyzed: khyad par dad sbyin ma nges pa dag kyang nges par smra ba bsal ba'i ba'i phyir gnyis te /
translated: The two, the particular and the unestablished, are also explained in order to eliminate the unestablished reason.

original: de yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'i skabs su bab pa na bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'i skabs su bab pa na bshad par bya'o //
translated: And that will be explained in the section on fallacious reasons.

original: gtan tshigs kyis ldog pa gtsor bsgrub pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos rnam pa gsum bshad do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyis ldog pa gtsor bsgrub pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos rnam pa gsum bshad do //
translated: Because the negation of the reason is the main thing to be established, the three types of property of the subject are explained.

original: 'di ltar rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, a reason is not understood through the positive concomitance,

original: mi rtag pa nyid las rtsol ba las byung ba ma yin pa nyid mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid las rtsol ba las byung ba ma yin pa nyid mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because non-effort-produced is not understood from impermanence.

original: 'di las ni rtogs par mi 'gyur te ldog pa med pas rjes su 'gro ba 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di las ni rtogs par mi 'gyur te ldog pa med pas rjes su 'gro ba 'ba' zhig yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is not understood from this, because there is no negation, and there is only the positive concomitance.

original: 'o na reg par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rtag go zhes bya ba 'di la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na reg par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rtag go zhes bya ba 'di la 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is permanent because it is not touchable, then this is not so.

original: ma yin te de la yang rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te de la yang rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: No, because in that case, the pervasion is not strong.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab pa'i phyir dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ga' la med pa'i phyir na 'dir rjes su 'gro ba stobs dang ldan zhing ldog pa stobs chung ba yin te /üîΩdper na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab pa'i phyir dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ga' la med pa'i phyir na 'dir rjes su 'gro ba stobs dang ldan zhing ldog pa stobs chung ba yin te / dper na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Here, the pervasion is strong because it pervades similar instances and it does not exist in any dissimilar instances.

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúIt is impermanent because it is produced by effort.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ma log pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ma log pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not so because it does not reverse from all dissimilar instances,

original: de lta na 'o na ni gang bas bde ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes rtag pa rnam par bcad pas go bar byed pa yin par 'dod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni gang bas bde ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes rtag pa rnam par bcad pas go bar byed pa yin par 'dod par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be asserted that the statement, ‚ÄúThat which is pleasant is impermanent,‚Äù is understood through the exclusion of permanence.

original: de lta ma yin na mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog par bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog par bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it could not be taught that it is the opposite of all that is not it.

original: des na 'di yod pa tsam dang mnyam pa dang gtso che bas rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di yod pa tsam dang mnyam pa dang gtso che bas rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not understood by mere presence, equality, or predominance.üîΩEven though the pervasion by the reverse is not the principal concomitance, it is present, as in the case of the inference,

original: rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin yang bzlog pas khyab na yod pa yin te dper na sgra mi rtag @213a * //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin yang bzlog pas khyab na yod pa yin te dper na sgra mi rtag @213a * //
translated: Sound is impermanent,

original: ste / rtsol ba las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ste / rtsol ba las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because it is produced by effort.

original: de'i phyir gang rtsol ba las byung ba de ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes de ltar rtag pa rnam par bcad pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang rtsol ba las byung ba de ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes de ltar rtag pa rnam par bcad pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is in this way that the reason is understood by the exclusion of permanence, as in the statement, Whatever is produced by effort is impermanent.

original: sgra dang sa phyogs la sogs par rtogs pa dang me med la sogs pa rnam par bcad pas ldog pa rtogs na ngag 'di'i nus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang sa phyogs la sogs par rtogs pa dang me med la sogs pa rnam par bcad pas ldog pa rtogs na ngag 'di'i nus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the power of this statement is complete when there is the understanding of sound and place, etc., and the exclusion of the absence of fire, etc.

original: de dag las tha dad pa tsam ni go bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag las tha dad pa tsam ni go bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Mere difference from them is not what is to be understood.

original: 'on kyang 'di la 'di nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes spyi de nyid mi mthun pa dang ma 'dres par go bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di la 'di nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes spyi de nyid mi mthun pa dang ma 'dres par go bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is understood that this is just that and not something else, and that this universal is not mixed with what is dissimilar.

original: gal te de dag gdon mi za bar gzhan dang ma 'dres par go bar bya ba yin na de tsam gyis 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir de dag gi gzhan dang ma 'dres pa de nyid go bar bya bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te de dag gdon mi za bar gzhan dang ma 'dres par go bar bya ba yin na de tsam gyis 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir de dag gi gzhan dang ma 'dres pa de nyid go bar bya bar 'gyur mod /
translated: If it is definitely understood that it is not mixed with something else, then just that, not mixed with something else, would be understood because the effect is completely fulfilled by that alone.üîΩWhat is the use of an intermediate universal?

original: bar gyi spyis ci zhig bya zhes ldog pa bsgrubs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: bar gyi spyis ci zhig bya zhes ldog pa bsgrubs pas ston par byed do //
translated: Thus he teaches by way of a counter-inference.

original: 'o na rgyu nus pas 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog par byed pa gang yin pa de ji ltar gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum gyi nang du 'du zhe na /üîΩnus pa'i rgyu yis 'bras skye bar //
analyzed: 'o na rgyu nus pas 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog par byed pa gang yin pa de ji ltar gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum gyi nang du 'du zhe na / nus pa'i rgyu yis 'bras skye bar //
translated: But how is it that the inference of the arising of an effect from a potent cause is included within the three types of reason?üîΩThe inference of the arising of an effect

original: rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa //üîΩdon gzhan la ni mi ltos phyir //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa // don gzhan la ni mi ltos phyir //
translated: from a potent causeüîΩis said to be a natural reason

original: de ni rang bzhin yin par brjod //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin yin par brjod //
translated: because it does not rely on another object.

original: 'di yang ji ltar nye ba las gzhan la mi ltos pas ni ngo bo de tsam dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang ji ltar nye ba las gzhan la mi ltos pas ni ngo bo de tsam dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: This is also a nature that is related to just that entity, because it does not depend on anything else, such as proximity.

original: de la ni rgyu tshogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu bskyed par rung ba nyid 'ga' zhig rjes su dpog la /
analyzed: de la ni rgyu tshogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu bskyed par rung ba nyid 'ga' zhig rjes su dpog la /
translated: In that case, the capability of the collection of causes to produce an effect is inferred.

original: rung ba nyid kyang tshogs pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pas na rang bzhin du gyur pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyang tshogs pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pas na rang bzhin du gyur pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since capability is related to the mere collection, it is a nature.

original: yang ci'i phyir rgyu tshogs pa las 'bras bu kho na rjes su dpog par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rgyu tshogs pa las 'bras bu kho na rjes su dpog par mi byed ce na /
translated: Why is it that an effect is not inferred from the mere collection of causes?

original: gang gi phyir rgyu'i rdzas tshogs pa dag kho nas rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu'i rdzas tshogs pa dag kho nas rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the mere collection of the substantial causes produces its own effect.

original: 'bras bu skye ba ni tshogs pa las skye ba can gyi nus pa rnams kyi 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba ni tshogs pa las skye ba can gyi nus pa rnams kyi 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The production of the effect depends on the transformation of the potencies that arise from the collection.

original: bar 'dir gegs byed pa srid pa'i phyir 'bras bu rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bar 'dir gegs byed pa srid pa'i phyir 'bras bu rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is possible that an obstruction occurs in the meantime, the effect is not inferred.

original: rung ba nyid ni rdzas gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir rjes su dpog pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rung ba nyid ni rdzas gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir rjes su dpog pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since suitability does not depend on another substance, there is no contradiction in inferring it.

original: rgyu tshogs pa 'di nus pa phyi ma phyi mar 'gyur bas 'bras bu skyed par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa 'di nus pa phyi ma phyi mar 'gyur bas 'bras bu skyed par nus pa yin te /
translated: This collection of causes is capable of producing the effect because it is capable of the subsequent transformation of its potency.

original: nus pa @213b 'gyur ba'i rkyen ltos par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa @213b 'gyur ba'i rkyen ltos par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no other condition that is required for the transformation of potency.

original: nus pa skye ba ni rang gi rigs snga ma tsam gyi rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir tshogs pa'i rung ba nyid ni gzhan la mi ltos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nus pa skye ba ni rang gi rigs snga ma tsam gyi rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir tshogs pa'i rung ba nyid ni gzhan la mi ltos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of potency is due to the cause of the mere prior type, and therefore the suitability of the collection does not depend on another.

original: rung ba nyid kyang rgyu tshogs pa dag kho nas rjes su dpog par byed de /
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyang rgyu tshogs pa dag kho nas rjes su dpog par byed de /
translated: Suitability is inferred from the collection of causes themselves.

original: ma tshogs pa la ni shin tu nus pa med pa'i phyir de las 'bras bu dpog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma tshogs pa la ni shin tu nus pa med pa'i phyir de las 'bras bu dpog pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no capacity at all in the non-collection, the effect is not inferred from that.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong yang lhag ma dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong yang lhag ma dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Even though the engagement of the opposing factor is not seen, it is still possessed.

original: dper na lus dang dbang po dang blo dag las 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lus dang dbang po dang blo dag las 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the inference of desire, etc. from the body, the senses, and the mind.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Desire, etc. are preceded by the clinging to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

original: nga dang nga'i zhes ma mthong ba la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga dang nga'i zhes ma mthong ba la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no desire and aversion for that which is not seen as ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa med par nyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa med par nyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because faults do not arise without incorrect mental activity.

original: lus la sogs pa rgyu nyid yin yang 'ba' zhig pa rnams la nus pa med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong du zin kyang rtags 'di lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa rgyu nyid yin yang 'ba' zhig pa rnams la nus pa med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong du zin kyang rtags 'di lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Even though the body, etc. are the cause, they are not capable of acting alone, and so, even though one does not see the engagement of the adverse factors, this reason is not without the remainder.

original: 'o na rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa gzhan ro la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa gang yin pa de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa gzhan ro la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa gang yin pa de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Well, then, what is the understanding of form, etc. by other things, such as taste, etc., which are not the effect of those?üîΩThat also is said:

original: de yang / tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i //
analyzed: de yang / tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i //
translated: The understanding of form, etc. is due to the dependence on the same collection.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ros rtogs pa //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ros rtogs pa //
translated: The cause of taste is the cause of form, because taste is not perceived when form is destroyed.

original: rgyu chos rjes su dpag pa ste //
analyzed: rgyu chos rjes su dpag pa ste //
translated: The cause of form is inferred from the effect,

original: du bas bud shing 'gyur ba bzhin //
analyzed: du bas bud shing 'gyur ba bzhin //
translated: just as the transformation of fuel is inferred from smoke.

original: de yang rgyu de lta bu kho na rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: de yang rgyu de lta bu kho na rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: And it is just that cause which is inferred.

original: ro'i rgyu ni gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i nus pa zhugs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin zhing ro skyed par byed de /
analyzed: ro'i rgyu ni gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i nus pa zhugs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin zhing ro skyed par byed de /
translated: The cause of taste is the condition that is the cause of the arising of taste, which is the potency that is the appropriator of form.

original: me bud shing 'gyur ba'i khyad par gyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin zhing du ba bskyed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me bud shing 'gyur ba'i khyad par gyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin zhing du ba bskyed pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the condition that is the cause of the arising of smoke is the transformation of fuel.

original: 'di ltar rang gi rgyu 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la mngon du phyogs pa med na ro med pa nyid gzugs kyi nye bar len pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi rgyu 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la mngon du phyogs pa med na ro med pa nyid gzugs kyi nye bar len pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, when its own cause is not present, taste is not perceived, and the cause of the arising of the appropriator of form is the cause of the arising of taste.

original: ro'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'jug pa de yang gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'jug pa'i lhan cig byed pa can yin te /
analyzed: ro'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'jug pa de yang gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'jug pa'i lhan cig byed pa can yin te /
translated: And the cause of the arising of the appropriator of taste is the cause of the arising of the appropriator of form.

original: de'i phyir rgyu ji lta bu las byung ba'i ros de lta bu rjes su dpog par byed pa na gzugs rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu ji lta bu las byung ba'i ros de lta bu rjes su dpog par byed pa na gzugs rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one infers the form of an object from the taste that arises from it, one infers the form.üîΩ

original: de la @214a * //üîΩyang 'das pa dang dus gcig pa rnams rtogs kyi /
analyzed: de la @214a * // yang 'das pa dang dus gcig pa rnams rtogs kyi /
translated: Therefore, when one infers the form of an object from the taste that arises from that object, one infers the form of the object from the effect of the form.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One infers the past and present form of an object from the effect of the form, but one does not infer the future form of an object because the effect does not yet exist.

original: de'i phyir de yang 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the inference of the future form of an object is based on the cause of the form.

original: 'dis ni grog ma mthong ba dang nya 'phar ba la sogs pa las char ba la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa yang bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni grog ma mthong ba dang nya 'phar ba la sogs pa las char ba la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa yang bshad pa yin te /
translated: This explanation also applies to the inference of rain, etc., from the behavior of ants, fish, etc.

original: de la yang char pa'i rgyu 'byung ba 'ga' zhig gi ni grog ma la sogs 'khrug pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la yang char pa'i rgyu 'byung ba 'ga' zhig gi ni grog ma la sogs 'khrug pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: In this case, the agitation of ants, etc., is the effect of a certain element that is the cause of rain, etc.

original: gzugs las reg pa rjes su dpog pa ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa yin te /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa ni 'byung ba la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs las reg pa rjes su dpog pa ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa yin te / gzugs la sogs pa ni 'byung ba la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inference of contact from form is based on the effect of form, because form is based on the elements.

original: 'o na ba lang yin pa'i phyir rva can yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ba lang yin pa'i phyir rva can yin no //
translated: If the inference of the possession of horns from the possession of a dewlap is based on the effect of the possession of horns, then why is the possession of horns not the effect of the possession of a dewlap?

original: zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: de la yang /üîΩtshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa yi //
analyzed: de la yang / tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa yi //
translated: In this regard,üîΩthe collection is posited

original: rgyu ni tshogs pa can yin pas //
analyzed: rgyu ni tshogs pa can yin pas //
translated: as the cause of the collection-possessor.

original: de dag med na de med phyir //
analyzed: de dag med na de med phyir //
translated: Since it does not exist when they do not exist,

original: ba lang nyid las rva can yin //
analyzed: ba lang nyid las rva can yin //
translated: the horn is from the cow.

original: lkog shal dang rva la sogs pa'i tshogs pa ni ba lang yin no //
analyzed: lkog shal dang rva la sogs pa'i tshogs pa ni ba lang yin no //
translated: The collection of dewlap, horn, and so on is the cow.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni tshogs pa can gyi rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir de med na mi 'byung la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni tshogs pa can gyi rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir de med na mi 'byung la /
translated: Therefore, since this positing of the collection is the sign of the collection-possessor, it does not occur when it does not exist.

original: yod na rang gi rgyu mtshan nye bar ston par byed pa'i phyir ba lang nyid las rva can la sogs pa rtogs pa ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: yod na rang gi rgyu mtshan nye bar ston par byed pa'i phyir ba lang nyid las rva can la sogs pa rtogs pa ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Since it manifests its own sign when it exists, the understanding of the horn and so on from the cow is produced from the sign of the effect.

original: chu yi bdag nyid de 'dra ba //
analyzed: chu yi bdag nyid de 'dra ba //
translated: The nature of water is like that.

original: gzhi las mngon par grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhi las mngon par grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Since it is established from the basis,

original: de'i 'bras yin /
analyzed: de'i 'bras yin /
translated: it is the effect of that.

original: chu brtan pa mthong nas gting ma mthong yang gzhi yod par rjes su dpog par byed pa gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa nyid de /
analyzed: chu brtan pa mthong nas gting ma mthong yang gzhi yod par rjes su dpog par byed pa gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa nyid de /
translated: When one sees the stability of the water, one infers the existence of the ground, even though one does not see the ground. This is also born from a reason based on effect,

original: chu'i bdag nyid de 'dra ba ni gzhi de las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu'i bdag nyid de 'dra ba ni gzhi de las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the water is established from that ground.

original: de las phan pa nyams su myong ba med par ni de las gnas skabs kyi khyad par thob par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las phan pa nyams su myong ba med par ni de las gnas skabs kyi khyad par thob par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that one obtains a special condition from that water without experiencing a benefit from it.

original: phan pa don gzhan nyid yin pa la yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: phan pa don gzhan nyid yin pa la yang bshad zin to //
translated: And it has already been explained that benefit is a different thing.

original: gal te de las bdag nyid kyi khyad par skyes pa'i phyir chu de ltar gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de las bdag nyid kyi khyad par skyes pa'i phyir chu de ltar gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If you say that the water is not in that state because it is born with a special nature from that ground,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: ldan pa las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ldan pa las yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is from the combination,

original: ji ltar de de dag gi ldan pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar de de dag gi ldan pa yin /
translated: how is it that the water is combined with those things?

original: de dag las skyes pa'am 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir yin grang na /
analyzed: de dag las skyes pa'am 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir yin grang na /
translated: If you say it is because it is born from them or because it is combined with them,

original: de ji ltar gcig nyid la 'phrod pa 'du'am skye bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar gcig nyid la 'phrod pa 'du'am skye bar mi 'gyur /
translated: then how could it not be that the water is born from or combined with those things?

original: de la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say it is because it has no power to do so,üîΩthen how could it not be that the water is born from or combined with those things?

original: de @214b la so sor nus pa med pa de ni tshogs kyang de 'dra ba kho na yin pa'i phyir ldan pas de dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de @214b la so sor nus pa med pa de ni tshogs kyang de 'dra ba kho na yin pa'i phyir ldan pas de dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since the collection is just like that, it is not endowed with that, because it does not have the power to do so,

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not benefit.

original: lhan cig pa ni de las gzhan pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa las khyad par skye ba'i phyir nus pa yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig pa ni de las gzhan pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa las khyad par skye ba'i phyir nus pa yin no //
translated: That which is simultaneous with it is powerful, because it arises with a difference in the benefit it provides.

original: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa rnams kyi phan pa de gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa rnams kyi phan pa de gang zhig yin te /
translated: What is the benefit of those that are not produced and do not produce?

original: gang gi ngo bo grub zin pas bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo grub zin pas bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which has already been accomplished does not need to be done again.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo byed na yang de la phan btags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo byed na yang de la phan btags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it produces another nature, it does not benefit that,üîΩbecause it does not do both, and because it does not do anything at all, it does not benefit.

original: gnyi ga ltar byed pa po ma yin pa ni cung zad mi byed pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar byed pa po ma yin pa ni cung zad mi byed pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes mang du bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained many times.

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i 'brel pa thams cad ni skyed par byed pa nyid kyi nye bar sbyor ba'i khyad par gyi dbang gis rnam par dbye bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po las rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i 'brel pa thams cad ni skyed par byed pa nyid kyi nye bar sbyor ba'i khyad par gyi dbang gis rnam par dbye bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po las rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all relationships of entities are posited as the state of cause and effect by the classification of the specific application of the producer.

original: des na mkhar gzhong dang sa gzhi la sogs pa rnams kyi gzhi'i dngos po 'di yang rgya shug dang chu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na mkhar gzhong dang sa gzhi la sogs pa rnams kyi gzhi'i dngos po 'di yang rgya shug dang chu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the state of basis of such things as the plate and the ground is the very capacity to produce such things as the jujube and water.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag la de'i bdag nyid kyis tha snyad la sogs pa ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po nyid kyis byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag la de'i bdag nyid kyis tha snyad la sogs pa ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po nyid kyis byas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the conventions of identity and so on in regard to these are made by the state of producer and produced.

original: ldan pa yod kyang de dag med na mi 'byung ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / brgyud pas rtog pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa yod kyang de dag med na mi 'byung ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / brgyud pas rtog pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though there is possession, they are not without the state of being produced, because the conceptualization of the series is meaningless.

original: gnas par byed pa'i phyir gzhi yin gyi skyed par byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa'i phyir gzhi yin gyi skyed par byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is a basis because it makes something endure, but not because it produces it.

original: gnas pa don gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ni phan pas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa don gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ni phan pas bshad pa yin no //
translated: The Master Vasubandhu explains that endurance is neither a different object nor not a different object.üîΩIf you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is endurance called a different object?‚Äù

original: ltung ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir gnas par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir gnas par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The answer is: because it is the obstruction of falling.

original: gegs zhes bya ba ci zhig gnas par byed pa pos de'i ltung ba'i gegs byas pa gang yin pa de ni don gzhan ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gegs zhes bya ba ci zhig gnas par byed pa pos de'i ltung ba'i gegs byas pa gang yin pa de ni don gzhan ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the obstruction?‚Äù the answer is: that which is the obstruction of falling by the one who endures. That is not a different object.

original: don gzhan nyid yin na ni de nyid la nye par sbyor ba'i phyir ji ltar ltung ba'i gegs yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan nyid yin na ni de nyid la nye par sbyor ba'i phyir ji ltar ltung ba'i gegs yin no //
translated: If it were a different object, then because it is applied to that, how could it be the obstruction of falling?

original: gegs kyi mi ltung ba la yang des gegs shes bya ba'i dngos po byas su zin kyang dngos po 'gro ba'i chos can bdag nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par nyams pa dang skyes pa med pa de go ci ste mi ltung zhes brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so
analyzed: gegs kyi mi ltung ba la yang des gegs shes bya ba'i dngos po byas su zin kyang dngos po 'gro ba'i chos can bdag nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par nyams pa dang skyes pa med pa de go ci ste mi ltung zhes brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so
translated: Even though the obstruction of falling is accomplished by that which is called the obstruction, the thing that has the nature of going does not fall because the special nature that has arisen does not deteriorate. Why is it that it does not fall? This objection is the same.

original: // gegs las khyad par grub na de yang bdag nyid @215a * //
analyzed: // gegs las khyad par grub na de yang bdag nyid @215a * //
translated: If the obstruction is established as a special thing, then that is also the nature of the obstruction.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dngos po de'i kho na yin pas ltung ba'am thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dngos po de'i kho na yin pas ltung ba'am thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is different, it would be the very thing that falls or collides, and there would be no end to falling or colliding.

original: gzhan dag de lta bur gyur pa'i bdag nyid byas pa la ni gegs su khas mi len to //
analyzed: gzhan dag de lta bur gyur pa'i bdag nyid byas pa la ni gegs su khas mi len to //
translated: Others do not accept that the self, which is of such a nature, is an obstruction to action.

original: de'i phyir ltung ba med pa gegs yin na de ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir ltung ba med pa gegs yin na de ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis byed /
translated: Therefore, if falling is an obstruction, how could it be produced by anything?

original: de rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar bya ba yin na dngos po med par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir med pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar bya ba yin na dngos po med par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir med pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is produced in some way, it is not tenable that it is a non-thing, and because the absurd consequence would be as before, there is no such thing as non-existence.

original: de'i phyir med pa byed do zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po'i bya ba 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa byed do zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po'i bya ba 'gog pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, to say that one produces non-existence is to deny the activity of a thing.

original: dngos po mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a thing does not act.

original: des na de ltung bar byed pa ma yin no zhes de ltar brjod par bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na de ltung bar byed pa ma yin no zhes de ltar brjod par bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, one should say that it does not cause falling in that way.

original: de yang 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: But that is precisely what is accepted.

original: de'i ltung ba des byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i ltung ba des byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not produced by its falling.

original: ltung ba'i chos can nyid yin pas rang nyid ltung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ltung ba'i chos can nyid yin pas rang nyid ltung ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the nature of a fall to fall,

original: gnam du 'phangs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnam du 'phangs pa bzhin no //
translated: like something thrown into the air.

original: de lta yin dang de la cung zad mi byed pa de ji ltar de'i gnas par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de la cung zad mi byed pa de ji ltar de'i gnas par byed pa yin /
translated: If that were so, then since it does nothing to it, how could it cause the thing to endure?

original: de'i phyir 'di gang gis kyang gegs byas pa med pa'i phyir nam yang gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gang gis kyang gegs byas pa med pa'i phyir nam yang gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is not obstructed by anything, it would never endure.

original: de'i phyir ltung ba'i gegs zhes bya bas kyang dngos po skad cig ma rnams kyi nye bar len pa dang yul mtshungs par skye bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ltung ba'i gegs zhes bya bas kyang dngos po skad cig ma rnams kyi nye bar len pa dang yul mtshungs par skye bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is called ‚Äúthe obstruction of falling,‚Äù it is said that the cause of the arising of momentary things is similar to the arising of the object.

original: de'i phyir chu'i de 'dra ba ni gzhi las skye bar grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir chu'i de 'dra ba ni gzhi las skye bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the water‚Äôs similarity is the cause of the arising of the water.

original: chu skyar yang gnas pa chu la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu skyar yang gnas pa chu la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The water fowl is also similar, because its endurance depends on the water.

original: de'i 'bras bu zhes rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu zhes rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The result of the water fowl is similar to the water.

original: chu skyar gyi gnas pa ni chu la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: chu skyar gyi gnas pa ni chu la brten pa yin te /
translated: The endurance of the water fowl depends on the water,

original: de las lus gnas pa thob pas de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las lus gnas pa thob pas de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its body is supported by the water, and it is connected to the water as its result.

original: yul la sogs pa la ltos nas chu go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa la ltos nas chu go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The water is understood in dependence on the place, etc.

original: phyogs 'dis go bar byed pa gzhan la yang 'brel pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis go bar byed pa gzhan la yang 'brel pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: By this method, the relation of the other means of understanding should be established.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las gzhan pa'i go bar byed pa ni med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las gzhan pa'i go bar byed pa ni med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no means of understanding other than the three kinds of reasons.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i rang bzhin ni med na mi 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i rang bzhin ni med na mi 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the absence of relation is not ascertained as invariably concomitant.

original: shes byed yan lag ma grub la //
analyzed: shes byed yan lag ma grub la //
translated: The means of understanding are not established.

original: shes byed nus pa yod min phyir //
analyzed: shes byed nus pa yod min phyir //
translated: Because the power of the means of understanding does not exist.

original: tshul gsum ma grub the tshom za //
analyzed: tshul gsum ma grub the tshom za //
translated: The three modes are not established. Doubt arises.

original: rtogs pa po yi sgrub byed min //
analyzed: rtogs pa po yi sgrub byed min //
translated: The one who understands is not the probandum.

original: shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs bdag nyid gang gis shes par byed pa yin pa de ma grub pa'am the @215b tshom za na shes par byed pa ma yin te sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs bdag nyid gang gis shes par byed pa yin pa de ma grub pa'am the @215b tshom za na shes par byed pa ma yin te sgra bzhin no //
translated: If the means of understanding is not established or is doubted, it is not a means of understanding, like a word.

original: gtan tshigs ni tshul gsum gyi don go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni tshul gsum gyi don go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: A reason is a means of understanding the meaning of the three modes.

original: tshang bang du mthong ba'i du ba las rgya mtshor me bzhin du ma 'brel ba las mi rtogs pa'i phyir dang / thams cad las thams cad rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir na 'brel pa med pa las kyang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshang bang du mthong ba'i du ba las rgya mtshor me bzhin du ma 'brel ba las mi rtogs pa'i phyir dang / thams cad las thams cad rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir na 'brel pa med pa las kyang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not understood from a non-related object, like the fire on the other side of the ocean from the smoke seen in the barn, and because it follows that everything would be understood from everything, it is not from a non-related object.

original: de'i phyir chos can dang 'brel pa dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag la ma grub pa'am the tshom za ba'i chos ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can dang 'brel pa dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag la ma grub pa'am the tshom za ba'i chos ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, a property that is not established or is doubted in relation to the subject, the pervasion, the counter pervasion, the probandum, and the proof is a seemingly correct reason.

original: de la / gcig rab ma grub the tshom na //
analyzed: de la / gcig rab ma grub the tshom na //
translated: With regard to that, if one is not established or doubted,

original: ma grub pa dang 'khrul pa can //
analyzed: ma grub pa dang 'khrul pa can //
translated: it is not established or mistaken.

original: gnyis ma grub bam the tshom na //
analyzed: gnyis ma grub bam the tshom na //
translated: If both are not established or doubted,

original: 'gal ba dang ni 'khrul pa can //
analyzed: 'gal ba dang ni 'khrul pa can //
translated: it is contradictory or mistaken.

original: tshul re re ma grub pa'am the tshom za na ma grub pa dang ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul re re ma grub pa'am the tshom za na ma grub pa dang ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one mode is not established or doubted, it becomes a seemingly correct reason that is not established or indefinite.

original: chos can dang 'brel pa ma grub nam grub pa yin te /
analyzed: chos can dang 'brel pa ma grub nam grub pa yin te /
translated: If the subject is not established, then the relation is not established.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag ste /
translated: For example, it is like the following: Sound is impermanent

original: mig gis gzung bya yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig gis gzung bya yin pa'i phyir ro // zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because it is perceptible by the eye.

original: shing rnams ni sems pa can yin te /
analyzed: shing rnams ni sems pa can yin te /
translated: It is like the following: Trees are sentient

original: shun pa thams cad bshus na 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shun pa thams cad bshus na 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they die when all their bark is removed.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol bas khas ma blangs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol bas khas ma blangs te /
translated: The opponent does not accept that,

original: rnam par shes pa dang dbang po dang tshe 'gags pa 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang dbang po dang tshe 'gags pa 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cessation of consciousness, faculties, and life is the definition of death.

original: 'chi ba khas len na sems pa can du ji ltar khas mi len /
analyzed: 'chi ba khas len na sems pa can du ji ltar khas mi len /
translated: If you accept death, then how could you not accept that they are sentient?

original: 'chi ba'i sgra 'jug pa grub pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sgra 'jug pa grub pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: The opponent might say that the term death is established.

original: sgra ni 'dod pas 'jug pas de'i dbang gis dngos po rnams par gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni 'dod pas 'jug pas de'i dbang gis dngos po rnams par gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: But since terms are used according to one‚Äôs wish, things do not exist by the power of that.

original: ha cang thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That would be absurd.

original: de'i phyir 'di skams la 'chi bar brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skams la 'chi bar brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, this is like saying that a corpse dies.

original: srog chags kyi 'chi ba ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: srog chags kyi 'chi ba ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: The death of a living being is not like that.

original: des na 'di ni shing dag la ma grub bo //
analyzed: des na 'di ni shing dag la ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, this is not established in regard to trees.

original: dngos po la ltos pa med pa 'dod pas 'jug pa'i sgra tsam yod pa'i phyir dngos pos go bar bya ba'i dngos po 'grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la ltos pa med pa 'dod pas 'jug pa'i sgra tsam yod pa'i phyir dngos pos go bar bya ba'i dngos po 'grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since the mere sound of the word is accepted without regard to the thing, the thing to be understood is not established by the thing.

original: 'dis ni blo dang gnas la sogs pa rnams sems pa med pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa'i blo sngon du 'gro ba can nyid la sogs par sgrub par byed pa mi rtag pa nyid dang / dbyibs kyi khyad par la sogs pa dag kyang bshad pa yin no //üîΩder yang sgra tsam 'ba' @216a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni blo dang gnas la sogs pa rnams sems pa med pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa'i blo sngon du 'gro ba can nyid la sogs par sgrub par byed pa mi rtag pa nyid dang / dbyibs kyi khyad par la sogs pa dag kyang bshad pa yin no // der yang sgra tsam 'ba' @216a * //
translated: This also proves that the mind, the abode, etc., are without thought and are preceded by a superior mind, etc. Impermanence and the particular shape, etc., are also explained.

original: zhig grub kyi don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhig grub kyi don ni ma yin no //
translated: There, only the mere sound is established, not the meaning.

original: nyams pa med pa'i bdag nyid nye bar zhi ba ni mi rtag pa nyid du gzhan dag mi 'dod do //
analyzed: nyams pa med pa'i bdag nyid nye bar zhi ba ni mi rtag pa nyid du gzhan dag mi 'dod do //
translated: Others do not accept that the self, which is of the nature of not being damaged, is impermanent.

original: gal te khyad par brjod par 'dod pa med pa'i spyi grub pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te khyad par brjod par 'dod pa med pa'i spyi grub pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the universal is not established without the desire to express the particular,

original: de grub na khyad par rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas ma grub par rtsod pa ni lan log pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de grub na khyad par rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas ma grub par rtsod pa ni lan log pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you can establish that, then the opponent‚Äôs argument that the word ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is not established by way of its specific property is a wrong response.

original: gal te byas pa nyid la sogs pa ltar mi rtag pa'i sgra 'di gang dang 'brel pa'i dngos po cung zad gcig gnyi gas kyang spyir 'dod pa yin na lan log par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gal te byas pa nyid la sogs pa ltar mi rtag pa'i sgra 'di gang dang 'brel pa'i dngos po cung zad gcig gnyi gas kyang spyir 'dod pa yin na lan log par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: If both parties agree that the word ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is related to something, like the word ‚Äúmade,‚Äù then the opponent‚Äôs argument is a wrong response.

original: bskal ba nyid yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bskal ba nyid yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But doesn‚Äôt the word ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù exist?

original: de la ni gzhan dag mi rtag par mi brjod do //
analyzed: de la ni gzhan dag mi rtag par mi brjod do //
translated: Others do not say that it is impermanent.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do they say?

original: 'jig pa la'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa la'o //
translated: They say that it is destroyed.

original: gal te zhig pa dang bskal ba dag mi gsal ba nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir gnyi ga la yang spyi yod pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zhig pa dang bskal ba dag mi gsal ba nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir gnyi ga la yang spyi yod pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If destruction and destruction of a kalpa are similar in being unclear, then doesn‚Äôt a universal exist for both?üîΩWhat is this so-called ‚Äúunclear‚Äù?

original: ci ste mi gsal ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste mi gsal ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid do zhe na /
translated: It is the nature of what is not seen.

original: mtshan nyid 'dis gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa yang mi rtag par yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'dis gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa yang mi rtag par yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By this definition, even prakriti, purusha, and so on would become impermanent.

original: sngar chos gzhan yin pa mi gsal ba mi rtag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sngar chos gzhan yin pa mi gsal ba mi rtag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that previously it was not clear that it was a different phenomenon, but now it is clear that it is impermanent,

original: sngar chos gzhan yang yin la nyams pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: sngar chos gzhan yang yin la nyams pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin no //
translated: then previously it was a different phenomenon and it was also an entity that did not disintegrate.

original: zhes legs par tha snyad byas so //
analyzed: zhes legs par tha snyad byas so //
translated: This is a good way to make conventional assertions.

original: 'dis ni de'i gnas skabs ldog pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni de'i gnas skabs ldog pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the reversal of its state.

original: gang zhig gnas skabs ldog pa bskal pa dang 'dra ba sgra'i don du smra ba de la yang yin la nyams pa med pa yang yin /
analyzed: gang zhig gnas skabs ldog pa bskal pa dang 'dra ba sgra'i don du smra ba de la yang yin la nyams pa med pa yang yin /
translated: If you say that the reversal of its state is like the reversal of an eon, and that the meaning of the word is that it is also an entity that does not disintegrate,

original: gnas skabs ldog gi gnas skabs can ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs ldog gi gnas skabs can ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but it is not an entity that has a state,

original: gnas skabs zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / chu 'dzin pa la sogs don byed pa nye bar bsgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / chu 'dzin pa la sogs don byed pa nye bar bsgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: then what is this so-called state? It is the performance of a function, such as holding water, that is accomplished.

original: 'di bum pa'o zhes 'jig rten pa 'di gang la mngon sum du lhag par zhen pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di bum pa'o zhes 'jig rten pa 'di gang la mngon sum du lhag par zhen pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is what worldly people directly cling to when they say, ‚ÄúThis is a pot.‚Äù

original: de log na gzhan ma log kyang 'di thams cad med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de log na gzhan ma log kyang 'di thams cad med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If that is reversed, then even if the others are not reversed, all of this is nonexistent.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni 'o na gnas skabs de nyid bum pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na gnas skabs de nyid bum pa yin te /
translated: If that is so, then at that time the vase would exist.

original: de ni ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the characteristics that have been explained.

original: de yang log pa'i phyir gnas skabs can ma log par gnas pa ni brgal zhing brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang log pa'i phyir gnas skabs can ma log par gnas pa ni brgal zhing brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: And because that is refuted, the one who maintains that the one that has a state does not cease is to be refuted.

original: yod kyang bum pa'i dngos por ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod kyang bum pa'i dngos por ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if it exists, it would not be the entity of the vase,

original: de'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not have the characteristics of that.

original: dngos po gcig nyid gnas skabs gzhan dang 'brel pa'i @216b phyir /
analyzed: dngos po gcig nyid gnas skabs gzhan dang 'brel pa'i @216b phyir /
translated: Because the very same entity is related to another state,

original: tha dad par mngon pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad par mngon pa yin no zhe na /
translated: it is evident that it is different.

original: gnas skabs tha dad pa de nyid dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: gnas skabs tha dad pa de nyid dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: Why do you not accept that very difference in state as the characteristic of difference in entity?

original: de lta yin dang bde ba la sogs pa rnam pa tha dad par 'gyur bar gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bde ba la sogs pa rnam pa tha dad par 'gyur bar gdon mi za'o //
translated: If that were the case, then without a doubt pleasure and so on would be different aspects.

original: rang bzhin 'ga' zhig rjes su byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'ga' zhig rjes su byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a nature that is uniform,

original: gnas skabs tha dad kyang tha mi dad do zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs tha dad kyang tha mi dad do zhe na /
translated: even though there is a difference in state, there is no difference.

original: 'di ni bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang skyes bu rnams la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang skyes bu rnams la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is this not the same for pleasure, etc., and the person?

original: tha dad na rim gyis mngon par gsal ba 'gal ba'i phyir gcig yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad na rim gyis mngon par gsal ba 'gal ba'i phyir gcig yin no zhe na /
translated: If they are different, they must be manifested simultaneously, because it is contradictory for them to be manifested sequentially.

original: de ci da ni rim ma yin par mngon par gsal bas bum pa dang zho la sogs pa du ma yin nam ci /
analyzed: de ci da ni rim ma yin par mngon par gsal bas bum pa dang zho la sogs pa du ma yin nam ci /
translated: But are not many things, such as a pot, yogurt, etc., manifested simultaneously?

original: rim gyis mngon par gsal ba la tha mi dad pas khyab pa ma grub na 'gal ba yang ci yin /
analyzed: rim gyis mngon par gsal ba la tha mi dad pas khyab pa ma grub na 'gal ba yang ci yin /
translated: If it is not established that they are not different because they are manifested sequentially, then what is the contradiction?

original: rim pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin pas de ma grub par de mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin pas de ma grub par de mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the sequence is the effect of that, it is not established without the establishment of that.

original: tha dad pa med pa nyid ni cher rim pa med par thal ba yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa nyid ni cher rim pa med par thal ba yin te /
translated: If there is no difference, it follows that there is no sequence,

original: gcig gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because they are the same as one.

original: 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir tha mi dad pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir tha mi dad pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are not different because they are the effect of that,

original: gal te 'brel pa grub na rigs pa yin na de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa la mi 'grub pa zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa grub na rigs pa yin na de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa la mi 'grub pa zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: if the relation is established, it is reasonable. But it is not established in the absence of concomitance. This will be explained.

original: ji ltar 'brel pa'i khyad par spangs kyang rgyu dag las skyes pa la byas pa'i sgra yin pa ltar gang la mi rtag pa'i sgra 'di 'jug par 'gyur ba tha dad par rtog pa med kyang zhig pa dang cig shos dag la thun mong gi chos ni rnamüîΩpa thams cad du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'brel pa'i khyad par spangs kyang rgyu dag las skyes pa la byas pa'i sgra yin pa ltar gang la mi rtag pa'i sgra 'di 'jug par 'gyur ba tha dad par rtog pa med kyang zhig pa dang cig shos dag la thun mong gi chos ni rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And just as the word ‚Äúmade‚Äù is applied to what is produced from causes, even though the particular relation has been abandoned, so too the word ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is applied to what is destroyed, even though the particular relation has been abandoned.

original: shing dang skyes bu dag la 'chi ba'i spyi yang de bzhin te /üîΩgal te gang zhig mthong bas srog chags gzhan las shi bar rtog pa de 'dra bar shing dag la dmigs nas de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing dang skyes bu dag la 'chi ba'i spyi yang de bzhin te / gal te gang zhig mthong bas srog chags gzhan las shi bar rtog pa de 'dra bar shing dag la dmigs nas de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as the word ‚Äúmade‚Äù is applied to what is produced from causes, even though the particular relation has been abandoned, so too the word ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is applied to what is destroyed, even though the particular relation has been abandoned.üîΩAnd just as the word ‚Äúmade‚Äù is applied to what is produced from causes, even though the particular relation has been abandoned, so too the word ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is applied to what is destroyed, even though the particular relation has been abandoned.üîΩAnd just as the word ‚Äúmade‚Äù is applied to what is produced from causes, even though the particular relation has been abandoned, so too the word ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is applied to what is destroyed, even though the particular relation has been abandoned.üîΩAnd just as the word ‚Äúmade‚Äù is applied to what is produced from causes, even though the particular relation has been abandoned, so too the word ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is applied to what is destroyed, even though the particular relation has been abandoned.üîΩAnd just as the word ‚Äúmade‚Äù is applied to what is produced from causes, even though the particular relation has been abandoned, so too the word ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is applied to what is destroyed, even though the particular relation has been abandoned.

original: ci ste skam pa la sogs pa nyid 'chi ba'i sgrar brjod na de la yang gang las 'grub par 'gyur ba sems pa can la sogs pa med par brtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste skam pa la sogs pa nyid 'chi ba'i sgrar brjod na de la yang gang las 'grub par 'gyur ba sems pa can la sogs pa med par brtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as the word ‚Äúmade‚Äù is applied to what is produced from causes, even though the particular relation has been abandoned, so too the word ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is applied to what is destroyed, even though the particular relation has been abandoned.üîΩAnd just as

original: de bzhin du dbyibs kyang gal te ci 'dra ba zhig blo sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ba khang bzangs la sogs pa'i bye brag tu 'jug pa can gang zhig mthong na byed pa po ma mthong ba rnams la yang byas pa'i blor 'gyur ba de 'dra
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyibs kyang gal te ci 'dra ba zhig blo sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ba khang bzangs la sogs pa'i bye brag tu 'jug pa can gang zhig mthong na byed pa po ma mthong ba rnams la yang byas pa'i blor 'gyur ba de 'dra
translated: So too, if you see that shape is preceded by cognition, and if you see that it is applied to the particulars of a mansion and so on, then you will think that it is produced even when you do not see the agent.

original: ba yin na yang gtan tshigs thams cad de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba yin na yang gtan tshigs thams cad de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if the shape is such that when it is seen, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is the shape of a house,‚Äù and so on, and if one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is a product,‚Äù even when one does not see the agent, then all reasons would be like that.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / dbyibs sogs ci 'dra byin rlob bo //üîΩyod @217a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dbyibs sogs ci 'dra byin rlob bo // yod @217a * //
translated: How could one bless the shape and so on?üîΩIt is established that it follows

original: med rjes 'jug can grub pa //üîΩde las rjes su dpog gang yin //
analyzed: med rjes 'jug can grub pa // de las rjes su dpog gang yin //
translated: The existence or nonexistence of the shape.üîΩThat which is inferred from that

original: de ni rig pa can yin no //
analyzed: de ni rig pa can yin no //
translated: Is the reasoning of the NaiyƒÅyika.

original: dngos tha dad las rab grub pa //
analyzed: dngos tha dad las rab grub pa //
translated: The pot is established from a different thing,

original: sgra tha dad las ma grub bo //
analyzed: sgra tha dad las ma grub bo //
translated: But sound is not established from a different thing.

original: rjes dpog rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: rjes dpog rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: Inference is not a reasoning,

original: skye bo'i rdzas la me bzhin no //
analyzed: skye bo'i rdzas la me bzhin no //
translated: Like fire from a substance of a person.

original: de ltar min na rdza mkhan gyis //üîΩbum pa la sogs 'jim pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar min na rdza mkhan gyis // bum pa la sogs 'jim pa yi //
translated: If that were not so, then since the potterüîΩMakes a different transformation of clay

original: rnam 'gyur gzhan zhig byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam 'gyur gzhan zhig byed pa'i phyir //
translated: In the case of a pot and so on,

original: grog mkhar yang des byas grub bo //
analyzed: grog mkhar yang des byas grub bo //
translated: It would follow that an anthill is also made by him.

original: bsgrub bya rjes 'gro phyir 'bras bu //
analyzed: bsgrub bya rjes 'gro phyir 'bras bu //
translated: Because the effect is subsequent to the object of attainment.

original: spyis kyang bsgrub par byas yin na //
analyzed: spyis kyang bsgrub par byas yin na //
translated: If the universal also establishes the object of attainment,

original: 'brel pa can ni tha dad phyir //
analyzed: 'brel pa can ni tha dad phyir //
translated: The related is different,

original: tha dad skyon brjod 'bras mtshungs 'dod //
analyzed: tha dad skyon brjod 'bras mtshungs 'dod //
translated: So the fault of difference is stated, and the effect is considered the same.

original: rigs gzhan la ni rab grub pa //
analyzed: rigs gzhan la ni rab grub pa //
translated: Well established in other types,

original: sgra yi spyi ni mthong ba las //
analyzed: sgra yi spyi ni mthong ba las //
translated: From seeing the universal of sound,

original: sgrub byed mi rigs dag la sogs //
analyzed: sgrub byed mi rigs dag la sogs //
translated: The establishment is unreasonable in the pure and so on.

original: go nyid nyid na rva can bzhin //
analyzed: go nyid nyid na rva can bzhin //
translated: Just like the one with horns,

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir //
translated: Because of the dependence of what is wished to be expressed,

original: sgra rnams gang la'ang med ma yin //
analyzed: sgra rnams gang la'ang med ma yin //
translated: The sounds do not exist anywhere.

original: de yod pas ni don grub na //
analyzed: de yod pas ni don grub na //
translated: If the meaning is established by its existence,

original: thams cad kyis ni thams cad 'grub //
analyzed: thams cad kyis ni thams cad 'grub //
translated: Everything would establish everything.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ma grub na //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ma grub na //
translated: If the nature of things is not established,

original: tshul 'di grub na ma grub kyang //
analyzed: tshul 'di grub na ma grub kyang //
translated: If this method is established, even if not established,

original: khyad par gnod byed ma yin te //
analyzed: khyad par gnod byed ma yin te //
translated: It does not harm the distinction,

original: sgra yi nam mkha' la brten bzhin //
analyzed: sgra yi nam mkha' la brten bzhin //
translated: Just like sound is based on space.

original: sgra ma grub kyang dngos po ni //
analyzed: sgra ma grub kyang dngos po ni //
translated: Even if sound is not established, if things

original: grub na grub par 'gyur te dper //
analyzed: grub na grub par 'gyur te dper //
translated: Are established, they will be established, for example,

original: 'ug pa pa la sangs rgyas pa //
analyzed: 'ug pa pa la sangs rgyas pa //
translated: Like the owl and the Buddha,

original: lus sogs sgrub byed bshad pa bzhin //
analyzed: lus sogs sgrub byed bshad pa bzhin //
translated: Explained as the establisher of the body and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: This is the verse in the middle.

original: dper na mngon par gsal bar smra ba la byas pa nyid ma grub bo //
analyzed: dper na mngon par gsal bar smra ba la byas pa nyid ma grub bo //
translated: For example, the statement ‚ÄúThe probandum is not established‚Äù is not established for the proponent of manifestation.

original: zhes bstan bcos la brten nas gang yang rung ba la ma grub par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa thams cad la ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bstan bcos la brten nas gang yang rung ba la ma grub par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa thams cad la ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is said to be unestablished for someone based on a treatise is not so for all inferences.

original: tshad mas mthong ba la khas blangs pas ma grub par rtsod pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang rjes su dpag pa la bstan bcos skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas mthong ba la khas blangs pas ma grub par rtsod pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang rjes su dpag pa la bstan bcos skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable to argue that what is seen by valid knowledge is unestablished due to the assertion of the opponent, and because a treatise is not the context for inference.

original: tshad ma nyid kyis gnod pa'am de'i ngo bo tshad mas ma rtogs na mngon par gsal bar smra ba ci zhig bya /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid kyis gnod pa'am de'i ngo bo tshad mas ma rtogs na mngon par gsal bar smra ba ci zhig bya /
translated: If it is undermined by valid knowledge itself or if its nature is not realized by valid knowledge, what is the use of the proponent of manifestation?

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid la bstan bcos kyi sgo nas gang yang rung ba la ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid la bstan bcos kyi sgo nas gang yang rung ba la ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, for inference based on a treatise, whatever is unestablished for someone is due to the treatise.

original: gzhan la ni ma shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: For others, it is due to lack of knowledge.

original: des na dper brjod pa ma smras so //
analyzed: des na dper brjod pa ma smras so //
translated: Therefore, the example is not stated.

original: slob dpon gyis ni dper brjod pa'i phyogs tsam zhig bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni dper brjod pa'i phyogs tsam zhig bshad do //
translated: The master has explained only a part of the example.

original: @217b gang yang dper na sgras mi rtag ste /
analyzed: @217b gang yang dper na sgras mi rtag ste /
translated: For example, it is like saying that sound is impermanent

original: sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma grub ba yin par brjod pa de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag ni tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma grub ba yin par brjod pa de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag ni tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is sound. Even that is said to be unestablished in the meaning of the thesis because the probandum and the proof are different.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can rang nyid bsgrub pa la sgrub par byed pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi ngo bor ma grub par brjod do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can rang nyid bsgrub pa la sgrub par byed pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi ngo bor ma grub par brjod do //
translated: Because the probandum itself is not established as the proof in the proof, it is said to be unestablished as the nature of the reason.

original: de nyid de'i sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid de'i sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: That itself is not the proof of that,

original: de'i ngo bo tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin na yang de bstan pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin na yang de bstan pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if it were merely related to its nature, teaching it would be pointless.

original: de la khyad par gzhan bsten pa ni med do //
analyzed: de la khyad par gzhan bsten pa ni med do //
translated: There is no reliance on another distinction there.

original: de sgra nyid kyis de ltar 'gyur na phyogs bstan pa nyid na de ltar 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de sgra nyid kyis de ltar 'gyur na phyogs bstan pa nyid na de ltar 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were like that by the mere word, it would be established like that when the position is taught.

original: phyis kyang rang nyid kho nas de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang rang nyid kho nas de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be so of itself later on as well.

original: de'i phyir de rang nyid kyi gtan tshigs su ma grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rang nyid kyi gtan tshigs su ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is not established as a reason of itself.

original: sgra ci ltar ma grub ce na sgra grub ste de bdag nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin du ma grub pa'i phyir ma grub par brjod do //
analyzed: sgra ci ltar ma grub ce na sgra grub ste de bdag nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin du ma grub pa'i phyir ma grub par brjod do //
translated: How is sound not established? Sound is established, but it is said not to be established as the nature of a reason that is itself.

original: sgra de ni phyogs su byas pa gang zhig gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba'i sgra gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra de ni phyogs su byas pa gang zhig gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba'i sgra gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other sound that is a subject and would be a reason.

original: de nyid gtan tshigs yin na yang bstan par mi bya'o zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: de nyid gtan tshigs yin na yang bstan par mi bya'o zhes brjod zin to //
translated: And it has already been said that even if it were a reason, it should not be stated.

original: rtag tu de'i ngo bo grub pa'i phyir rtsod pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu de'i ngo bo grub pa'i phyir rtsod pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And there would be no dispute because its nature is always established.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba'i phyir mi 'grub po zhe na de da ci chos can gzhan la rjes su 'gro'am /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba'i phyir mi 'grub po zhe na de da ci chos can gzhan la rjes su 'gro'am /
translated: If you say it is not established because concomitance is not seen, is it concomitant with another subject?

original: sgron ma la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bor rung ba nyid kyis bdag nyid kyi rnam par shes pa bskyed na de ltar gsal bas rang gi bdag nyid gsal bar byed pas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bor rung ba nyid kyis bdag nyid kyi rnam par shes pa bskyed na de ltar gsal bas rang gi bdag nyid gsal bar byed pas zhes brjod do //
translated: The lamp, etc., are suitable as the nature of consciousness, and so it is said that they illuminate themselves by generating their own consciousnesses in a clear way.

original: rtags dang rtags can ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: But the mark and the marked are not like that.

original: de'i dngos po la tha dad pa brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po la tha dad pa brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their entities are different.

original: rtags rang nyid rnam par shes pa'i yul du gyur pas ni rtags can rtog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags rang nyid rnam par shes pa'i yul du gyur pas ni rtags can rtog par byed pa yin no //
translated: The mark, which is itself the object of consciousness, causes the marked to be conceived.

original: chos can gyi rang gi sgrub par byed pa yin na ni thal ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can gyi rang gi sgrub par byed pa yin na ni thal ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mark were the proof of the property possessor, then this consequence would follow.

original: dngos po thams cad la chos dang chos can gyi dbye ba ma grub pa'i phyir skyon 'di thams cad la mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad la chos dang chos can gyi dbye ba ma grub pa'i phyir skyon 'di thams cad la mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: But since the distinction of property and property possessor is not established for all things, this fault applies to all of them.

original: 'di la dngos po rnams kyi ldog pa la brten pa'i tha snyad tha dad pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa tha dad de bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la dngos po rnams kyi ldog pa la brten pa'i tha snyad tha dad pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa tha dad de bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that the proof and the probandum are different in the case of things that are different in dependence upon their conceptual difference.

original: don dam pa rnam par dpyad na ni de lta bur gyur pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa rnam par dpyad na ni de lta bur gyur pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the negation of sameness and difference applies to

original: kun rdzob pa'i don @218a * //üîΩrnams la de nyid dang gzhan nyid 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i don @218a * // rnams la de nyid dang gzhan nyid 'gog pa yin no //
translated: objects of the conventional.üîΩThe conventions of inference and the inferred are posited on the basis ofüîΩthe difference that is established in consciousness.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.

analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad ni shes pa la grub pa'i tha dad pa la brten nas 'jog pa yin no //
translated: The difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.
