analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta'i tha dad kyi //
translated: The difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the object

translated: is not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the objectüîΩis not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the object

analyzed: de ni tha snyad rten yin no //
translated: is not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the object

analyzed: 'di ni tha snyad kyis gzhag pa //
translated: is not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the object

translated: is not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the object

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dag go / de'i phyir chos can ni gtan tshigs su gnyi ga la ma grub bo //
translated: is not the basis of the conventional.üîΩThe difference of the object

original: 'dis ni chos kyang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos kyang bshad pa yin no //
translated: is not the basis of the conventional.

original: de yang gal te de nyid las grub na /
analyzed: de yang gal te de nyid las grub na /
translated: If it is established from itself,

original: de ni snga ma kho nar bstan pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur bar brjod do //
analyzed: de ni snga ma kho nar bstan pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur bar brjod do //
translated: then it is just as previously explained, so the fault stated previously applies.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ma grub par brjod pa yang 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ma grub par brjod pa yang 'brel pa med do //
translated: And the statement that the reason is not established is also irrelevant,

original: de nyid bdag nyid la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bdag nyid la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not follow that it is itself.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan pa gtan tshigs su brjod pa de'i tshe ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan pa gtan tshigs su brjod pa de'i tshe ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that when the reason is stated as ‚Äúdifferent from the dissimilar,‚Äù then what?

original: de la yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas de las gzhan pa ni bsgrub bya nyid yin pa'i phyir ma grub bo //
analyzed: de la yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas de las gzhan pa ni bsgrub bya nyid yin pa'i phyir ma grub bo //
translated: In that case, too, the absence of the object of affirmation is the dissimilar class, and that which is different from that is the object of affirmation itself, so the reason is not established.

original: gal te phyogs la sogs ba rnams phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid phyogs la yod pa kho na ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyogs la sogs ba rnams phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid phyogs la yod pa kho na ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the reason is not established because the positions, etc., are mutually different and the dissimilar class does not exist in the position itself,üîΩthen what?

original: phyogs gang zhig yin la mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang gang zhig bsgrub par 'dod pa de ni phyogs yin la de med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: phyogs gang zhig yin la mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang gang zhig bsgrub par 'dod pa de ni phyogs yin la de med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: What is the position? What is the counter-position? That which is to be established is the position; the absence of that is the counter-position.

original: 'o na ni de 'dod pas gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas dngos po'i dbang gi rnam bar gnas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel ba ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ni de 'dod pas gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas dngos po'i dbang gi rnam bar gnas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel ba ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But then, since it is defined as that which is accepted, how can the counter-position be eliminated by the power of the real fact?

original: de lta na ni gtan tshigs 'ga' yang ma nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni gtan tshigs 'ga' yang ma nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then no reason would ever be indeterminate.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang 'dod pas byas pa'i phyir ro zhes mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang 'dod pas byas pa'i phyir ro zhes mang du bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained this at length: the counter-position is also created by acceptance.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs yin la de las gzhan pa yang chos can la grub na gang gi don du gtan tshigs brjod pa ma grub pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs yin la de las gzhan pa yang chos can la grub na gang gi don du gtan tshigs brjod pa ma grub pa ci zhig yod /
translated: If the similar position is not the probandum, and if the property-possessor is established in the other, then what is the unestablished object for the sake of which the reason is stated?

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma grub tsam gyis ni thams cad du ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma grub tsam gyis ni thams cad du ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that everything is so, merely because the probandum is not established.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de med par gnyi ga la nges pa @218b yin no //
analyzed: de med par gnyi ga la nges pa @218b yin no //
translated: If it did not exist, then both would be ascertained.

original: ma nges pa'i chos can la ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i chos can la ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid grub bo zhe na /
translated: If the subject is not ascertained, then it is not established that it is not the counter-position.

original: de lta na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then even when there is doubt about the property of the probandum, it would not be the counter-position.

original: des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog par ma nges pa'i rang bzhin 'di ji ltar sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog par ma nges pa'i rang bzhin 'di ji ltar sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could the nature of this non-ascertainment of the negation of the absence of the probandum be established as not being the counter-position?

original: de'i mtshan nyid ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its definition is not ascertained.

original: de nyid kyi nges par byed do zhe na ji ltar ma nges pa la nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid kyi nges par byed do zhe na ji ltar ma nges pa la nges par 'gyur /
translated: If it is said that it is ascertained by that itself, how could it be ascertained when it is not ascertained?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yin pa'i sgra ni ldog pa ma nges par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yin pa'i sgra ni ldog pa ma nges par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: The word ‚Äúis‚Äù in the counter-position expresses the non-ascertainment of the negation.

original: ji ltar de nyid kyis bsgrub bya med pa la ldog par nges gang gi phyir 'di 'dir the tshom za ba'i phyir 'di na med do //
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid kyis bsgrub bya med pa la ldog par nges gang gi phyir 'di 'dir the tshom za ba'i phyir 'di na med do //
translated: How could it be ascertained that the absence of the probandum is negated by that itself? Because there is doubt about this here, it does not exist here.

original: zhes bya ba yang legs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang legs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is also a good statement.

original: de'i phyir chos rnams kyi 'jug pa dang ldog par phyogs rnam par gzhag pa la mi ltos pa de dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas phung po ldog par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos rnams kyi 'jug pa dang ldog par phyogs rnam par gzhag pa la mi ltos pa de dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas phung po ldog par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who do not rely on the establishment of the position of the engagement and disengagement of phenomena are not the agents of the reversal of the aggregates, because they are characterized by the mutual exclusion of one another.

original: de dag las gcig ldog pa ni gzhan 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mi rtag pa med pa la ldog mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la grub /
analyzed: de dag las gcig ldog pa ni gzhan 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mi rtag pa med pa la ldog mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la grub /
translated: Since the engagement of one of them is the disengagement of the other, how can the impermanent be established as the subject to be proven as the disengagement of the impermanent?

original: de ci da ni phyogs kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ram zhe na rnam grangs kyis ni 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de ci da ni phyogs kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ram zhe na rnam grangs kyis ni 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: How can it be that now the position becomes the counter-position? By way of enumeration, it can be so.

original: mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba ni brjod zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba ni brjod zin pa nyid do //
translated: The classification of characteristics has already been stated.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su the tshom mi za na ni bsgrub bya med pa rnam par gcad pa'i don du gtan tshigs brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su the tshom mi za na ni bsgrub bya med pa rnam par gcad pa'i don du gtan tshigs brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is no doubt about the counter-position, then the reason is not stated for the purpose of excluding the non-existence of the probandum.

original: gang las skyon 'dir 'gyur ba gtan tshigs kyis 'brel pa ston pa'i dus na phyogs la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las skyon 'dir 'gyur ba gtan tshigs kyis 'brel pa ston pa'i dus na phyogs la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is said that the example is not established, then the definition of the example is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the definition is not established, then the definition is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the definition is not pervaded, then the example is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the example is not established, then the definition of the example is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the definition is not established, then the definition is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the definition is not pervaded, then the example is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the example is not established, then the definition of the example is stated.

original: 'di 'ba' zhig nyid 'ga' zhig yod pa dang med pa dag tu 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag tu bstan na rang nyid yod pa dang shugs kyis de de lta bur sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'di 'ba' zhig nyid 'ga' zhig yod pa dang med pa dag tu 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag tu bstan na rang nyid yod pa dang shugs kyis de de lta bur sgrub par byed do //
translated: If it is said that the definition is not established, then the definition is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the definition is not pervaded, then the example is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the example is not established, then the definition of the example is stated.

original: de'i phyir de'i shugs kyi yul rjes thogs pa de ni phyogs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i shugs kyi yul rjes thogs pa de ni phyogs zhes brjod do //
translated: If it is said that the definition is not established, then the definition is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the definition is not pervaded, then the example is stated.

original: des na de'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas 'ongs pa'i chos ni ston par byed pa'i dus na med pa'i phyir yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas 'ongs pa'i chos ni ston par byed pa'i dus na med pa'i phyir yan lag ma yin no //
translated: If it is said that the example is not established, then the definition of the example is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the definition is not established, then the definition is stated.

original: 'o na de las bzlog pa gzhan las rnam par grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gang yin pa de 'di yin no //üîΩde la ni skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: 'o na de las bzlog pa gzhan las rnam par grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gang yin pa de 'di yin no // de la ni skyon 'di med de /
translated: If it is said that the definition is not pervaded, then the example is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the example is not established, then the definition of the example is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the definition is not established, then the definition is stated.

original: gzhan smos pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde @219a * //
analyzed: gzhan smos pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde @219a * //
translated: If it is said that the definition is not pervaded, then the example is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the example is not established, then the definition of the example is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the definition is not established, then the definition is stated.üîΩIf it is said that the definition is not pervaded,

original: las bzlog pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos su 'gyur gyi med pa 'ba' zhig dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las bzlog pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos su 'gyur gyi med pa 'ba' zhig dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The mere absence of the opposite is the property to be established, not the mere absence of the existent.

original: des na bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag khyad par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: des na bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag khyad par yod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there is a difference between the property to be established and the proof.

original: 'di la yang khyad par nye bar gzung ba ni 'dod pa nyid la gnod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di la yang khyad par nye bar gzung ba ni 'dod pa nyid la gnod par byed do //
translated: But the mere assertion of a difference is unacceptable.

original: de med par khas len na ni gzhan smos par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de med par khas len na ni gzhan smos par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: If you accept that it does not exist, then it cannot be mentioned as something else.

original: dper na ma tha ra'i bu las gzhan pa'i bram ze la zan byin cig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ma tha ra'i bu las gzhan pa'i bram ze la zan byin cig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúGive food to a Brahmin other than MƒÅthara‚Äôs son.‚Äù

original: ma tha ra'i bu bram ze ma yin na ni bram ze la zan byin cig ces bya ba nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma tha ra'i bu bram ze ma yin na ni bram ze la zan byin cig ces bya ba nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If MƒÅthara‚Äôs son were not a Brahmin, then it would be said, ‚ÄúGive food to a Brahmin.‚Äù

original: med pa ces bya ba 'di ni pha rol po'i bsam pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa ces bya ba 'di ni pha rol po'i bsam pa yin te /
translated: The opponent thinks that the word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù refers to the property to be established.

original: de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis de skad brjod do //
analyzed: de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis de skad brjod do //
translated: They say this because of their own thoughts.

original: des na med pa gzhan dang bral bar khyod kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na med pa gzhan dang bral bar khyod kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, since you accept that it is devoid of otherness that does not exist, that is the meaning of the statement.

original: zhe na / de la yang don dam par med pa la phan tshun rnam par dbye ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: zhe na / de la yang don dam par med pa la phan tshun rnam par dbye ba ci zhig yod /
translated: If you say that, then what sort of mutual difference can there be in ultimate reality between that which does not exist and that which does not exist?

original: gcig gi rang bzhin gzhan la ma mthong bas 'di la tha dad pa yin no zhes blos rtogs pa yin na dngos po med pa de dag la yod yod na yang med par mi 'gyur te de ni yod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi rang bzhin gzhan la ma mthong bas 'di la tha dad pa yin no zhes blos rtogs pa yin na dngos po med pa de dag la yod yod na yang med par mi 'gyur te de ni yod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you think that the difference is that the nature of one is not seen in the other, and that the mind understands that they are different, then those non-things would exist, and if they exist, they would not be non-existent, because that is the characteristic of existence.

original: rnam par rtog pas bkod pa 'di dag bdag nyid med pa yin yang smra ba po dag brjod pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa lta bur ston par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas bkod pa 'di dag bdag nyid med pa yin yang smra ba po dag brjod pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa lta bur ston par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: These conceptual superimpositions are themselves non-existent, but the proponents of these positions merely display them as if they had the difference of being other.

original: des byas pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni dngos po rnam par 'jog pa'i rten ma yin te /
analyzed: des byas pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni dngos po rnam par 'jog pa'i rten ma yin te /
translated: The difference created by them is not the basis for positing things.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that it leads to absurdity.

original: gcig la gcig tha dad pa yod pa dang rjes su 'brel par ston pa 'dis ni thams cad med pa 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig tha dad pa yod pa dang rjes su 'brel par ston pa 'dis ni thams cad med pa 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: This shows that they are related to each other as different, and that everything would be nonexistent.

original: de lta na yang med pa gzhan dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ma grub pa nyid dam 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang med pa gzhan dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ma grub pa nyid dam 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, the reason ‚Äúbecause of being devoid of another non-existent‚Äù is either unestablished or mistaken.

original: ci ste yang de'i mngon par 'dod pa 'ga' zhig la tha dad pa yin na de ltar 'gyur na 'o na ni de las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid 'dod pa las yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang de'i mngon par 'dod pa 'ga' zhig la tha dad pa yin na de ltar 'gyur na 'o na ni de las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid 'dod pa las yin te /
translated: But if they are different in some respect that is accepted, then it would be just that which is accepted as the nature of the thing, because it is different from that.

original: yang 'dod pa gzhan du 'gyur na gzhan la yang de lta bu yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'dod pa gzhan du 'gyur na gzhan la yang de lta bu yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were another thing that is accepted, then it would be just that which is accepted as the nature of the thing, because it is different from that.

original: de'i phyir 'dir 'dod pa nyid la nus pa rnam par gnas pa'i phyir de nyid 'dod pa'i dngos po'i rang @219b bzhin gyi sgrub byed du brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir 'dod pa nyid la nus pa rnam par gnas pa'i phyir de nyid 'dod pa'i dngos po'i rang @219b bzhin gyi sgrub byed du brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the capacity is restricted to that which is accepted here, just that which is accepted would be stated as the proof of the nature of the thing.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gi phan tshun dben pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gi phan tshun dben pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: So what is the use of their mutual exclusion?

original: de nyid gtan tshigs su brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid gtan tshigs su brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: That itself will be stated as the reason.

original: de la dngos po dang 'brel pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po dang 'brel pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therein, the connection with the entity should be stated,

original: de lta ma yin na mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: otherwise it would not be established.

original: 'dis ni bdag dang gzhan gyis khas blangs pa la sogs pa dang / skyes bus rnam par gzhag pa la brten pa'i gtan tshigs thams cad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag dang gzhan gyis khas blangs pa la sogs pa dang / skyes bus rnam par gzhag pa la brten pa'i gtan tshigs thams cad brjod pa yin te /
translated: By this, all reasons based on the establishment by oneself and others, etc., and based on the arrangement by a person, are stated,

original: dper na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for example, because it is the discordant class,

original: spyi de'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: spyi de'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: because it is a part of that universal, and so on.

original: phyogs de'i 'dis sbyor ba thams cad la brjod pa yongs su 'gyur bas byas pa'i 'khrul pa spangs te /
analyzed: phyogs de'i 'dis sbyor ba thams cad la brjod pa yongs su 'gyur bas byas pa'i 'khrul pa spangs te /
translated: In all those applications, the pervasion should be stated, having abandoned the error made by the transformation of the statement,

original: don rnam par gnas pa'i tshul gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: don rnam par gnas pa'i tshul gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: and one should follow the method of the well-established meaning.

original: rtsol ba las byung ba'i sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: rtsol ba las byung ba'i sgra ni mi rtag ste /
translated: Sound is impermanent because it is produced by effort.

original: rtsol ba las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ltar dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma yin zhe na /üîΩldog pa las tha dad pa brten pa'i phyir blo tha mi dad pa'i yul tha snyad kyis nye bar gzhag pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin na dam bcas pa'i don gyis phyogs gcig nyid yin par brjod do //
analyzed: rtsol ba las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ltar dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma yin zhe na / ldog pa las tha dad pa brten pa'i phyir blo tha mi dad pa'i yul tha snyad kyis nye bar gzhag pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can de nyid sgrub par byed pa yin na dam bcas pa'i don gyis phyogs gcig nyid yin par brjod do //
translated: If you say that the meaning of the thesis is not a part of that,üîΩthen the subject, which is the probandum, is posited by convention as the domain of a nondistinct awareness, because it is distinct from the negation.üîΩWhen the reason is stated with respect to a subject that is a specific instance of a property to be proven, the reason and the property to be proven are not contradictory, because they are distinct properties.

original: khyad par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can du byas te gtan tshigs su brjod pa la ni chos tha dad pa'i phyir rtags dang rtags can mi 'gal lo //üîΩkhyad par spyi chos tha dad phyir //
analyzed: khyad par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can du byas te gtan tshigs su brjod pa la ni chos tha dad pa'i phyir rtags dang rtags can mi 'gal lo // khyad par spyi chos tha dad phyir //
translated: The reason and the property to be proven are asserted to be

original: rtags dang rtags can yin par 'dod //
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can yin par 'dod //
translated: distinct, because the specific instance is a distinct property from the general property.

original: dper na rtsol ba las byung sgra //
analyzed: dper na rtsol ba las byung sgra //
translated: For example, the sound of a conch is produced by effort

original: rtsol byung nyid phyir mi tha dad phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsol byung nyid phyir mi tha dad phyir ro //
translated: because it is produced by effort and because it is not distinct from that.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su lag na'ang gnod med phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su lag na'ang gnod med phyir //
translated: This is a verse in the middle of the text.

original: chos can tha dad ma grub min //
analyzed: chos can tha dad ma grub min //
translated: The subject is not established as different.

original: dper na gong bu rva can bzhin //
analyzed: dper na gong bu rva can bzhin //
translated: For example, like a lump with horns.

original: rva can nyid phyir rta min bzhin //
analyzed: rva can nyid phyir rta min bzhin //
translated: Because of having horns, it is not a horse.

original: yang na des mtshon nas ldog phyir //
analyzed: yang na des mtshon nas ldog phyir //
translated: Or, because it is indicated by that, it is excluded.

original: bsgrub bya'i dus su yan lag min //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i dus su yan lag min //
translated: At the time of the probandum, it is not a part.

original: de phyir khyad par dam bca' yi //
analyzed: de phyir khyad par dam bca' yi //
translated: Therefore, the distinction is a thesis.

original: don min chos tha dad phyir ro //
analyzed: don min chos tha dad phyir ro //
translated: It is not the meaning, because the phenomena are different.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is an intermediate verse.

original: de bzhin du rang nyid dam de'i gzhi las the tshom za na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang nyid dam de'i gzhi las the tshom za na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, if one doubts oneself or its basis, the reason is not established.üîΩFor example, in establishing fire, the doubt about the state of steam, etc., is like the assembly of elements.

original: dper na me bsgrub pa la rlangs pa la sogs pa'i dngos por the tshom za ba'i 'byung ba 'dus pa lta bu dang / yang dper na ri sul 'di na @220a * //
analyzed: dper na me bsgrub pa la rlangs pa la sogs pa'i dngos por the tshom za ba'i 'byung ba 'dus pa lta bu dang / yang dper na ri sul 'di na @220a * //
translated: Again, for example, in this mountain ravine,

original: rma bya'i sgra grag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la de grag pa'i yul can mi rtog pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rma bya'i sgra grag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la de grag pa'i yul can mi rtog pa lta bu'o //
translated: because the sound of a peacock is heard, the subject that hears that is not conceived.

original: chos can ma grub na yang ste //
analyzed: chos can ma grub na yang ste //
translated: Also, when the subject is not established,

original: dper na bdag ni khyab pa yin te //
analyzed: dper na bdag ni khyab pa yin te //
translated: for example, the self is all-pervading,üîΩbecause it is the experiencer of pleasure and pain.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad dmigs pa'i phyir ro // zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because all the good qualities such as pleasure are observed.

original: de ltar gtan tshigs kyi tshul gcig phyogs kyi chos nyid ma grub pa'am the tshom za na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs kyi tshul gcig phyogs kyi chos nyid ma grub pa'am the tshom za na ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: Thus, when one of the three modes of a reason is not established or is doubted, it is a fallacious reason of unestablished subject.

original: de bzhin du gcig ma grub pa'am the tshom za na ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig ma grub pa'am the tshom za na ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, when one of the three modes is doubted, it is inconclusive.

original: gcig po gang zhe na ldog pa'o //
analyzed: gcig po gang zhe na ldog pa'o //
translated: Which one? The pervasion.

original: ma grub pa ni dper na phyogs chos kyi rab tu dbye bar bstan pa thun mong gi ma nges pa rnam pa bzhi lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni dper na phyogs chos kyi rab tu dbye bar bstan pa thun mong gi ma nges pa rnam pa bzhi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, unestablished is like the four types of common inconclusive reasons taught in the section on the property of the subject.

original: de bzhin tu the tshom za na ni dper na brjod par 'dod pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin tu the tshom za na ni dper na brjod par 'dod pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin nam /
translated: Similarly, when there is doubt, for example, is the person who is the object of the desire to speak omniscient?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin te smra ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin te smra ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: He is endowed with attachment and so on because he speaks and so on.

original: 'dir ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: Here there is doubt about the pervasion.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa smra ba ma dmigs so zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu ni yul bltar mi rung ba'i bdag nyid kyis the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa smra ba ma dmigs so zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu ni yul bltar mi rung ba'i bdag nyid kyis the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúI do not perceive a speaker who is omniscient‚Äù is a non-perception that is a cause of doubt, because the object is of the nature of something that cannot be seen.

original: gal te smra ba'ang yin la thams cad mkhyen pa yang 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te smra ba'ang yin la thams cad mkhyen pa yang 'gyur mod /
translated: But it is possible that someone is a speaker and also omniscient.

original: 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the contradiction here?

original: gal te 'dir blo dang mi gzhan pa khyed kyis ma dmigs pa'i don spang na 'o na pha'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ldog par thal ba'i phyir khyod nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dir blo dang mi gzhan pa khyed kyis ma dmigs pa'i don spang na 'o na pha'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ldog par thal ba'i phyir khyod nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you reject the meaning of non-perception because it is not in accordance with your mind, then you lose, because it follows that the reason for the convention of father is refuted.

original: smra ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa gnyis la 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smra ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa gnyis la 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction in the two, being a speaker and being omniscient.

original: ma mthong du zin kyang thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa de smra ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ldog pa ni mi 'grub ste the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong du zin kyang thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa de smra ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ldog pa ni mi 'grub ste the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though you do not see it, you cannot establish the reverse proposition, ‚ÄúWhoever is omniscient is not a speaker,‚Äù because you would be doubtful.

original: gnod par byed pa yod na ni gzhan med par nges par byed do //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yod na ni gzhan med par nges par byed do //
translated: If there is an object of harm, then it is ascertained that there is no other.

original: mtshan nyid mi 'gal ba dbang po las 'das pa'i rnam pa ni shes par sla ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'gal ba dbang po las 'das pa'i rnam pa ni shes par sla ba ma yin te /
translated: The aspect of the non-contradictory characteristic that transcends the sense faculties is not easy to know.

original: de'i phyir smra ba thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes khyab pa ma grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir smra ba thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes khyab pa ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that all speakers are not omniscient.

original: smra ba po thams cad kyi chos nyid dang yongs su bcad par yang mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smra ba po thams cad kyi chos nyid dang yongs su bcad par yang mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to determine the nature and delimitation of all speakers.

original: de lta na ni thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur bas @220b dgag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur bas @220b dgag pa ma yin no //
translated: If it were so, then it would not be a refutation because it would be omniscience.

original: bdag nyid la rang gis rig pa des gzhan la yongs su bcad do zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid la rang gis rig pa des gzhan la yongs su bcad do zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the self-awareness determines the other through that,

original: gal te de ltar bdag la mthong ba gzhan la bsgrubs na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bdag la mthong ba gzhan la bsgrubs na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: if seeing is established for another in that way, would it not lead to an absurd consequence?

original: mthong ba dang 'gal ba ni mi bsgrub bo zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba dang 'gal ba ni mi bsgrub bo zhe na /
translated: If it is said that what contradicts seeing is not established,

original: rigs pa mtshungs na ci ste mi sgrub //
analyzed: rigs pa mtshungs na ci ste mi sgrub //
translated: why is it not established if the reasoning is the same?

original: yang na de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na de rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, that reasoning is not correct.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that a thing having the characteristics may be harmed.

original: mthong ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not by mere seeing.

original: 'o na ci zhe na ldog pa las kyang yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na ldog pa las kyang yin te /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù it is also by reversal.

original: de med pa'i phyir gzhan mi bsgrub po zhe na /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir gzhan mi bsgrub po zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù it is because the other is not established in the absence of that.

original: zhugs pa dang der the tshom za ba dag gis med par ma grub pa'i phyir sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhugs pa dang der the tshom za ba dag gis med par ma grub pa'i phyir sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not established because those who are engaged in it and those who doubt it do not establish its absence.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid bltar rung ba nyid kyis 'gal bar dmigs pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid bltar rung ba nyid kyis 'gal bar dmigs pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Those who are visible are not established because they are observed to be contradictory by their own nature.

original: gang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal nas gcig tu nges par byed pa bltar mi rung ba rnams ni rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag dang yang 'gal bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal nas gcig tu nges par byed pa bltar mi rung ba rnams ni rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag dang yang 'gal bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are not visible, having removed their discordant side, make a single determination, but they do not contradict their own discordant side.

original: bdag nyid nang gi chos gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid nang gi chos gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The self is not known by another inner phenomenon.

original: 'ga' zhig dang ldan par rigs pas thams cad du de nye bar bsgrubs pas tha snyad byed pa'i bum pa 'di /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig dang ldan par rigs pas thams cad du de nye bar bsgrubs pas tha snyad byed pa'i bum pa 'di /
translated: It is reasonable that some are endowed with it, and by establishing that everywhere, the convention of a pot is made.

original: bud med dang dmangs rigs rnams dang thun mong ba'i khyad par yang mi rtogs pa ni rig pa ngal pa'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa grub bo //
analyzed: bud med dang dmangs rigs rnams dang thun mong ba'i khyad par yang mi rtogs pa ni rig pa ngal pa'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa grub bo //
translated: The result of the perfection of knowledge is the complete achievement of the non-apprehension of the distinctions common to women and the low castes.

original: de'i phyir bdag la mthong ba tsam gyis ni nye bar 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag la mthong ba tsam gyis ni nye bar 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not established by mere seeing.

original: de tsam gyis khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pervasion is not established by that alone.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is doubt about the reverse.

original: sngar bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid las kyang 'di 'dra ba'i spyod pa rnams the tshom gyi rgyu yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid las kyang 'di 'dra ba'i spyod pa rnams the tshom gyi rgyu yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: From the previously explained definition of non-apprehension, it should be understood that such practices are the cause of doubt.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang don gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang don gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, one who possesses attachment defined by inference is a different object,

original: tshig las mi rtogs pa rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: tshig las mi rtogs pa rtogs par bya ste /
translated: so it should be understood from the words.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no connection.

original: 'dod chags med na tshig med do zhes ldog pa nges pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags med na tshig med do zhes ldog pa nges pa ni med do //
translated: When there is no attachment, there is no word. There is no certainty about the reverse.

original: g-yo ba dang tshig la sogs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: g-yo ba dang tshig la sogs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Movement, speech, etc. are not the effects of passion, etc.

original: brjod par 'dod pa spyi'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa spyi'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the general effects of the desire to express.

original: de 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are passion because they are the effects of passion,

original: 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: then there is no fault, because they are desired.

original: rtag pa dang bde ba dang @221a * //
analyzed: rtag pa dang bde ba dang @221a * //
translated: The view of permanence, of happiness,

original: bdag dang bdag gir lta bas 'phangs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi yul can yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan la mngon par dga' ba ni 'dod chags zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir lta bas 'phangs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi yul can yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan la mngon par dga' ba ni 'dod chags zhes brjod do //
translated: of self, and of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is called passion, because it is the delight in the false virtues of the objects of the contaminated dharmas projected by the view of self.

original: dga' ba de'i yul can mi mthun pa la des byas pa'i sems kyis 'khrug pa ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: dga' ba de'i yul can mi mthun pa la des byas pa'i sems kyis 'khrug pa ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Aversion is the disturbance of the mind by that passion toward an object that is contrary to that delight.

original: gnyi ga'i sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rten phyin ci log de nyid ni gti mug go //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rten phyin ci log de nyid ni gti mug go //
translated: Delusion is the inversion of the basis that precedes both of them.

original: snying rje la sogs de lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snying rje la sogs de lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: Compassion, etc. are not like that,üîΩbecause they are possible in other ways.

original: gzhan du srid pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam 'grel bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan du srid pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam 'grel bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained in the commentary.

original: de la ji ltar 'dod chags dang bcas pa smra ba ltar zhes 'dod chags dang bral ba yang smra bas tshig tsam las ni mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de la ji ltar 'dod chags dang bcas pa smra ba ltar zhes 'dod chags dang bral ba yang smra bas tshig tsam las ni mi rtogs so //
translated: As for the statement, Just as one who is attached speaks, so also one who is free from attachment speaks, this is mere words, for one does not understand anything from this.

original: khyad par las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it from the special nature of the words,

original: bsam pa rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir tha snyad 'chol bas thams cad 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir tha snyad 'chol bas thams cad 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the intention is difficult to understand, and because of the confusion of all conventional expressions.

original: dogs pa med pa'i phyir mi smra'o zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: dogs pa med pa'i phyir mi smra'o zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say, One does not speak because there is no need to, this is not so,

original: gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is for the sake of others.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'thad do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'thad do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say, It is not tenable that one speaks because one is free from attachment, this is not so,

original: snying rjes kyang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rjes kyang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one engages through compassion.

original: de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, That itself is attachment,

original: ming du 'dod pa mi dgag go //
analyzed: ming du 'dod pa mi dgag go //
translated: we do not deny the assertion of a name.

original: rang bzhin ni tha mi dad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni tha mi dad do //
translated: The nature is not different.

original: mi sdug pa la mngon par dga' ba nyid mtshams 'brel par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi sdug pa la mngon par dga' ba nyid mtshams 'brel par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who delights in the repulsive is bound.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyin ci ma log pa las byung ba de ni skyon med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyin ci ma log pa las byung ba de ni skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, since it arises from the absence of error, there is no fault.

original: snying rje ni bdag tu 'dzin pa med kyang sdug bsngal gyi khyad par mthong ba tsam gyi goms pa'i stobs las skye ba yin te /
analyzed: snying rje ni bdag tu 'dzin pa med kyang sdug bsngal gyi khyad par mthong ba tsam gyi goms pa'i stobs las skye ba yin te /
translated: Compassion arises from the power of habituation to the mere sight of the specific suffering, even without the apprehension of self.

original: 'di ltar mdo las /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las /
translated: Thus, a sutra declares:

original: byams pa la sogs pa ni sems can la dmigs pa la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa ni sems can la dmigs pa la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: Love, etc., are taught to be focused on sentient beings, etc.

original: de dag kyang rigs mthun pa goms pa las 'jug pa can yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang rigs mthun pa goms pa las 'jug pa can yin no //
translated: And they are engaged through the cultivation of similar types.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case with attachment, etc.

original: phyin ci log med na med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsnying rje can gyi rtsom pa 'bras bu med pa yang phyin ci log las yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log med na med pa'i phyir ro // snying rje can gyi rtsom pa 'bras bu med pa yang phyin ci log las yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: For they do not exist when there is no error.

original: gzhan gyi don nyid 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir te 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir te 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if the effort of the compassionate one is fruitless because of error, no, because the benefit of others is accepted as the fruit, since that is the definition of fruit.

original: smra ba po bdag nyid la 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong bas gzhan la de rjes su dpog na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: smra ba po bdag nyid la 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong bas gzhan la de rjes su dpog na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba bshad zin to //
translated: And it has already been explained that it is absurd to infer the existence of attachment, etc., in others from the fact that one sees it in oneself, the speaker.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir gzhan rjes su mi dpog na @221b 'di la mi 'khrul lo zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir gzhan rjes su mi dpog na @221b 'di la mi 'khrul lo zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yod /
translated: If you do not infer the existence of something else because of error, then what is the certainty that there is no error here?

original: ma mthong ba la ni brjod zin to //
analyzed: ma mthong ba la ni brjod zin to //
translated: We have already discussed the non-perception of something.

original: tshu rol mthong ba 'di ltar rung ba'i bdag nyid ni lhan cig tu 'gyur ba'am de lta ma yin par mthong gi gcig tu nges par lkog tu gyur pa'i don ni med par nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba 'di ltar rung ba'i bdag nyid ni lhan cig tu 'gyur ba'am de lta ma yin par mthong gi gcig tu nges par lkog tu gyur pa'i don ni med par nges pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the perception of the present is either simultaneous or not, but the nature of the hidden object is not ascertained as non-existent.

original: de'i phyir tshig gis ni byed pa'i yon tan dang rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gis ni byed pa'i yon tan dang rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the unseen agent is inferred from the seen effect.

original: 'dir yang bdag las mthong bas rjes su dpog pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i thal ba 'di mtshungs so zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang bdag las mthong bas rjes su dpog pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i thal ba 'di mtshungs so zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Here, the consequence that ‚Äúit is not inferred from the seen self‚Äù is the same.

original: de dag 'dir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du grub pas gzhan la rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'dir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du grub pas gzhan la rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because here the causal relationship is established from the positive and negative concomitance, and it is inferred from something else.

original: mi sdug pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / phyin ci log dang tshig ni de ltar de grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / phyin ci log dang tshig ni de ltar de grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The lover is not seen to be free from the object of desire, because he is seen to have the desire for the other person.

original: bdag nyid la gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The lover is seen to be free from the object of desire, because he is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.

original: 'dod chags skyes par rung ba nyid dang bral ba la tshig ma mthong ba'i phyir de rjes su dpog na ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du ma grub bo //üîΩsems pa med pa ldog pa'i yul yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags skyes par rung ba nyid dang bral ba la tshig ma mthong ba'i phyir de rjes su dpog na ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du ma grub bo // sems pa med pa ldog pa'i yul yin no zhe na /
translated: The argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ldog pas ni rgyu'i nus pa mi grub bo //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ldog pas ni rgyu'i nus pa mi grub bo //
translated: The argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.

original: de las gzhan pa'i nus pa dag yod pa na 'bras bu mi skye bas rgyu gzhan rjes su dpog par byed do //üîΩrnam pa de lta bu'i ldog pa ni sems pa med pa dag la mi srid de /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nus pa dag yod pa na 'bras bu mi skye bas rgyu gzhan rjes su dpog par byed do // rnam pa de lta bu'i ldog pa ni sems pa med pa dag la mi srid de /
translated: The argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.

original: de dag la ni sems pa dang byed pa'i yon tan la sogs pa nus pa mthong ba'i rgyu nyid med pa'i phyir the tshom za'o //
analyzed: de dag la ni sems pa dang byed pa'i yon tan la sogs pa nus pa mthong ba'i rgyu nyid med pa'i phyir the tshom za'o //
translated: The argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.üîΩThe argument is not established, because the lover is seen to have the desire for the other person.

original: 'dod chags kyis phan mi 'dogs na ji ltar de'i nus pas phan 'dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis phan mi 'dogs na ji ltar de'i nus pas phan 'dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If attachment does not benefit, how could it benefit by its power?

original: rang gi ngo bo'i yon tan nus pa la nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i yon tan nus pa la nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the quality of its own nature is figuratively designated as its power.

original: gang la des mi nus pa de la nus pas nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la des mi nus pa de la nus pas nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is not powerful with regard to something, it is not powerful with regard to that.

original: de med na de mi 'byung ba'i 'bras bu kho nas rgyu rjes su dpog par byed de der 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na de mi 'byung ba'i 'bras bu kho nas rgyu rjes su dpog par byed de der 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One infers a cause only from an effect that does not occur when the cause is absent, because there is a relation between them.

original: gzhan ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong yang ma yin no //
translated: But one does not infer it from something else, even if it is not seen in the absence of the cause.

original: thams cad gzigs pa'i gzigs pa log pas ni thams cad na med pa go bar byed do //üîΩla la na de ltar mthong ba rnams kyang yul dang dus dang 'du bya ba'i khyad par las @222a * //
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa'i gzigs pa log pas ni thams cad na med pa go bar byed do // la la na de ltar mthong ba rnams kyang yul dang dus dang 'du bya ba'i khyad par las @222a * //
translated: One understands that something does not exist everywhere because it is not seen by one who sees everything.

original: gzhan du snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan du snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: But even if something is seen somewhere, it is not seen elsewhere because of the difference of place, time, and conditions.

original: dper na skyu ru ra'i shing dag 'o mas bcus na 'bras bu mngar po chags la phal cher ni de ltar mi snang ba lta bu'i //
analyzed: dper na skyu ru ra'i shing dag 'o mas bcus na 'bras bu mngar po chags la phal cher ni de ltar mi snang ba lta bu'i //
translated: For example, myrobalan fruit becomes sweet if watered with milk, but it does not appear that way in most places.

original: des na 'di skad du bdag lta bu'i smra ba po ni 'dod chags can yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du bdag lta bu'i smra ba po ni 'dod chags can yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is correct to say that a speaker like me is desirous,

original: 'dod chags skye ba'i rkyen gyi khyad par bdag tu lta ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags skye ba'i rkyen gyi khyad par bdag tu lta ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he possesses the specific conditions for the arising of desire, namely, the view of self and improper mental attention.

original: de'i tshe yang smra ba po dper brjod pa ni med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang smra ba po dper brjod pa ni med do //
translated: But at that time, there is no example of a speaker.

original: de'i phyir 'di yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir tshul gnyis ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir tshul gnyis ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, since this reason is present in the dissimilar class, the two modes are not established.

original: phyin ci log tu grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are established in a contrary manner.

original: des na 'di dag phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di dag phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since these reasons establish in a contrary manner, they are contradictory.

original: 'dod pa la gnod par byed pa 'gal ba gsum pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dod pa la gnod par byed pa 'gal ba gsum pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt there a third type of contradiction that contradicts desire?

original: dper na mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
translated: For example, eyes and so on are for the benefit of others,üîΩbecause they are the basis of the benefit of others.

original: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because they are collections, like the parts of a bed, a seat, and so on.

original: de ni 'dod pa 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi don byed pa phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
translated: This is contradictory, because it proves the opposite of what is intended, which is to prove that the other is not a collection.

original: de ci'i phyir ma smos shes na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir ma smos shes na /
translated: Why is this not mentioned?

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde dag las 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i chos phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa nyid du ni bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro // de dag las 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i chos phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa nyid du ni bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no difference in what is to be established.üîΩThere is no difference in what is to be established, because it proves the opposite of what is to be established.

original: 'dod pa dang smras pa dag bsgrub par bya ba nyid du ni khyad par 'ga' yang med do zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang smras pa dag bsgrub par bya ba nyid du ni khyad par 'ga' yang med do zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that there is no difference in what is to be established, whether it is a thesis or a statement.

original: khyad par yod na ni 'gal ba bzhin du 'dod pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs su brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par yod na ni 'gal ba bzhin du 'dod pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs su brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a difference, then, like a contradiction, it would be stated as a reason to prove the thesis.

original: gcig nyid kyi tshig gis bsgrub par bya ba nyid du khyad par med par bstan to //
analyzed: gcig nyid kyi tshig gis bsgrub par bya ba nyid du khyad par med par bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù shows that there is no difference in what is to be established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa yang gcig nyid do //üîΩde'i tha dad ma ni sbyor ba'i bye brag las te la lar ni brjod pa dang shugs dag gis /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa yang gcig nyid do // de'i tha dad ma ni sbyor ba'i bye brag las te la lar ni brjod pa dang shugs dag gis /
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the reason is the same in both cases.

original: la lar ni brjod par 'dod pas chos dang chos can gyi khyad par du nye bar gzhag pas yin la /
analyzed: la lar ni brjod par 'dod pas chos dang chos can gyi khyad par du nye bar gzhag pas yin la /
translated: The difference between them is due to the difference in the application of the reason, for in some cases, the reason is stated by the proponent himself, and in some cases, it is stated by the opponent.üîΩIn some cases, the proponent states the reason by himself, and in some cases, the proponent states the predicate of the probandum by himself.

original: 'gal ba bzhin du gtan tshigs kyang ci ste tha mi dad ce na /
analyzed: 'gal ba bzhin du gtan tshigs kyang ci ste tha mi dad ce na /
translated: Why is the reason not different from the contradictory?üîΩWho prevents the distinction?

original: rnam par 'byed pa la su 'gog / don gyis 'phangs pa'i 'dod pa ma @222b brjod pa pha rol po'i 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa la gnod par byad pa zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa la su 'gog / don gyis 'phangs pa'i 'dod pa ma @222b brjod pa pha rol po'i 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa la gnod par byad pa zhes brjod kyi /
translated: The reason is stated by the proponent himself, and the predicate of the probandum is stated by the opponent.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not different from the contradictory.

original: de nyid kyi phyir logs shig tu bstan par bya ba ma yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir logs shig tu bstan par bya ba ma yin par bshad do //
translated: For that very reason, it is explained that it is not to be stated separately.

original: gal te 'dus pa rnams 'dus pa ma yin par gzhan la phan 'dogs par nges pa med pa'i phyir 'gal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'dus pa rnams 'dus pa ma yin par gzhan la phan 'dogs par nges pa med pa'i phyir 'gal ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if the assembly is not an assembly, it is not certain that it benefits others. So how can it be non-contradictory?

original: 'dus pa gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'dus pa gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What certainty is there that the assembly benefits others?

original: gal te yang 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la mngon du phyogs pa'i don rnams tshogs pa 'dus pa yin pa de lta na yang gags byed pa logs pa srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te yang 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la mngon du phyogs pa'i don rnams tshogs pa 'dus pa yin pa de lta na yang gags byed pa logs pa srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if the assembly is the collection of things that are directed toward some effect, still, since it is possible that something else obstructs,

original: rgyu rnams gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin pas 'khrul pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu rnams gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin pas 'khrul pa nyid do //
translated: the cause does not necessarily possess the effect. Therefore, it is mistaken.

original: thogs pa med pa'i phan 'dogs pa'i mig la sogs pa gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i phan 'dogs pa'i mig la sogs pa gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But the unobstructed benefit is the benefit of others, such as the eye and so on.

original: de la yang 'dus pa gzhan la phan 'dogs pa nyid do zhes 'brel pa nges pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de la yang 'dus pa gzhan la phan 'dogs pa nyid do zhes 'brel pa nges pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the definite relation in this case that the assembly benefits others?

original: de dag las nye bar sbyor ba rnams rang bzhin du ma'i phan pa sgrub par byed pa 'di yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag las nye bar sbyor ba rnams rang bzhin du ma'i phan pa sgrub par byed pa 'di yin gyi /
translated: The application of those is the establishment of the benefit of the various natures.

original: dus gcig tu du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gcig tu du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: and it is not of a multiple nature at one time.

original: phan pa don gzhan nyid yin na de'i phan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: phan pa don gzhan nyid yin na de'i phan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang bshad zin to //
translated: And if benefit were something else, then the non-benefit, etc., would also be as previously explained.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i byed pa ni don med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i byed pa ni don med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The activity of neither is meaningless.

original: de'i don du sgrub par byed pa 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i don du sgrub par byed pa 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is contradictory to establish it for that purpose.

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa phan 'dogs pa ni khyad par skyed pa nyid kyi phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa phan 'dogs pa ni khyad par skyed pa nyid kyi phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the benefit of the eye, etc. is the benefit of producing a distinction.

original: de bas na de rang bzhin gcig tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de rang bzhin gcig tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory because it would not be of the same nature.

original: ngang gi sgras ni gnyis las gcig ma grub na gzhan la the tshom za na 'khrul pa can yin no //
analyzed: ngang gi sgras ni gnyis las gcig ma grub na gzhan la the tshom za na 'khrul pa can yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used because if one of two is not established, there is doubt about the other, and it is mistaken.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is taught.

original: dper na 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHe is free from attachment,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa yin te /
translated: or he is omniscient,

original: smra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: smra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because he speaks.‚Äù

original: 'di la ldog pa ma grub pa la rjes su 'gro ba la ni the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la ldog pa ma grub pa la rjes su 'gro ba la ni the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: When there is doubt about the pervasion, there is doubt about the forward pervasion.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa 'dod chags dang bral ba dag bskal pa'i @223a * //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa 'dod chags dang bral ba dag bskal pa'i @223a * //
translated: Because of the remoteness of omniscience,

original: phyir de la tshig la sogs pa yod pa'am med pa nyid du the tshom za'o //
analyzed: phyir de la tshig la sogs pa yod pa'am med pa nyid du the tshom za'o //
translated: one doubts whether or not the Buddha has speech, etc.

original: the tshom za na 'khrul pa can gnyis zhes snyegs so //
analyzed: the tshom za na 'khrul pa can gnyis zhes snyegs so //
translated: When there is doubt, there is the second type of error.

original: gang la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba ste /
analyzed: gang la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba ste /
translated: When there is doubt about the forward pervasion and the counter-pervasion,

original: dper na gson pa'i dus na bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na gson pa'i dus na bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: for example, one might say, ‚ÄúThe self exists at the time of life,

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because it possesses life, etc.‚Äù

original: gang la srog la sogs pa gnas par 'gyur ba bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa las phung po bzhin ni med de bdag rnam par gnas pa dang / rnam par gcod pa dag gis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la srog la sogs pa gnas par 'gyur ba bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa las phung po bzhin ni med de bdag rnam par gnas pa dang / rnam par gcod pa dag gis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The self does not exist apart from the aggregates, because the existence and non-existence of the self are included in the existence and non-existence of the aggregates, since the self is not perceived apart from the aggregates.

original: 'di gnyis las gcig la rnam par gnas pa nges pa med de de'i bdag nyid las ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis las gcig la rnam par gnas pa nges pa med de de'i bdag nyid las ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no certainty that either of these two is the case, because they are not established as having that nature.

original: de bas na gson po'i lus dang 'brel pa can gyi srog la sogs pa ni gnyis kyi bdag nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa med pa'i phyir de dag las ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gson po'i lus dang 'brel pa can gyi srog la sogs pa ni gnyis kyi bdag nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa med pa'i phyir de dag las ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, life force and so on, which are related to the body of a living being, are not reversed from those two because they are not external.

original: de la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las the tshom za ba'i phyir ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las the tshom za ba'i phyir ma nges pa yin te /
translated: There is no certainty because there is doubt about the forward pervasion and counter pervasion.

original: de las bsgrub par bya ba dang cig shos dag tu nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bsgrub par bya ba dang cig shos dag tu nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no certainty that the probandum and the other are pervaded.

original: mi rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there no understanding.

original: 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is a relationship.

original: ma 'brel pa las ni dpyod pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: ma 'brel pa las ni dpyod pa mi skye ste /
translated: An inquiry does not arise from a nonrelationship.

original: dper na sgra la mig gis gzung bya bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra la mig gis gzung bya bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the apprehension of sound by the eye.

original: 'brel pa las ni 'di ci zhig dang 'brel zhes ci zhig dpyod /
analyzed: 'brel pa las ni 'di ci zhig dang 'brel zhes ci zhig dpyod /
translated: From a relationship, what is inquired into is what is the relationship of this?

original: dper na ma 'brel par mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na ma 'brel par mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, because it is not suitable to be unrelated.

original: 'brel pa yongs su shes pa med par mngal chags pa las skyes bu'i khyad par dang 'brel par the tshom za ba de bzhin du 'dir yang thams cad nang du 'dus par mi rung ba'i phyir the tshom za'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa yongs su shes pa med par mngal chags pa las skyes bu'i khyad par dang 'brel par the tshom za ba de bzhin du 'dir yang thams cad nang du 'dus par mi rung ba'i phyir the tshom za'o //
translated: Just as one doubts the connection between a particular person and the conception of a fetus in the womb when one does not know the connection between the two, so too here one doubts the inclusion of everything in the two truths, because it is not possible.

original: mi rtogs pa gnyi gar rtogs pa dang the tshom med pa'i rang bzhin de ni gnyis las phyi rol du 'gyur ba yod na 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi rtogs pa gnyi gar rtogs pa dang the tshom med pa'i rang bzhin de ni gnyis las phyi rol du 'gyur ba yod na 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the nature of non-realization, realization of both, and non-doubt were external to the two, it would be so.

original: nang du 'dus na ji ltar mi rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: nang du 'dus na ji ltar mi rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: But if it were included within, how could it not be realized?

original: de lta ni kho na mig gis gzung ba nyid las kyang 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ni kho na mig gis gzung ba nyid las kyang 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it were so, it would be just what is apprehended by the eye.

original: ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: No, because it is not connected, as has already been explained.

original: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the uncommon is the cause of doubt.

original: srog @223b la sogs pa ni khyad par du yin te /
analyzed: srog @223b la sogs pa ni khyad par du yin te /
translated: Life and so on are particular.

original: bdag bskal pas 'jug pa dang ldog pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa yang de la 'jug pa dang ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag bskal pas 'jug pa dang ldog pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa yang de la 'jug pa dang ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self is not established as engaging in and disengaging from life and so on, and because it is not established as engaging in and disengaging from life and so on.

original: don gzhan 'bras bu ma yin pa las mi 'grub pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan 'bras bu ma yin pa las mi 'grub pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because it is not established as a different object that is not the effect.

original: srog la sogs pa dang bdag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang bdag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'grub ste /
translated: The self is not established as the causal basis of life and so on,

original: de ni dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is based on the nonobservation and observation of that.

original: 'brel pa med pa yod na yod pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir the chom za'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa yod na yod pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir the chom za'o //
translated: If there is no relation, it is not established that it exists when that exists.

original: gzhan dag srog la sogs pa ni bdag go bar byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag srog la sogs pa ni bdag go bar byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: Others say: Life and so on is the self because it is the cause of the self.

original: de'i ldog pa ni gcig tu nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ldog pa ni gcig tu nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its cessation is ascertained as one.

original: srog la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na ldog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na ldog pa yin gyi /
translated: Life and so on is the cessation of the opposite alone,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs las ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the cessation of the concordant.

original: med pa las ldog par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa las ldog par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable that the opposite of a nonexistent is a nonentity.

original: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba gcig tu nges pa ltar ldog pa gcig tu nges pa yang go bar byed do //
analyzed: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba gcig tu nges pa ltar ldog pa gcig tu nges pa yang go bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, just as there is a single invariable concomitance, there is also a single invariable contradistinction.

original: mnyan bya nyid ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case with the object of hearing.

original: gnyi ga las ldog pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga las ldog pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because it is contradistinguished from both.

original: ldog pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i smra ba des ni med na mi 'byung ba nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i smra ba des ni med na mi 'byung ba nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this kind of contradistinction, the speaker expresses the fact that the effect is invariably concomitant with the cause.

original: 'di ltar bdag med pa nyid la med pa nyid do zhes don gyis bdag la gnas pa gzhan dang ma 'brel par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag med pa nyid la med pa nyid do zhes don gyis bdag la gnas pa gzhan dang ma 'brel par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: For, in the statement ‚ÄúIt does not exist in the absence of self,‚Äù the meaning is that it is related to the self, not to anything else.

original: de nyid kyis ni rjes su 'gro ba grub pa'i phyir ldog pa can zhes brjod pa can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni rjes su 'gro ba grub pa'i phyir ldog pa can zhes brjod pa can yang ma yin no //
translated: And, because invariable concomitance is established by this, it is also not the case that the contradistinction is stated in terms of the absence of the effect.

original: med na mi 'byung ba yang 'brel pa yin na yang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba las gzhan med do zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba yang 'brel pa yin na yang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba las gzhan med do zhes bshad zin to //
translated: And, although invariable concomitance is a relation, it is not other than identity and origination from it.

original: de dag kyang mthong ba med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang mthong ba med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: And, because they are not established without being seen, life force, etc. are not invariably concomitant with the absence of self.

original: de nyid kyis gang las ldog pa can zhes brjod pa yang bdag ma logs kyang 'brel par ldog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis gang las ldog pa can zhes brjod pa yang bdag ma logs kyang 'brel par ldog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And by that very fact, the so-called ‚Äúreverse‚Äù is not a reverse that is related to the self.

original: de bas na khyad par ni ldog pa med pa dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na khyad par ni ldog pa med pa dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the distinction is that there is no reverse and no following.

original: ma mthong ba tsam la brten nas slob dpon gyis mnyan par bya ba nyid ldog pa can du bshad do //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam la brten nas slob dpon gyis mnyan par bya ba nyid ldog pa can du bshad do //
translated: The master has explained that the mere non-seeing is the reverse of the hearer.

original: de tsam gyis med par rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de tsam gyis med par rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that it is not that one understands non-existence by that alone.

original: de lta ma yin na the tshom gyi rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur te /
