analyzed: de lta ma yin na the tshom gyi rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, it would not be the cause of doubt.

original: gang zhig @224a * //
analyzed: gang zhig @224a * //
translated: What is the cause of doubt?

original: gang la mi srid pa de dmigs pas de la the tshom za bar ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang la mi srid pa de dmigs pas de la the tshom za bar ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that one doubts that which is not possible.üîΩIf the self is reversed, life, etc., would be reversed because the non-existence of life, etc., is pervaded by selflessness.

original: srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa la khyab pa'i phyir bdag log na srog la sogs pa ldog par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te ma 'brel pa med pas nye bar mi sbyor ba med pa la khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa la khyab pa'i phyir bdag log na srog la sogs pa ldog par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te ma 'brel pa med pas nye bar mi sbyor ba med pa la khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because the pervasion is not established that the non-connection of the non-existent is not applied.

original: gal te srog la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: gal te srog la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: If life force and so on were the self,üîΩ

original: de las byung ba bdag dang 'brel pa yin na /
analyzed: de las byung ba bdag dang 'brel pa yin na /
translated: If life force and so on were related to the self, either by being its essence orüîΩarising from it, then when they ceased, the self would cease. At that time,

original: de dag de log na ldog par 'gyur bas de'i tshe srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa las khyab par 'gyur ro //üîΩde med na med par grub pas khyab pa grub pa'i phyir de yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de dag de log na ldog par 'gyur bas de'i tshe srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa las khyab par 'gyur ro // de med na med par grub pas khyab pa grub pa'i phyir de yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: since life force and so on would not exist, the self would not exist.üîΩSince it is established that if one does not exist, the other does not exist,

original: bzlog pa la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: this is also not established, because the opposite is not related to the self.

original: de dag gi 'brel pa ni dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dag las shes pa yin na de dag ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de dag gi 'brel pa ni dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dag las shes pa yin na de dag ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la mi 'grub bo //
translated: The relation between them is known from the observation and nonobservation of the other, but that is not established in the case of the very obscure.

original: srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa'i bdag med pa yang gang yin /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa'i bdag med pa yang gang yin /
translated: What is the self that is pervaded by the nonexistence of life force and so on?

original: bum pa la sogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: It is a pot and so on.

original: gzhan du mthong ba med pas bum pa la sogs pa la med do zhes gang las yin /
analyzed: gzhan du mthong ba med pas bum pa la sogs pa la med do zhes gang las yin /
translated: But since it is not seen elsewhere, how can it be said that it does not exist in a pot and so on?

original: des na ldog pa shes pa med pa'i ldog pas khyab pa yang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: des na ldog pa shes pa med pa'i ldog pas khyab pa yang mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the pervasion of the absence of knowledge of the relation by the absence of knowledge of the reversal is not established.

original: srog la sogs pa yang mthong ba nyid las la lar yod pa dang med par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa yang mthong ba nyid las la lar yod pa dang med par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Life and so on are also understood to exist and not exist in some cases, from seeing them.

original: bdag ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir de yod pa dang med par mi rtogs so //
analyzed: bdag ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir de yod pa dang med par mi rtogs so //
translated: But the self is not like that, so it is not understood to exist or not exist.üîΩAlso, if the living body does not have a self, it follows that it does not have life and so on, because it would be without a self, like a pot and so on.

original: gang yang gal te gson po'i lus bdag dang bcas pa ma yin na srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal bar 'gyur te bdag med pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes brjod pa de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med par mi
analyzed: gang yang gal te gson po'i lus bdag dang bcas pa ma yin na srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal bar 'gyur te bdag med pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes brjod pa de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med par mi
translated: This is not established because the state of being cause and effect does not exist.

original: 'grub bo // rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa bkag pa ni go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes mi dmigs par bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'grub bo // rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa bkag pa ni go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes mi dmigs par bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that the negation of not being cause and effect is not a nonobservation.

original: rgyu yi dngos po de yang bdag mthong ba med pa'i phyir mi 'grub po zhes lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu yi dngos po de yang bdag mthong ba med pa'i phyir mi 'grub po zhes lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
translated: Also, that state of being cause and effect is not established because the self is not seen.üîΩThis has been explained more than once.

original: mthong yang ldog pa ma 'grub pa'i phyir mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: mthong yang ldog pa ma 'grub pa'i phyir mi 'grub bo //
translated: Even if it is seen, it is not established because it is not established that it ceases.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ldog pa'i yul yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ldog pa'i yul yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that a pot and so on is the object of cessation,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i ldog pa las ni rgyu yi nus pa mi 'grub kyi nus pa @224b gzhan dag yod kyang 'bras bu mi skye bas rgyu gzhan yod par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i ldog pa las ni rgyu yi nus pa mi 'grub kyi nus pa @224b gzhan dag yod kyang 'bras bu mi skye bas rgyu gzhan yod par rtogs par byed do //
translated: But from a reversal of that sort, the power of the cause is not established. Even though other powers exist, the effect is not produced. Therefore, one should understand that other causes exist.

original: zhes lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained more than once.

original: srog la sogs par rgyu blo la sogs pa yang bum pa la sogs par mi srid do //
analyzed: srog la sogs par rgyu blo la sogs pa yang bum pa la sogs par mi srid do //
translated: Also, the mind, etc., which are the cause of life, etc., are not possible as a pot, etc.

original: de bas na bdag ldog pa ni nus par the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag ldog pa ni nus par the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reversal of the self is doubtful as to power.

original: blo la sogs pa de dag kyang bdag med pa la mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: blo la sogs pa de dag kyang bdag med pa la mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: And those mind, etc. would not be without a self.

original: de la gzhan nyid kyi nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzhan nyid kyi nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the power of another is seen there.

original: re zhig mig la sogs pa'i rgyu blo la sogs pa bdag nyid ji lta ba'i dbang po dang yul dang / nus pa nyams pa med pa'i bdag nyid snga ma yang yin te /
analyzed: re zhig mig la sogs pa'i rgyu blo la sogs pa bdag nyid ji lta ba'i dbang po dang yul dang / nus pa nyams pa med pa'i bdag nyid snga ma yang yin te /
translated: First, the cause of the eye, etc., the mind, etc., is the prior self, which is the nature of the unimpaired faculty, object, and power, just as it is.

original: yul gzhan la yengs sam 'khrug pa la sogs par gyur na rnam par shes pa phyi ma mi skye ba dang / 'chol pa la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan la yengs sam 'khrug pa la sogs par gyur na rnam par shes pa phyi ma mi skye ba dang / 'chol pa la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the object is distracted or disturbed, the subsequent consciousness does not arise, because it is seen that the consciousness is confused.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni nus pa nyams pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni nus pa nyams pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma yin no //
translated: The cause of mental consciousness is the prior consciousness, which is not impaired.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu yang skal ba mnyam pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par snga ma snga ma yin la blo ni rkyen yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu yang skal ba mnyam pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par snga ma snga ma yin la blo ni rkyen yin no //
translated: The cause that appropriates the sense faculties, etc., is the prior special state of the same status. The mind is the condition.

original: de ltar 'di'i bdag nyid 'grub pa ni de tsam dang rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhan rtag na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i bdag nyid 'grub pa ni de tsam dang rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhan rtag na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the establishment of its nature is based on the presence or absence of that. Therefore, that is the cause. If the other is permanent, there is an infinite regress.

original: gang yin te de ni ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhe na ji ltar / rtogs pa yin na thams cad la //
analyzed: gang yin te de ni ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhe na ji ltar / rtogs pa yin na thams cad la //
translated: What is the reason? Because the absence of that is confused.

original: rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: If it is understood, all causes are without end.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is the concluding verse.

original: srog la sogs pa mnyan bya nyid dang 'khrul par yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa mnyan bya nyid dang 'khrul par yang mtshungs so //
translated: Life force, etc., are similar to the object of hearing in being mistaken.üîΩNo, because that is mistaken with regard to the reverse.

original: ma yin te de ni ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhe na ji ltar 'khrul /
analyzed: ma yin te de ni ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhe na ji ltar 'khrul /
translated: How is it mistaken?

original: de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa kho na las ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa kho na las ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not the reverse of that which is not the discordant class.

original: des ni 'di mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med par brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: des ni 'di mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med par brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But doesn‚Äôt that state that it does not occur in the concordant class?

original: de ni gzhan la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni gzhan la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: That is similar to the other.

original: ji ltar srog la sogs pa dang mi mtshungs /
analyzed: ji ltar srog la sogs pa dang mi mtshungs /
translated: How is it not similar to life force, etc.?

original: mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid la med do zhes bya bas 'di mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid la med do zhes bya bas 'di mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par brjod pa yin te /
translated: It is stated that it exists in the concordant class by the statement that it does not exist in the nonconcordant class.

original: dgag pa gnyis kyi rnal ma go ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa gnyis kyi rnal ma go ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation of the two negations is understood.

original: @225a * // de lta ma yin rnam par gcad par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir nges par gzung ba'i 'bras bu cir 'gyur /
analyzed: @225a * // de lta ma yin rnam par gcad par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir nges par gzung ba'i 'bras bu cir 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, if it were not so, what would be the result of the ascertainment, since it would not be the object of negation?

original: gcig la nges par gzung ba med na ni /
analyzed: gcig la nges par gzung ba med na ni /
translated: If there is no definite determination of one,

original: ldog pa mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the contrapositive is not nonerroneous.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa dang mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid la med pa zhes don go bas de gnyis las gang yang rung ba gnyi ga bstan par brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa dang mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid la med pa zhes don go bas de gnyis las gang yang rung ba gnyi ga bstan par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because the meaning is understood, ‚Äúexisting in only that which is similar and not existing in that which is not similar,‚Äù either one of the two is stated.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa mi 'khrul ba 'di 'dra ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa mi 'khrul ba 'di 'dra ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med par mi 'grub bo //
translated: Thus, this kind of nonerroneous contrapositive is not established without a positive concomitance.

original: grub na ni nan gyis rjes su 'gro ba 'gug par byed do //
analyzed: grub na ni nan gyis rjes su 'gro ba 'gug par byed do //
translated: If it were established, then one would be forced to accept a positive concomitance.

original: de dgag pa bkag pa'i ngo bo ni sgrub pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmthun pa'i phyogs med pa las ldog pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid la med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dgag pa bkag pa'i ngo bo ni sgrub pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las ldog pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid la med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Because the nature of the negation of the negation is the nature of the affirmation.üîΩIf you say that it is because of the contrapositive of the absence of the similar class that there is the absence in that which is not the similar class,

original: med ces ldog pa de nyid med pa las ldog pa ji ltar 'dod /
analyzed: med ces ldog pa de nyid med pa las ldog pa ji ltar 'dod /
translated: then how could you assert that the contrapositive of absence is the contrapositive of nonexistence?

original: med pa bkag pa dngos po ni med pa yang yod la dngos po bkag pa ni mi srid do zhes bya ba ni lha rnams dga' ba shes rab 'khrul pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa bkag pa dngos po ni med pa yang yod la dngos po bkag pa ni mi srid do zhes bya ba ni lha rnams dga' ba shes rab 'khrul pa med pa yin te /
translated: This is the delight of the gods, the non-erroneous wisdom.

original: yul de la dgag pa mi 'dod pa dang yod pa ma yin pa dang dngos po med pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa tha snyad byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yul de la dgag pa mi 'dod pa dang yod pa ma yin pa dang dngos po med pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa tha snyad byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning: ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù is a term used for what is not desired to be refuted, what does not exist, and what is non-existent.

original: don 'di ni med pa la med ces bya ba de'i nang du bsal zin pa des na 'dir mi spro'o //
analyzed: don 'di ni med pa la med ces bya ba de'i nang du bsal zin pa des na 'dir mi spro'o //
translated: Since this meaning has already been included in the term ‚Äúnon-existence,‚Äù it is not elaborated here.

original: yod pa'i sgrub byed 'jug pa'i phyir bdag med pa ni ma yin gyi the tshom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i sgrub byed 'jug pa'i phyir bdag med pa ni ma yin gyi the tshom du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the proof of existence is engaged, it is not non-self, but becomes doubtful.

original: gzhan gyi de ltar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi de ltar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes na /
translated: If it is said that it is because of the other‚Äôs acceptance of it as such,

original: khas blangs pa tshad ma ma yin pa las de ltar ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa tshad ma ma yin pa las de ltar ba yang ma yin te /
translated: acceptance is not valid cognition, and it is not like that.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: lhas blangs pa'i stobs kyis mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gzhag nas ched ma 'jug par ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: lhas blangs pa'i stobs kyis mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gzhag nas ched ma 'jug par ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to posit the concordant and discordant sides by the power of the gods, and then to not engage in the thesis.

original: de lta na ni bdag lung gis grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni bdag lung gis grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were so, then the self would be established by scripture,

original: rjes su dpag pas grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not established by inference.

original: de'i phyir bdag the tshom za bas mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las ldog pa med kyang srog la sogs pa ldog par the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag the tshom za bas mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las ldog pa med kyang srog la sogs pa ldog par the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because of doubt about the self, even though there is no concordant side, there is doubt about the reversal of life, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang ldog pa the tshom za ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang ldog pa the tshom za ste /
translated: For that very reason, there is doubt about the reversal of the discordant side,

original: gcig la nges par grub na gzhan la ldog par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la nges par grub na gzhan la ldog par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it were established in one, it would be established in the other.

original: de lta ma yin na mthong ba 'ga' zhig la med par grub kyang ma mthong ba rnams la the @225b tshom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mthong ba 'ga' zhig la med par grub kyang ma mthong ba rnams la the @225b tshom du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, even though nonexistence is established in some things that are seen, there would be doubt about those that are not seen.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba'i bye brag mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin pa'i don yang de'i rigs pa can 'ga' zhig la srid pa mthong ste //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba'i bye brag mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin pa'i don yang de'i rigs pa can 'ga' zhig la srid pa mthong ste //
translated: Thus, we see that the meaning of ‚Äúpervasion‚Äù is not applicable to all particular cases of ‚Äúclarity.‚Äù

original: dper na sra ba la mtshon gyis mi chod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sra ba la mtshon gyis mi chod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, ‚Äúhardness‚Äù is not invariably concomitant with ‚Äúnot being cut by a weapon.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir yang the tshom nyid do //
analyzed: 'gal ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir yang the tshom nyid do //
translated: And because there is no perception of contradiction, there is doubt.

original: bdag med pa dang srog la sogs pa bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba ma grub pa'i phyir bdag med pa las ldog par the tshom za'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang srog la sogs pa bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba ma grub pa'i phyir bdag med pa las ldog par the tshom za'o //
translated: Since there is no establishment of a contradiction with the characteristics of selflessness, etc., as already explained, there is doubt about the negation of selflessness.

original: srog la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu'am bdag nyid kyis bdag la nges pa yin na bdag med pa dang lhan cig 'gal bar 'gyur na de ni ma grub po zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu'am bdag nyid kyis bdag la nges pa yin na bdag med pa dang lhan cig 'gal bar 'gyur na de ni ma grub po zhes bshad zin to //
translated: If the soul, etc., were the effect or the nature of the self, then it would be contradictory to selflessness, but it has been shown that this is not established.

original: srog la sogs pa bdag med pa las ldog pa dang / de yod pa bdag med par ldog tu chug pa de lta na yang bdag med pa med pas gson po'i lus bdag dang bcas par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa bdag med pa las ldog pa dang / de yod pa bdag med par ldog tu chug pa de lta na yang bdag med pa med pas gson po'i lus bdag dang bcas par mi 'grub po //
translated: Even if it were possible that the soul, etc., were the negation of selflessness and that its existence were the negation of selflessness, still, because of the nonexistence of selflessness, it would not be established that the living body has a self.

original: gang gis na bdag med pa med pas bdag yod par 'gyur bas 'di ldog pa med pa dngos por 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis na bdag med pa med pas bdag yod par 'gyur bas 'di ldog pa med pa dngos por 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But since the non-existence of self is not non-existent, the self would exist. Therefore, this is not the case that the existence of the self is not refuted.

original: dper na ldog pa med kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la srog la sogs pa mi 'dod pa bzhin no //üîΩgal te gtan tshigs mthun phyogs las //
analyzed: dper na ldog pa med kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la srog la sogs pa mi 'dod pa bzhin no // gal te gtan tshigs mthun phyogs las //
translated: For example, although there is no refutation, life, etc. are not accepted in the similar instance.üîΩIf the reason does not differ

original: ldog med de phyir rjes 'gro can //
analyzed: ldog med de phyir rjes 'gro can //
translated: from the similar instance, then it is concomitant.

original: gal te ldog med rjes 'gro min //
analyzed: gal te ldog med rjes 'gro min //
translated: If the reason does not differ, it is not concomitant.

original: bdag med ma yin bdag bcas min //
analyzed: bdag med ma yin bdag bcas min //
translated: It is neither non-self nor endowed with self.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is a summarizing verse.

original: gal te srog la sogs pa yod pas bdag med pas ldog pa'i phyir bdag rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te srog la sogs pa yod pas bdag med pas ldog pa'i phyir bdag rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If the self is not understood because of the non-existence of self, since life, etc. do not differ,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: srog la sogs pa ni bsgrub pa'i sgo kho na nas bdag rtogs par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni bsgrub pa'i sgo kho na nas bdag rtogs par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Life, etc. are understood to be the self only through the door of proof.

original: de ni bdag med pa las ldog pa la 'bras bu ci yod /
analyzed: de ni bdag med pa las ldog pa la 'bras bu ci yod /
translated: Then what is the result of the non-existence of self not differing?

original: de de la mi srid pas rang yod na de med par sgrub par byed pa'i phyir de las ldog pa can du brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de de la mi srid pas rang yod na de med par sgrub par byed pa'i phyir de las ldog pa can du brjod pa yin te /
translated: Since that is impossible, it is said to be the opposite of that, because it proves that when this exists, that does not exist.

original: de lta ma yin na bdag med pa las ldog pa bdag 'grub pa la ci phan /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bdag med pa las ldog pa bdag 'grub pa la ci phan /
translated: Otherwise, how could the opposite of selflessness, that is, a self, be established?

original: yang na bdag nyid nges par ma grub pa'i srog la sogs pas bdag ji ltar sgrub ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid nges par ma grub pa'i srog la sogs pas bdag ji ltar sgrub ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Or else, it should be said that how could a self be established by a life-force, etc., that is not itself established?

original: de lta na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would follow, absurdly, that anything could prove anything.

original: de bas na srog la sogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa nyid do //üîΩgzhal bya nyid thun @226a * //
analyzed: de bas na srog la sogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa nyid do // gzhal bya nyid thun @226a * //
translated: Therefore life-force, etc., are not uncommon and nonestablished.

original: mong ba yang 'dus ma byas la skur pa'i med pa la rjes su 'gro ba mi rung ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa med pa mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa yin pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs su smra'o //
analyzed: mong ba yang 'dus ma byas la skur pa'i med pa la rjes su 'gro ba mi rung ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa med pa mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa yin pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs su smra'o //
translated: The object of comprehension is common, but since it is not suitable to follow a nonexistence that is a negation of the uncompounded, the unmistaken pervasion exists only in the similar class, and therefore it is said that the reason is one that possesses the pervasion.

original: de la yang ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med pa'am /
analyzed: de la yang ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med pa'am /
translated: In that case, how could it not be the opposite of the dissimilar class?

original: ji ltar mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa yin /
translated: How could it exist in a similar instance?

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid rnam par bcad pa ma yin na nges par gzung ba 'di'i 'bras bu ci yin /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid rnam par bcad pa ma yin na nges par gzung ba 'di'i 'bras bu ci yin /
translated: If it does not exclude existence in a dissimilar instance, what is the point of this restrictive statement?

original: rnam par gcod na yang ji ltar mi ldog ste /
analyzed: rnam par gcod na yang ji ltar mi ldog ste /
translated: But if it does exclude it, how can it not be reversed?

original: ldog pa ni yod pa rnam par bcad pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa ni yod pa rnam par bcad pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because reversal is nothing other than the exclusion of existence.

original: rjes su 'gro ba yang ma yin la ldog pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba yang ma yin la ldog pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal ba yang yin te /
translated: It is contradictory to say that it is neither positive nor negative.

original: med do zhes rjes su 'gro ba dgag pa gang yin pa de nyid ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med do zhes rjes su 'gro ba dgag pa gang yin pa de nyid ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation of positive concomitance is itself reversal.üîΩThis is the same as saying that it is not tenable that it is reversed from nonexistence.

original: de ni med pa las ldog pa mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di nyid yang 'ongs pa yin pas ji ltar med pa la rjes su 'gro ba dgag ces 'dir yang de nyid brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni med pa las ldog pa mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di nyid yang 'ongs pa yin pas ji ltar med pa la rjes su 'gro ba dgag ces 'dir yang de nyid brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since this is the same as saying that it is not tenable that it is reversed from nonexistence, it should be stated here that it is not tenable that it is concomitant with nonexistence.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin 'phen pa'i dgag pa med pa la mi srid kyang ma yin par dgag pa gcig pu ni dgag pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin 'phen pa'i dgag pa med pa la mi srid kyang ma yin par dgag pa gcig pu ni dgag pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: The absence of a negation that imputes the nature of an entity is impossible, but a mere negation is not the object of negation.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: med par dgag pa yang yin la de ni med pa la'ang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: med par dgag pa yang yin la de ni med pa la'ang mi 'gal lo //
translated: It is an external negation, and that is not inconsistent with nonexistence.

original: gzhi la sogs pa'i don can dgag pa'i yul ston pa'i rnam par dbye ba rnams dang mi ldan pa'i phyir de yang mi srid do zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi la sogs pa'i don can dgag pa'i yul ston pa'i rnam par dbye ba rnams dang mi ldan pa'i phyir de yang mi srid do zhe na /
translated: Because it is not endowed with the divisions that reveal the object of negation, such as the basis, etc., that also is impossible.

original: 'di la len btab zin to //
analyzed: 'di la len btab zin to //
translated: This has already been answered.

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no reason at all called ‚Äúpervasion.‚Äù

original: gzhal bya nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And the property of the position is not endowed with pervasion in the discordant side,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga la brten pa'i chos rnam pa gsum zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga la brten pa'i chos rnam pa gsum zhes bshad zin to //
translated: because it has been explained that there are three kinds of properties that rely on an entity, a nonentity, or both.

original: med pa la ni chos 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: med pa la ni chos 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
translated: But there is no property at all in a nonentity.

original: chos dang bral ba de nyid de'i chos ma yin na /
analyzed: chos dang bral ba de nyid de'i chos ma yin na /
translated: If that which is devoid of the dharma is not that dharma,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid ni chos ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid ni chos ma yin te /
translated: then the intrinsic reality of things is not the dharma.

original: med du zin kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis de'i tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: med du zin kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis de'i tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: Even though it does not exist, some make the convention of it.

original: de lta ma @226b yin na ni de la tha snyad med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma @226b yin na ni de la tha snyad med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then there would be no convention of it.

original: don dam par ni yod pa la yang chos dang chos can gyi dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni yod pa la yang chos dang chos can gyi dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate, even if something exists, there is no dharma or dharmin at all.

original: 'brel pa 'di dag ni blos bkod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes rnam 'grel du bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'di dag ni blos bkod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes rnam 'grel du bshad zin to //
translated: As has been explained in the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika, these relations are only posited by the mind.üîΩIf the relation is mentally constructed, then how can it be refuted in the case of non-existent things?

original: 'brel pa blos byas pa ni med pa la yang gang gis bzlog / de dang de ma yin pa'i brda can rnams kyis yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rnam par gnas pa sgrub par byed pa ma nges pas gcig tu nges par 'dzin
analyzed: 'brel pa blos byas pa ni med pa la yang gang gis bzlog / de dang de ma yin pa'i brda can rnams kyis yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rnam par gnas pa sgrub par byed pa ma nges pas gcig tu nges par 'dzin
translated: Since the establishment of the existence, nonexistence, and both of those by those who use the conventions of ‚Äúthat‚Äù and ‚Äúnot that‚Äù is indeterminate, one cannot

original: par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: grasp them as determined.

original: de'i phyir med pa nges par byed pa des de ji ltar yang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa nges par byed pa des de ji ltar yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, how could that which ascertains nonexistence ascertain existence?üîΩ

original: gzhal byar brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhal byar brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which ascertains non-existence is a means of valid cognition, and non-existence is a cognizable object, in whatever way.

original: dngos po'i yul can nyid ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i yul can nyid ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: A means of valid cognition is not a subject of an existent object,

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the definition of a means of valid cognition is non-deceptive.

original: de ni gal te rang gi yul la gnod pa med na yod pa dang med pa de'i ngo bor 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gal te rang gi yul la gnod pa med na yod pa dang med pa de'i ngo bor 'jog pa yin no //
translated: If it is not contradicted with regard to its object, then existence and non-existence are posited as its nature.

original: de bas na 'di la tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yod pas med pa gzhal bya yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yod pas med pa gzhal bya yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it has the definition of a means of valid cognition, non-existence is a cognizable object.

original: gal te thams cad rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar yod pa'i phyir 'ga' yang dngos po med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar yod pa'i phyir 'ga' yang dngos po med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that nothing is a non-existent thing, because everything exists in some way,

original: de dag gis ji ltar med pa'i rnam pa de dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ji ltar med pa'i rnam pa de dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: then how is the aspect of non-existence a non-existent thing?üîΩThose who ridicule the statement that the horn of a rabbit does not exist because the rabbit and the horn exist,

original: ri bong dang rva dag yod pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva med par smra ba la bzhad gad byed pa de ni bdag nyid la bzhad gad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ri bong dang rva dag yod pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva med par smra ba la bzhad gad byed pa de ni bdag nyid la bzhad gad byed pa yin no //
translated: ridicule themselves.

original: ri bong gi yan lag tu gyur pa'i rva med do zhes brjod pa la ri bong dang rva yang yod do zhes bya ba'i lan gyi skabs ci zhig yod /
analyzed: ri bong gi yan lag tu gyur pa'i rva med do zhes brjod pa la ri bong dang rva yang yod do zhes bya ba'i lan gyi skabs ci zhig yod /
translated: When it is said that the horn that is a part of the rabbit does not exist, what opportunity is there to reply, ‚ÄúThe rabbit and the horn exist‚Äù?

original: gang gis gnod par 'gyur ba de rva tsam la bsnyon pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis gnod par 'gyur ba de rva tsam la bsnyon pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The horn alone is not denied, but rather that which would be harmed by it.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: ri bong dang 'brel pa can no //
analyzed: ri bong dang 'brel pa can no //
translated: It is that which is connected to the rabbit.

original: gal te de lta na 'brel pa med ces brjod par bya ba'i rva ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'brel pa med ces brjod par bya ba'i rva ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it should be said that the horn is not connected to anything, since it does not exist.

original: ci rva can rnams kyis rva la 'brel pa tsam khyad par yod kyi rdzas kyi rang bzhin ma yin nam /
analyzed: ci rva can rnams kyis rva la 'brel pa tsam khyad par yod kyi rdzas kyi rang bzhin ma yin nam /
translated: But do those who have horns not have a mere connection to horns, and is that not the nature of substance?

original: rang bzhin yang tha dad de 'bras bu so so la rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir 'brel pa med ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di @227a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin yang tha dad de 'bras bu so so la rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir 'brel pa med ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di @227a * //
translated: The nature of substance is different, because the nature of the cause is different for each effect.

original: ga la yod /
analyzed: ga la yod /
translated: Therefore, how can this objection be raised: ‚ÄúIt should be said that there is no connection‚Äù?

original: gal te rva can rnams kyi rva rang bzhin tha dad pa de bzhin du ri bong gi rva rang bzhin tha dad pa ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rva can rnams kyi rva rang bzhin tha dad pa de bzhin du ri bong gi rva rang bzhin tha dad pa ni med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the horns of horned animals are different in nature from the horns of hornless animals, but the horns of a rabbit are not different in nature from a rabbit,

original: kho bo yang de nyid smra'o //
analyzed: kho bo yang de nyid smra'o //
translated: we agree.

original: yang na med pa'i phyir dgag par bya ba'i 'brel pa gang yin pa de nyid dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na med pa'i phyir dgag par bya ba'i 'brel pa gang yin pa de nyid dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: Or else, since it does not exist, the relation of the object of negation is itself a non-entity.

original: 'brel pa can yod pa la 'brel pa med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi tshul yang brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa can yod pa la 'brel pa med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi tshul yang brtags pa yin no //
translated: The rule of grammar that ‚Äúa relation does not exist when the relata exist‚Äù is also a fiction.

original: khas blangs pa'i 'brel pa can gyi rdzas kyang med do zhe na /
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i 'brel pa can gyi rdzas kyang med do zhe na /
translated: And the substance that is the related term of the relation that you accept does not exist.

original: 'dod pa bsgrubs te /
analyzed: 'dod pa bsgrubs te /
translated: We agree.

original: gal te 'di nyid dang por brjod na nyon mongs par mi bya ba zhig go //
analyzed: gal te 'di nyid dang por brjod na nyon mongs par mi bya ba zhig go //
translated: If you had stated this at the beginning, we would not have been troubled.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can yang the tshom gyi rgyur bshad na de 'dir ma bshad de rjes su dpag pa'i yul mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can yang the tshom gyi rgyur bshad na de 'dir ma bshad de rjes su dpag pa'i yul mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We have explained that a contradiction that is non-erroneous is a cause of doubt. But we do not explain that here, because it is impossible for it to be the object of inference.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag gam /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag gam /
translated: The nature and effect that have the characteristics explained above are the two kinds of reason.

original: mi dmigs pa la ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can mi srid la /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can mi srid la /
translated: But it is impossible for a nonobservation to be a nonerroneous reason that contradicts the probandum.

original: mi 'khrul ba can gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: mi 'khrul ba can gzhan ni med do //
translated: And there is no other nonerroneous reason.

original: de'i phyir dngos po ma mthong ba'i stobs kyis zhugs pa lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa la brten te de'i don dpyod pa na 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can bsgrub pa'i skyon du bshad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ma mthong ba'i stobs kyis zhugs pa lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa la brten te de'i don dpyod pa na 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can bsgrub pa'i skyon du bshad de /
translated: Therefore, when one analyzes the meaning of a scripture that is based on inference and that is engaged by the power of not seeing a thing, one is at fault if one posits a reason that is a nonerroneous contradiction of the meaning of the scripture.

original: bstan bcos byed pa rnams ni 'khrul bas don rnams la rang bzhin log par ston pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa rnams ni 'khrul bas don rnams la rang bzhin log par ston pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the authors of treatises may err and may present the nature of things incorrectly.
